loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.  Violita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Violita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Violita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 year old a married woman with four children all of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for two year.
Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père d deux enfants dont un fréquente l'école primaire.Il tient une cantine au marché et propose à ses clients des habits pour hommes et dames.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de son commerce et parvient à subvenir à ses propres besoins. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 200000f afin d'acheter des vétements à l'occasion des fètes de fin d'année. Son ambition est d'acheter une voiture pour faciliter ses déplacements.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man and the father of 2 children, one of whom goes to primary school. He manages a small booth at the market where he sells clothes for men and women. He supports himself and his family thanks to the income generated by this business. In order to strengthen his business, he is applying for a 200 000f loan from UIMCEC so he can buy clothes for the holiday season. His ambition is to buy a car so he can be more mobile.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 31 years old, married, with one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living, and has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business to  wholesale in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dúo Santo Domingo Group

texts.es: Dúo Santo Domingo Este dúo está conformado por Yovani de 30 años de edad es originario de Sumpango, es casado y tiene un hijo Yovani es propietario de una cafetería  que está ubicado en el centro del municipio de donde son originarios, necesita un crédito ya que necesita comprar mesas y bancos pues le ampliaron el local y no puede desaprovechar esa oportunidad, el promete cumplir con los pagos correspondientes de cada fecha asignada, así como también agradece la oportunidad que kiva le brinda.
texts.en: One of the members of the communal bank "Dúo Santo Domingo" is 30-year-old Yovani, who comes from Sumpango. He's married and has a son. Yovani owns a coffee shop which is located in the centre of the town where they come from. He needs a loan because he needs to purchase tables and stools, since his business venue has been expanded and he can't let this opportunity go to waste. He pledges to make the repayments on each assigned deadline. He's also thankful for the opportunity that Kiva is providing him with.

loans.use: to purchase furnishings for a coffee shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his printing business.

loans.name: Unah

texts.en:
Unah is 30 years old. Unah has been selling gada-gado (vegetable dishes) for a living but would also like to sell mambo ices (popsicles), kitchen spices and also various fried foods. The loan that she requested from MBK for $50, will be used entirely to buy the materials for making ices and the different kinds of vegetables needed to make gado-gado. Now Unah can raise her income.

Translated from Indonesian by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To help buy her food ingredients

loans.name: Rokhatoy

texts.en:
Rokhatoy is a pharmacist with a lot of experience. Previously, she worked in a government drugstore, and then she decided to start her own business. She started her business from the market. Now she has purchased a premise for her drugstore.
Rokhatoy has many clients from the neighboring country of Kirgystan (the border is near to their place). They have friendly relations, which contributes to international co-operation. Now her clients have asked her to open a wedding salon on her other premise. She plans to use her next loan for design and dresses for the wedding salon. 

As for her family, Rokhatoy has 3 children and 8 grandchildren. Her eldest daughter’s marriage was not successful. She is a teacher and, unfortunately, her husband is a drug addict and she had to leave him. Now Rokhatoy helps her daughter and her grandchildren.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Acira Ismael

texts.pt:
Ácira Ismael T. was born on 06/01/80 in Maputo. She lived for 5 years in Alto Mae, later she had to move with an aunt in Xai Xai. There she completed her primary schooling, and returned to Maputo. When she was 12 years old she continued studying and finished secondary school. Her life has not been easy. She became pregnant when she was 17, that was when she decided she had to work for herself and the child. Acira went to work for a beauty salon where she also apprenticed. She saved enough money to buy a small house with the help of her father.

She learned about LHUVUKU through one of her clients. With the loan of 15.000,00 she plans on paying off her house and expanding her small business. Her work has a positive impact in the community because it brings the service closer to men and women in her community. After paying off this loan, Gilda plans on requesting another one in order to open another location.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Ácira Ismael T. Tarmamade Actividade: comércio Valor do empréstimo:15.000.00 (600.00US$) Aplicação do empréstimo-compra de produtos de beleza Início: 10/07/07 Fim : 31/08/08 Ácira Ismael T. Tarmamade nascida em 06/01/80 em Maputo.nasceu e viveu ate aos 5 anos no bairro do Alto Maé onde depois foi obrigada a ir morar com uma tia na cidade de Xai-Xai quando seus pais separaram. Fez o ensino Primário do 1ºgrau na cidade de Xai-xai , voltou a cidade de Maputo com apenas 12 anos onde continuo com os estudos fez o 2º grau. A sua vida foi muito deficil por essa razão acabou engravidando com apenas 17 anos e foi obrigada a trabalhar cedo porque apartir daquela altura gerava se uma nova vida dentro dela e que era necessário trabalhar para o seu sustento assim como da crianca que viria a nascer. E o seu 1º emprego foi no salão de beleza ideal onde aprendeu a trabalhar graças a bondade da patroa.

Assim sendo foi trabalhando neste salão onde foi fazendo pequenas economias ate que no principio deste ano conseguiu um pequeno imóvel com ajuda do pai. Conheceu a LHUVUKU atravéz duma cliente sua que é gestora de crédito tendo lhe explicado todos os procedimentos para acesso ao crédito. Com o crédito dos 15.000.00 pretendia concluir o pagamento do imóvel e ampliar o seu negócio. Com ampliação do negócio abriu mais dois postos de trabalho, a sua actividade tem um impacto bastante positivo na cumunidade porque é responsavel pelos bons cuidados da aparencia femenina assim como masculina. No entanto após a conclusão do empréstimo pretende solicitar mais um empréstimo para abrir mais um salão.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her salon

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a small farmer and producer of cheese. His wife helps him selling the cheese, potatoes and chuño which they make themselves. From these activities they derive their main income with which they cover the family's expenses.

He lives in the Caluyo de Batallas Community (two hours away from La Paz City).

The credit will be used to purchase a milk cow of medium breed to increase the production of milk and make a greater quantity of cheese.

This is his second credit with Impro; the first credit was given to him in December 2006 for $150 and to date it's completely repaid. His payment history and the evaluation realized qualifies him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Mario es pequeño agricultor y productor de queso; la esposa ayuda comercializando los quesos, papa y chuño que producen ellos mismos y de estas actividades derivan los ingresos principales con que cubren la manutención de su familia. Vive en la Comunidad de Caluyo de Batallas (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y producir mayor cantidad de queso. Es el Segundo crédito con Impro; el primer crédito fue concedido en Diciembre de 2006 por $150 y a la fecha esta completamente pagado. Su historial de pagos y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchasing of a milk cow

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi A. was born on 17 July 1966 and lives in Lomé. He is married with six (06) children of his own, and also takes care of his older brother's two (02) children. After his secondary education, he started an apprenticeship as an auto mechanic. Currently he is a master mechanic and has complete command of his business, and his work is without reproach, which only serves to increase his clientele. To strengthen his business, he is asking for a loan of $1000, which he will use to build a garage.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kossi est née le 17 Juillet 1966 et réside à Lomé, Il est marié et père de six (06) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) enfants de son grand frère. Après les études secondaires il entre en apprentissage de la mécanique auto. Aujourd’hui il est maître mécanicien et a une parfaite maîtrise de ses activités et ses prestations sont sans reproche, ce qui ne fait qu’augmenter sa clientèle. Pour renforcer ses activités, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui servir de construire un garage.

loans.use: To build a garage

loans.name: Tarsih

texts.en: Tarsih is 38 years old, and a mother of a child aged 15. She has a small shop that sells snacks, and some household goods. She usually earns US $5.50 per day with a small profit. Her husband, M., works at a repair shop but does not have a regular income. Tarsih requests a loan to buy more goods to fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Octaviana

texts.en:
Octaviana is a mother of four children, two boys and two girls, which will soon go to university.  She is a very persistent woman that has been running a small cafeteria in her community for one year.  She produces an assortment of delicious sandwiches, hot dogs, empanadas and juices in the morning.  For lunch, she serves traditional Dominican meals such as moro, which is a mixture of rice and beans.  Her cafeteria is well visited and people who go to eat there once generally return. 
Octaviana wants to make a good income to keep on supporting her children's studies.  With this loan, she will purchase raw materials such as fresh bread, butter, vegetable oil, ketchup, spices, rice and beans so she can keep on preparing delectable meals for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to continue food production for a small cafeteria

loans.name: Lutfiah

texts.id:
With the knowledge to make sandals, Lutfiah started to make Mote Sandals to finance her family and to send her two children to school. She buys her material at shop which sell raw materials for making sandals. She also teach this skills to her other relative, so that they are also able to make the sandals. After collecting all the sandals, she distributes them to shops around Bali. Her husband handles the distribution. She hopes that they will not be any bombing cases like before that had dampen her sales.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan berbekal keahlian dalam membuat sandal, Lutfiah memulai usahanya menjadi pengepul sandal mote. Usaha ini ditekuninya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan juga menyekolahkan kedua anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah. Lutfiah membeli bahan-bahan baku untuk pembuatan sandal disalah satu toko yang memang menjual bahan-bahan dasar untuk pembuatan sandal tersebut. Keahliannya diajarkan kepada tetangganya dengan tujuan agar mereka juga bisa mengerjakan hal yang sama dan setelah jadi dikumpulkan di tempatnya dan Lutfiah yang menyalurkannya kepada toko-toko atau art shop-artshop yang ada di Bali. Untuk bagian penjualan ke toko-toko dan artshop di tangani oleh suaminya. Harapannya supaya tisdak ada lagi kasus bom yang seperti waktu lalu yang mematikan pemasaran sendalnya.

loans.use: buying materials to make sandals -  untuk membeli bahan-bahan pembuatan sendal

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is married with 4 children.  She sells plastic sandals in the market of Makeni town in Sierra Leone. She was retailing the sandals, but after her previous loans from SMT, she increased her stock and now sells on wholesale.  She would like to expand her business and is, therefore, requesting a loan of $1200.  Salamatu is 36 years old.

loans.use: Salamatu is a wholesaler of shoes and sandals in the Makeni market.  She needs additional capital to be able to purchase her goods in bulk for wholesaleing.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Jhony and her aunt Thania make the perfect team for making crafts and sewing. Both are originally from Arequipa, but currently live in Juliaca for academic and professional reasons. Since Jhony was a little girl, her aunt Thania has taught her this wonderful craft and, with lots of patience and diligence, has cultivated her talents. The two of them have decided to offer classes to anyone who wants to learn the art of crafts. Jhony is able to pay for her college studies doing this work and Thania uses the income to support her household. They both hope to continue making their beautiful and distinctive crafts. To to do this, they are applying for a loan which they will use to purchase the materials they require for their work. With the essential support you provide, Jhony and her aunt will continue on the road to progress.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Jhony y su querida tía Thania son el equipo perfecto para las manualidades y la costura, ambas son naturales del departamento de Arequipa, por cuestiones de estudio y trabajo radican en la ciudad de Juliaca.Desde muy pequeña Jhony aprendió este bello oficio de su querida tía, quien con mucha paciencia y diligencia cultivó sus conocimientos en ella, y ahora ambas en sociedad decidieron ofrecer cursos de manualidades a todas aquellas personas que desean aprender este hermoso arte.Gracias a este trabajo Jhony logra cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de sus estudios superiores y por su parte su querida tía cubre plenamente las necesidades de su hogar.El deseo de ambas es seguir realizando sus hermosos y distintivos trabajos, es por ello que solicitan un préstamo que invertirán en la compra de indispensables materiales para su trabajo.Con tu imprescindible apoyo Jhony y su querida tía seguirán por el camino del progreso.

loans.use: Purchase of greater number of raw materials to continue craftmaking and sewing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Born in 1946, Mama A. Mary was forced to get married at the age of 15 years to Mr. Maricus A., who was three times older than Mary, because her parents couldn't pay her school fees or meet her basic needs. She and her husband had nine children. Life was difficult. She couldn't provide for her family, pay school fees, or complete the building of their home. In 2002, she decided to join GHAPE to improve her life. Since then she has received and repaid four loans from GHAPE.

Given a loan she plans to buy seeds and cassava for the production of water fufu. She thinks she will succeed because she has experience in this business and has a ready market in Bamenda urban center.

She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. The first installment is due on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and cassava

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.en: I. Gulizor is 47-years old. She is a widow and has two children: Suhrob, age 22, a student, and Gulandom age 19, who helps her mother with the business. Gulizor began selling clothing 10 years ago. Gulizor usually travels to Bishkek in the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan to purchase new goods. She tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices that keeps ger customers happy. Gulizor is requesting a loan of $600 for the term of 6 months. In the middle of the June, Gulizor plans her next trip to Bishkek. She will use the loan to purchase summer season clothes for women and children. This will enhance her sales and increase her income.She promises to pay the loan in time and thanks everyone for support.

loans.use: To purchase summer season clothes for women and children

loans.name: Salim Saleh

texts.en: Salim is a 46 year old resident of Chanika in the Dar Es Salaam area. He has been in business for the past 15 years. Recently he has run a small poultry farm, where he has up to 150 broilers and layers. He supplies eggs for the nearby restaurants. The profits have helped him put all his kids to school and build a new house. He is in need of a loan to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Judith's Tunda Group

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with 2 children who are 20 and 2 years old. She owns and operates a small shop which sells various household products and which was started in 2006. Every day, she works extremely hard from 6 am to 10 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $350 from her sales.

Judith now seeks a loan in order to buy more items for her business. Notably, she will share the loan proceeds with her subgroup members, Maua and Mwanaisha, who have their own businesses selling clothes.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by increasing her inventory (i.e., by purchasing additional items)

loans.name: Tinuke

texts.en:
Tinuke A. sells prayer items like candles, olive oil, and prayer books in her shop. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She is married, has 4 children, and she is 49 years old.

She has been a leader in a lending group for the past 3 years and she lives in Ajamgbadi Lagos state, Nigeria. Tinuke need a loan of $425 to buy more prayer materials for her business expansion and for profit growth. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more prayer items like olive oil, candles, and prayer books for sale

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago A. es mozo de profesión, luego había puesto un restaurante, siempre en lugares bien ubicado para eso, pero pagando arrendamientos, por lo que la ganancia no era tan buena.

Hace 10 años aproximadamente, se animo y abrió su despensa con mercerías y comidas por supuesto en su domicilio lo cual le resultó, ya que hoy esta floreciente su negocio y siempre atendido por el mismo.

El comercializa todo tipo de comestibles de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, harina, carnes, etc. además de comidas y algunos artículos de mercería.
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago A. is a waiter by profession, and he previously started a restaurant. It is located in a good area, but rent payments prevented him from earning enough. About ten years ago, Santiago decided to open a grocery store in his home, selling hardware and food. His store is now flourishing, and he always tends it himself. Santiago sells all types of food and basic goods such as sugar, oil, flour, meats, etc. as well as food and some hardware.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, drinks, milk products, and basic products, hardware products, and general merchandise

loans.name: Garden Of Hope Group

texts.en:
Garden of Hope is a support group based in Mombasa and affiliated to Coast General Hospital. It was formed by 15 members in 2008. Currently, membership has increased to 20. The group was formed with the following objectives:

1. Give moral and psychological support to members

2. Improve the welfare of members

3. Advocacy/speaking on issues affecting people living with HIV/Aids (PLWAs)

4. Advocating for economic empowerment of PLWAs.

Sixteen active members of the group have requested US $4000, each to receive US $250 to improve on their income generating activities as follows:

1. Rose N., who is 32 years old, needs the loan to buy poultry feed.

2. James M., a 43-year-old, runs a charcoal selling kiosk and needs a loan to increase stock of charcoal.

3. Jectone O., who is 37 years old, has applied for a loan to improve her cereal business.

4. Leornadus O., who is 36 years old and runs a food kiosk, requires the loan to buy stock of consumables for her food kiosk.

5. Zipporah K. is 28 years old. She requires the loan to increase her stock of new clothes for sale.

6. Joyce W. is 23 years old. She needs to buy stocks of rice for sale.

7. Metrice O. has applied for a loan to improve his tailoring business.

8. Joshua K., who runs retail kiosk, has applied for a loan to increase stock.

9. Jane W., a 23-year-old, needs the loan to improve her potato selling business

10. Webster I. is 34 years old and needs a loan to improve his vegetable stall business.

11. Mellin A. is 31 years old. She operates a telephone booth.

12. Joyce A. needs loan to increase her stock of charcoal.

13. Salim N. has applied for loan to buy stock of second hand clothes for sale.

14. Marren A., who runs a charcoal business, requires a loan to buy further stock of charcoal in bulk.

15. Meshack O. is the proprietor of a grocery stall. He has applied for a loan to improve his charcoal business.

16. Ruweda M. sells coconut products. She has applied for loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To improve and expand individual enterprises.

loans.name: Snat

texts.ru: Базаров Снат проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 23 года. Уже 5 лет занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. У него есть несколько голов животных , которых необходимо качественно кормить. Поэтому для этого, он решил закупить сено и комбикорм. Запас данной продукции даст возможность получить хорошо откормленных животных. Для этого он обратился к нам за получением кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Snat B. lives in the Bakhsh District. He is 23 years old. He has been raising livestock for five years. He has a few head of cattle, and they must have high quality feed. Because of that he decided to buy hay and pre-mixed complete feed. Having a stock of that feed will result in well finished animals. To do this he contacted us about receiving a loan. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete feed supply

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey C. is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Four of them attend secondary school, and one is married and lives away from home. Her husband, Chay Sokkom, is 35 years old and drives a motorcycle taxi.

Mrs. C. makes a living by selling chicken in the Pursat Market. She purchases chickens from a wholesale breeder that kills and plucks them, which she then sells at retail. Mrs. C. has applied for a loan to purchase additional chickens to resell and to purchase wood to fix up her house. The family resides in Svay Art Commune in the Pursat Province.

loans.use: Buy additional chickens to resell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Asha Y. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of 12 and 22 years old. Asha has been running a bun making and selling business since 2006. Buns are a delicious food and many people like them. People eat them with tea or juice during breakfast time. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Asha currently earns about 300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.  In the future, she plans to open a store. Asha thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El señor Abraham R. y su esposa la señora Perfecta Alemán tiene una hermosa familia que son dos hijos ya mayores de edad. Con un crédito anterior de FVP adquirió su vivienda, el cual pago puntual mente.
Don Abraham necesita realizarse unos estudios médicos pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar los estudios clínicos que necesita.  
Por el momento entres su esposa la señora Perfecta y sus hijos se están haciendo cargo de los gastos familiares y quienes lo van a poyote para esté crédito.
texts.en:
Abraham R. and his wife Perfecta Aleman have a beautiful family - they have two older children. With a prior loan from FVP, which he paid on time, he was able to acquire his home. Abraham needs to have some medical exams but does not have the necessary money to pay for the exams she needs. Currently, his wife Perfecta and his children are taking care of the household expenses. They will support him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont en majorité des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et  7 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, frères, sœurs et époux  dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU relevant de la préfecture de BAROUELI, région de SEGOU république du Mali.
Ce groupe fait essentiellement l’achat vente de céréales.
Dans le souci d’agrandir leur fonds de commerce, les femmes du groupe ont  décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt  elles comptent acheter,  850 kg de fonio, 300 kg de haricot et 1tonne 500kg de maïs dans le village de WEREKELA et environnants avec les producteurs et productrices de céréales pour être revendus au comptant aux grossistes de Fana. Leur clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  la prise en charge des dépenses des enfants.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Kotognonyala group are mostly married and are an average age of 36 with 7 children. They live in traditional family structures made up of their husbands, children, brothers and sisters in the village of Zanfina, located in the prefecture of Konobougou, adjacent to the prefecture of Baroueli, in the region of Segou, Republic of Mali. This group deals mainly in the sale of cereals. In the effort to increase their operating capital, this group of women decided to join the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance company, with which they are now taking out their fourth group loan.Their previous loans were all duly repaid. With this loan they plan to buy, 850 kg. of fonio (west African grain), 300 kg. of beans and 1,500 kg of corn in the village of Werekela and surrounding area. They will buy from the cereal farmers and resell for cash to the wholesalers in Fana. Their customers are made up of both men and women. With this loan they expect to make a profit of 35,000 Francs CFA which will be used to meet their children's expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat  de céréales.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 54 años, vive en su propia casa con sus 4 hijos mayores. Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, tanto nueva, como de segundo uso, Dominga realiza sola este trabajo motivada por la necesidad de generase mayores ingresos. Vende todos los domingos en la feria comercial de su localidad de manera ambulante, y disfruta de su actividad porque desde joven le gustó el comercio. Su negocio es rentable porque las prendas de vestir  siempre tienen demanda. Por ello Dominga está pensando acrecentar su negocio vendiendo también zapatos, además quiere acondicionar un espacio de su casa para tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus prendas o otros productos más. Es la cuarta vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, Dominga disfruta de cada reunión que realiza su banco comunal y promueve la solidaridad entre todos. El dinero que requiere lo usará en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa, en especial de chompas de lana para la próxima época de invierno.
texts.en:
Dominga is 54 years old. She lives in her own house with her four grown sons. For four years, she has sold second-hand clothing. Dominga was motivated to begin this business because she needed to generate more income. She sells every Sunday at the local market, as a roaming vendor. She enjoys her work because she has liked retail since she was young. Her business is profitable because her articles of clothing are always in demand. For this reason, Domingo is thinking about expanding her business to include selling shoes. In addition, she wants to renovate a space in her house where she can have a store from which to sell her articles of clothing or other products. It is her fourth time seeking a loan from MFP, and she has demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. Dominga enjoys all of her meetings with the communal bank, which promote solidarity among everyone. She will use her loan to purchase a larger quantity of clothing, especially wool sweaters for the coming winter.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her second-hand business

loans.name: Ivan Arnulfo

texts.es: el joven Ivan M. se dedica al negocio de transporte de personas en su taxi usando la ruta de barrio abajo - la sagastume, desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, tambien se dedica a dar clases de musica por las tardes en una escuela de la capital, es una persona bien comprometida con Dios. el necesita el credito para poder arreglar su unidad de trabajo y asi poder darles un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ivan M. works in transportation; he has driven his taxi along a route in the lower neighborhood of La Sagastume for approximately three years. He also teaches music classes in the afternoons in a school in the capital, and is very committed to God. Ivan needs a loan to fix his work vehicle, so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare motor parts

loans.name: Sirari Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sirari” esta representado por la señora Maria y conformada por 14 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta D. comida, ropa, pan, abarrotes y entre los varones se dedican a actividades como la sastrería, moto taxista, venta D. ladrillos y al servicio D. transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del ámbito D. la prestación D. servicios y el comercio existe mucha competencia donD. aquel que brinda un mejor servicio o un mejor producto es el que genera mayores ganancias; es por esta razón que el grupo adquiere el financiamiento para la compra D. insumos, herramientas y materiales para poner a la venta un producto D. calidad y brinda un servicio mas eficiente y D. calidad. Una mayoría D. los miembros va cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando cumplimiento y responsabilidad en los pagos efectuados demostrando ser capaces y con grandes expectativas D. crecimiento.
texts.en:
The Sirari group is represented by Maria and its 14 members operate businesses selling food, clothing, bread and groceries; the men work as tailors, cab drivers, brick salesmen and bus drivers. There is a lot of competition for the products and services offered by the group's businesses and the businesses that proviD. better products or services are the ones that generate the highest earnings. That's why the group acquired funding for the supplies, tools and materials they need to bring products of quality to market and to be able to proviD. the best, most efficient service. A majority of the members are starting a second lending cycle and have a history of repaying their loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Riva

texts.en:
Riva is 47 years old, and has been blessed with six children: Mary Ann, Ernie Mark, Magno A. Jr., Rose Ann, Sherry Ann, and Antonette. Her children are currently studying in college, high school and elementary school. Riva puts a lot of hard work into developing her snack vending business in order to support her children’s education. Her family lives happily in Barangay Centro 3 of Angadanan, Isabela.

Riva has been selling street food in front of her house in the village for almost four years. Her weekly net income from the business is around PHP 6,000.00 and it is used for her family’s needs, especially her children’s education. Riva would like a loan of PHP 6,000.00 from Kiva to develop her business further. The loan will help her purchase additional food to sell, satisfying her customers’ demands.

loans.use: To purchase additional food to sell

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Argentina R. López tiene 49 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo que con mucho esfuerzos ha logrado en le colegio. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, iniciando esta actividad para el bienestar familiar ya que como es madre soltera le ha tocado llevar toda la cargo de su hogar. El financiamiento es para aumentar el negocio y proveer de mejores recursos a su familia. a pesar de que vive de una manera humilde y con ganas de salir adelante sus sueños son de establecer un restaurante propio.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina R. López is 49. She is a single mother raising four children. With great effort she has put them in school. She sells clothes. She has been doing this for more than three years. She started the business for the well being of her family. Since she is a single mother, it falls on her to take care of her home. The loan is to expand her business and provide better resources to her family. In spite of the fact that she lives in a humble way, she has the desire to get ahead. She dreams of establishing her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Valeria es viuda, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Valeria tiene dos puestos uno propio y otro alquilado en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende zapatillas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Valeria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas.
Los sueños de Valeria son tener una tienda, comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Valeria is a member of the Village Bank The Seagulls. Valeria is a widow, she is 52 years old and has 4 kids. She has two booths, one her own and one rented in the market April 12th where she sells shoes, an activity she carries out with the help of her children. Valeria needs a 1000 soles loan that will be invested in the purchase of shoes. Valeria's dream is to have a store, to buy a plot of land and to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes cuenta con 25 años de edad, es una muchacha muy trabajadora, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos en la casa heredada por sus suegros. A los 15 años se convirtió en madre, pero a su vez en una mujer muy responsable, con su pequeña cargada en la espalda labraba la tierra de sus vecinos; juntamente con su esposo, a ella le pagaban 8 soles diarios y a su esposo 12 soles. Posteriormente se propusieron alquilar chacras y sembrar sus propios cultivos, iniciaron sembrando 764 m2 de papas, en ese entonces sus cosechas le resultaron muy buenas, permitiéndole acumular dinero que le sirvió para adquirir sus propios terrenos cultivables. Desde entonces siembra cada año papa y arveja; para ello, muy temprano por la mañana su esposo se adelanta a sus chacras y ella va luego con el almuerzo, muy contenta puesto que le agrada trabajar en sus cultivos. Mercedes está convencida de progresar mediante la agricultura, para ello quiere adquirir otros terrenos cultivables para evitar pagar alquiler. Mercedes es una nueva en MFP, se está incorporando a un banco comunal que ya va por décimo crédito. Por lo que hace compromisos de cumplir con cada una de sus cuotas, asimismo tiene muchos anhelos de empezar a juntar sus ahorros en su grupo. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus siembra de papas.
texts.en:
25-year old Mercedes is a hardworking woman. She lives with her partner and their three children in a house inherited from her parents-in-law. She became a mother at the age of 15--having a baby made her become a responsible woman. With her little daughter on her back she worked in the fields for her neighbours alongside her husband. She was paid 8 soles a day; he earned 12 soles. Later they decided to rent fields and grow their own crops, beginning with 764 m2 of potatoes. They had good harvests which allowed them to save enough money to buy their own land. Since then they have planted potatoes and peas every year. To achieve this Mercedes’ husband goes to their fields very early every morning, and she follows along soon afterwards with lunch, happy because she enjoys working the land. Mercedes is convinced that farming will enable them to get ahead; she wants to buy more arable land so they don’t have to spend money on renting it. As a new member of MFP (which incorporated as a community bank and is already on its tenth loan cycle), Mercedes has committed to repaying all loan instalments and is looking forward to saving together with the rest of her group. The loan will be used to buy chemical fertilizers to put on her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort H. sells African wear, such as beads and other African jewelry, at the Castle. Comfort has received a senior-high-school education. She is a single parent and has 4 dependents .Comfort has been selling beads and other African jewelry since 2003. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy more beads and other African jewelry to resell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more beads and other African jewelry to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new products to diversify his business

loans.name: K. Don Chirac

texts.fr: Ce monsieur s’est spécialisé dans le commerce D. prêt-à-porter dans sa petite boutique D. Kodjoviakopé à Lomé. Marié et père D. 02 enfants, il s’est lancé en 2007 dans le commerce D. prêt-à-porter pour dames ; cette activité lui permet donc D. subvenir aux besoins D. sa famille. Il reçoit ses commandes du Ghana mais aussi du Nigéria. Il a besoin d’un crédit D. WAGES pour commander 25 balles D. vêtements D. prêt-à-porter, pour renouveler son stock. Il a beaucoup D. clients D. la capitale et D. l’intérieur du pays.

loans.use: Achat de 25 bals de prêt à poter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his farm acreage to pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy C. is from the village of Tolon. She is 35 years old. Joy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Joy's husband works as a maintenance crew in one of the hotels in Dipolog City.  The family earns as little as 14,000 per month as their main source of living. Joy is also engage in Ready to Wear business which gave her a return of 500 Php per week. 

In 2006, Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services at Paglaum Coop. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Joy is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to finance her house repair activity. Little by little, she purchased some of the materials to start the house repair. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Joy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni C. sells for at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food. Poni is 45 years old and is widowed. She has three children who attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Increase food inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) and scarves

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B. is a 43 year old entrepreneur from Caloocan City. She lives with her husband and their six children: one is in college, two in high school, and the rest are in grade school.
 
For six years now, Lilibeth has been a successful dealer of eggs, cooking oil, and sugar to stores and stalls in their community market. Her business is brisk and has been growing continuously. Lilibeth earns more than P40,000.00 a month.

Lilibeth has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2007. The loans provided by the cooperative help her pursue her business. She is now on her seventh loan cycle as she applies for a new loan with the amount of P19,000.00, which she will use as additional capital.

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar and trays of eggs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años, 02 hijos 01 que aun depende de ella y le ayuda en sus ventas.

Martha, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Martha, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Martha, 38, is a member of the "La Marginal II" communal bank which is in Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has two children, one of whom still depends on her and helps her with her sales. Martha is a hard-working woman. She decided to set up her own soft-drink selling business in a well-apportioned area of her home. She administers her store with no boss nor schedule. She tells us that she began with 300 soles and bought 5 packages of soft-drinks. She saw that she did well and, little by little, started to invest more. Currently, she is in the same line of work and is well-known by her customers who are her neighbors, family members, and friends. With this 1500 sol loan she will buy more soft-drinks: packages of soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes, and brands, as well as mineral water, both sparkling and still. Martha has many goals ahead and is very motivated to see her dreams come true. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help. She is responsible with regard to repayments and intends to continue being so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old and married with two children. She is really dedicated to her work and supportive to her family. She owns and operates a clothing and jewelry shop in the local market. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support. She wants to use the loan to buy more clothing materials and assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. 

Martha hopes to raise more income this season to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty de 41 años, vive con sus  3 hijos, de los cuales sólo se encuentra con la pequeña Katherine de 1 año,juntas  habitan su  vivienda que es propia.Desde hace 21 años, todos los días se levanta al amanecer para preparar los alimentos que comercializa como son la papa rellena (papa sancochada y rellena con carne molida y huevo sancochado),y las mazamorras de maíz morado, durazno y de  calabaza; vende sus platillos en las calles de la ciudad donde vive, esta actividad la desempeña con la ayuda de su madre , a quien le gusta cocinar y ser exigente  con la preparación de los  alimentos para agradar a sus clientes; considera rentable su negocio porque con las ganancias que obtiene puede educar a sus dos hijos que se encuentran en la ciudad  en busca de un futuro mejor, como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado aperturar un establecimiento de comidas e incluso innovar en los platillos.Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas porque desea progresar en la vida.Para alcanzar sus objetivos invertirá el dinero del préstamo  en la compra de insumos al por mayor para preparar  los alimentos que comercializa, y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Betty is forty-one and lives with her three children, but is shown above with only little one-year-old Katherine. They live together in her house, which she owns. For the past twenty-one years she has gotten up early in the morning to make food to sell, including stuffed potatoes (boiled potatoes stuffed with ground meat and hard-boiled egg), and mazamorras (sweet pudding) made from purple corn, peaches, and pumpkin. She sells her dishes in the streets of the city she lives in, helped out by her mother, who likes to cook and does so with a discerning hand so her customers will be satisfied. It's a worthwhile business for Betty because she can use her profits to educate her two children, who are in the city in search of a better future. Being an enterprising woman, she has plans to open a food establishment, and even create new dishes. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments promptly because she wants to make progress with her life. In order to reach her goals she plans to invest her loan in purchasing ingredients for her meals wholesale so she can bring in higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients so she continue running her business

loans.name: Joyrisa

texts.en:
Joyrisa O. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joyrisa owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products such as shampoo, sugar, snack food, salt, noodles, etc. in the local community. Joyrisa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Joyrisa joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Julia es casada, tiene 60 años y 10 hijos, Julia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende crudo en el mismo lugar.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Julia sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía Communal Bank in the Comañía community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Julia is 60, married, and has ten children. Julia and her husband make bricks by hand in the Compañía community. They sell their product unprocessed in the same place. Julia needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy land. Julia dreams of building her house in the city of Ayacucho and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice M. is currently in the business of selling clothes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Joice is 32 years old. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build houses to rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth A. is from the village of Bangko, Panaon, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 51 years old. Ruth is the group leader for a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ruth is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing new clothing like blouses, skirts, pants etc. to local community members. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be Ruth's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Zareena wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mehraj wants a loan to buy quilts to sell. Rukhsana wants a loan to buy spare parts for motorbikes for her spare parts sales business. Parveen wants a loan to buy construction supplies (cement, bricks) to resell. Parveen is the group leader for the above-mentioned ladies. They all belong to a city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Parveen manages her cloth-selling business and she prepares embroidered clothes as well. Both businesses give her good earning which helps her to meet the family's expenses, together with her husband. She purchases the cloth from different areas such as “Ichra & Azam Market” because of its good quality stuff and cheap prices. 

Parveen's husband's name is M. B. and he is a driver, driving a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) belonging to someone else. At the end of the day he gives him Pak Rs. 300 which is the least amount that can feed his family. Therefore Parveen has decided to ask for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so he gets the full amount of his struggle and can manage the expenses.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Biyinzika Kabyuma Group Of Mubende

texts.en:
K. Richard has, over the last five years, been successfully plying his small retail business in Kibyamirizi in Mubende district. With a monthly net profit of 80,000 shillings, this 52-year-old married man has enjoyed the good graces that have come with running this lucrative business. Consequently he has made enormous progress in educating his eight children.

Richard’s first priority after acquiring this loan is to purchase more clothing stock with the sole objective of turning his business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more garments and other goods he deals in

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 44 years old and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately $300 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Fe decided to lower her loan request to 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 9th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nyame Ntese Odasani Group

texts.en:
Akua B. is a widow with eight children, all of whom are living with her. She retails maize and smoked fish and has been doing this for the last 10 years. She says her business has sustained her family ever since her husband died and she has been able to pay her children's school fees from the income generated. She hopes to support her children's education to a level that will enable them to find decent jobs. She hopes this dream comes to pass. 

The name 'Nyame Ntese Odasani' in our language literally means "God is not a Human Being". The group says they derive inspiration from the fact that God will never disappoint them. They have been together for some time and trade in the same market; as a result they trust each other for repayment. They trust that this loan will help them achieve the dream of expanding their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase bags of maize amd smoked fish

loans.name: Pola Marqueza

texts.es:
Pola Marqueza B. V. tiene 56 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene una hija, Doris, de 34 años.
Pola es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a 30 minutos del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura. 
Pola trabaja en la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de su familia. Los productos que más siembra son maíz y fréjol. En la casa, Pola se dedica a la costura.  Ella vende sus productos y también realiza sus compras en el mercado de San Miguel.
Pola solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y más productos para la agricultura. Piensa que el préstamo la ayudará a mejorar la condición económica de su familia.  Su meta es mejorar su vivienda, comprar semilla certificada para una mejor producción y para tener mejores precios. Los desafíos que ella enfrenta en la familia es la falta de dinero para comprar insumos y la falta de mano de obra.
Pola dice que las costumbres del cantón son las fiestas del Patrón San Miguel y sus carnavales. Como hobby, le gusta jugar Basket.
texts.en:
Pola Marqueza B. V., 56, is married and lives with her husband in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar province. She has a daughter, Doris, who is 34 years old. Pola is a member of the communal bank "Lotan Bajo," which is located 30 minutes from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members in all, and the majority of them work in agriculture. Pola works in agriculture to provide a source of income for her family. She cultivates corn and beans. In the house, Pola also does sewing work. She sells her products and also makes her purchases in the San Miguel market. Pola requests a loan to buy fertilizers and other products for agriculture. She thinks that this loan will help her to improve the economic situation of her family. Her goal is to improve their house, and to buy seed that is certified for better production so that she can get better prices for her products. The challenges she faces are the lack of money to buy supplies and a lack of labor. Pola says that the customs of her canton are the fiestas of Patrón San Miguel and their carnivals. As a hobby, she likes to play basketball.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other products for agriculture

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is married and has three children. She operates a shop where she virtually sells almost everything her customers request. She has received senior high education. Her husband is a mason.  Comfort uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more groceries for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to add to her working capital.

loans.use: purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Soribel is the coordinator of her group 'Emmanuel', and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally--many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Soribel is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and shoes by purchasing underwear, bras, high-heeled shoes, men's shoes and boxers for men to sell. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Underwear, bras, high-heeled shoes, men's shoes and boxers for men

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people are making a village bank president which located in Preaek Ta Mem village, Kandal province. Mrs. Hong B. is 45 years old and she is the village bank president having been selected by its members. With the loans, they hope to increase income to improve their family living.
Mrs. Hong B. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow peanuts for a living. Aside from farmer she is also pig breeder at home who can earn a small profit to support her family living. For pig breeding, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding. Mrs. Hong B. is widow with three children, one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other two are students and also support their mother businesses.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Luz Gladis

texts.es: La Sra. Luz tinene 58 años de edad es conviviente tiene 3 hijos 2 mayores de edad y uno de 12 años el cual esta  en el colegio estatal. Ellos viven en casa propia de material de abobe, su conyugue se dedica como obrero de campo. La Sra. Luz se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, viene realizando esta actividad mas de 5 años. La Sra. Luz tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es poder crecer en su negocio , con el dinero que solicita invertira en capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Luz is 58 years old. She has a live-in partner and 3 children. Two of her children are adults, and one is 12 years old and goes to a state school. They live in their own house made of adobe. Her partner works as a rural laborer. Luz dedicates herself to raising and selling pigs; she has done this work for more than 5 years. Luz has many dreams, and one of them is to expand her business. She will invest the funds she is requesting to provide working capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ayme Yanina

texts.es:
Ayme tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermano en el sector Huaca Partida, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace dos años. Ella nos comenta que aprendió del negocio de su madre y luego empezó a criar sus propios animales. Ayme cria sus animales en la parte posterior de su casa y estos también buscan su propio alimento en los alrededores, ya que la zona en donde vive es zona rural y las casas están rodeadas de bosques secos y campos de cultivo.

Ayme cria aves de corral y cerdos para luego venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente recorren la zona donde vive. Ella había tenido un préstamo financiado por Kiva y gracias a el su negocio ha ido creciendo con el transcurrir de los meses, actualmente Ayme necesita adquirir mas animales para poder seguir adelante con su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ayme es una joven responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo sigue siendo hacerse conocida en el negocio y crecer poco a poco como empresaria. Ella se encuentra contenta y muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a traves del programa Kiva.
texts.en:
Ayme is twenty-one-years-old and lives with her parents and brother in the Huaca Partida, a rural area in the district of Pitipo, located forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For two years she has made her living raising and selling young animals. She tells us that she learned the business from her mother and then started raising her own animals behind her house. Ayme lives in a rural area where the houses are surrounded by dry forest and crop fields, so the animals search around the area for their own food Ayme raises barnyard fowl and pigs to sell to businesspeople who typically travel around her area. She had gotten a loan financed through Kiva, and thanks to that, her business had been growing as the months went by. Now she needs to get more animals so she can get ahead in her business and bring in more profit. The loan she is seeking at this time, through Edpyme Alternativa, is for 1000 soles, which will help her reach her goal. Ayme is a responsible and hard-working young woman. It continues to be her greatest wish to be known for her business and to grow as a businesswoman little by little. She is happy and really appreciates the people who work with her through the Kiva program.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barnyard fowl and pigs so she can grow her business raising and selling young animals.

loans.name: Venicia Dionisia

texts.es: La señora Venicia V. labora en una institución siendo una persona muy responsable y aplicada en su trabajo que a diario realiza. Ella es soltera y con un hijo que depende de ella por lo que tiene que esforzarse más para suplir las necesidades de este pequeño. Hoy en día está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos para su hogar debido a que los que ha tenido ya están deteriorandose y ella necesita mejorarlos para así mejorar su condición y suplir todas las necesidades de su humilde hogar.
texts.en:
Venecia Dionisia works for UNICA as a custodian who cleans at the University. She is single and has a son who depends on her. She has received two loans from CEPRODEL, and appreciates their support since she has been able to get ahead and earn additional income. Her first loan was used to plant a corn crop, which she sold and then earned additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an electrical appliance for home

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
This is Lina H., 49, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Remo H. and the mother to six young, hardworking adults. By the grace of God, Lina has managed to support her children's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5 Philippine-pesos-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies in at a wholesale price and selling at a piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 pesos in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 pesos loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Lina dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Haidy

texts.en:
Haidy A. is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis occidental. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, she operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $467 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Haidy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Haidy is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 6th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa is a 44-year-old single woman from Tyre who has been working as a tailor since 1990. She works hard for her living. This is the first time Asmaa is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, and it’s because she needs to buy a special textiles offer that’s a good investment for her business. Her clients are her neighbors, friends and foreigners. She attends tailoring workshops from time to time, to stay updated on what’s new in the market. Asmaa seeks to meet the customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy a special textiles offer

loans.name: Josue Abraham

texts.es: JOSUE ABRAHAM M. A., Trabajo como  Responsable de la Unidad  de planilla de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. es padre de familia de tres hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolara, el prestamo solicitado es para invertir en gastos medicos para su mama.
texts.en: JOSUE ABRAHAM M. A. is in charge of the Payroll Unit at the National University of Engineering.  He is the father of three school-aged children.  He is requesting a loan to pay for medical expenses for his mother.

loans.use: To pay for some family problems related to illness.

loans.name: Racheal Wangui

texts.en:
Racheal is married to Patrick and together they have four children. She lives in Limuru which is not far from Nairobi. This is a business and farming region with good rainfall. Racheal has been involved in farming as her primary business for a number of years, planting various vegetables such as cabbage and kale. 

Racheal got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she will buy seeds in readiness for the planting season which starts soon. Racheal hopes to own a dairy farm and be able to supply milk to the residents and the market center.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in readiness for the planting season

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is a member of her group "Caminando hacia el progreso 4 & 5" (Walking toward progress). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to educate her children. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying attending church. 

Ramona is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years, starting with Esperanza's first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business (a vegetables stand) by buying vegetables and fruit such as plantains, bananas, cassava, yams, sweet potatoes, tomatoes and others. She will use the profits to put aside savings and take care of her hearth; she wishes to have a peaceful life. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to have a business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and its sugar cane industry,where the main economic activity is Free Trading Zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and uncertain electricity.

loans.use: to buy plantains, bananas, cassava, yams, sweet potatoes, tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Mukami

texts.en: Mukami is a 73-year-old married lady who is blessed with nine children. She runs Mukami N. Rentals where she rents out houses.  She has been running the business for twenty years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to expand her rental houses hence more income.  She dreams of building an apartment in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kes so as to get capital to start a business of selling livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock for resale

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es: Guillerma es casada y tiene tres hijos de 20, 14, y 6 años de edad. Los dos menores se encuentran todavía en la escuela y la mayor esta en Lima. Guillerma y su esposo son los carniceros en la ciudad de Quinua, que está a una hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Ellos compran animales como cerdos, vacas, carneros en ferias de ganado y diversas granjas y venden la carne en el mercado central de la Quinua. El negocio ha sido lento últimamente porque ha habido menos lluvia que lo normal y los animales no tienen tanto que comer. Guillerma es socia de FINCA Perú hace 11 años aproximadamente. A ella le gusta trabajar con FINCA Perú porque le ayudan a obtener el capital que necesita para invertir en su negocio y ahorrar dinero y educar a sus hijos. Su sueño es la construcción de una casa en Quinua y dice que para Junio próximo debería haber ahorrado lo suficiente para comenzar la construcción!
texts.en: Guillerma is married and has three children who are aged 20, 14, and 6. The two younger ones are still at school and the eldest is in Lima. Guillerma and her husband are butchers in the city of Quinua, which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho. They buy animals such as pigs, cows, rams at livestock fairs and various farms and sell the meat at the Quinua central market. Business has been slow lately because there has been less rain than normal and the animals don't have so much to eat. Guillerma has been a member of FINCA Perú for approximately 11 years. She likes working with FINCA Perú because they help her obtain the capital that she needs to invest in her business and save money and educate her children. Her dream is to build a house in Quinua and she says that by next June she would have saved sufficient to start building!

loans.use: Buy young animals

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: Kyakimwa S.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Neema, âgée de 52 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants.  Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat à l’office congolais de contrôle (OCC),l’ une des grandes entreprises publiques en RDCongo. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente de  Fanta (sucrés) à son domicile. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre par une activité de vente de pagnes. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2004. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (40 casiers de Fanta sucrés) pour augmenter son stock en volume et en valeurs.  En plus, elle ambitionne ouvrier une boutique de référence. La cliente Kyakimwa S.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Neema est constitué de 14 membres.
texts.en:
Kyakimwa S. is an entrepreneure and president of the Neema solidarity group, which is composed of 14 members. She is 52 years old and married with six children. Her husband is an official with the Congolese control office, one of DRC’s largest public corporations.  

She sells Fanta (soft drink) from her home. She started her business using her own capital to sell pagnes (colorful West-African cloth). Later, in 2004, she obtained a $50 loan from the Hekima MFI.
