This new loan will be used to buy merchandise (40 cases of Fanta soft drink) to increase her stock both in volume and in value. She also plans to open a reference shop. 

Kyakimwa S. wishes to thank Hekima for helping the less fortunate who don’t have the option of turning to traditional banks.

loans.use: Buying 40 cases of Fanta soft drink

loans.name: Santa María Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa María lo conforman cinco féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ella es la señora Corina M. de 78 años quien desde hace 30 años tiene su propio negocio el cual inicio con la realización de tortilla y luego cuando su hijo le regalo una mantenedora empezó a vender gaseosa, helados, hielos y cuajadas. 
Ella con el crédito comprara maíz, leña, cuajada y frijoles para su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Elisa Antonia M. Salazar quien vende nacatamales, ropa usada y realiza trabajo de costura, Judith N. comercializa discos, Maira V. López vende ropa y comida y Miurel de 24 años vende productos Avon desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The Santa María group is made up of five hard working, enterprising women. One of them is Mrs. Corina M., who is 78. For 30 years, she has had her own business which she started by making tortillas. Later, when her son gave her a refrigerator, she began to sell soft drinks, ice cream, ice and curds.   

With her loan, she will buy corn, firewood, curd and beans for her business. The other members of the group are Elisa Antonia M. Salazar, who sells nacatamales, used clothing, and does sewing. Judith N. sells disks, Maira V. López sells clothes and food, and Miurel, who is 24 years old, has sold Avon products for three years.

loans.use: For basic grains

loans.name: La Ilucion Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento La Ilusión entrando a su segundo  ciclo conformado por 8 integrantes que viven en la zona del torno de los 8 clientes todos cuentan con negocio y actividad fija, la Presidenta la Sra. Regina de edad de 27 años oriunda del departamento de Oruro Poopó totoral actualmente vive en la localidad  del torno barrio Miraflores hace 19 años. Su Actividad es la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio cuenta hace 4 años  con esta actividad y como segunda actividad trabaja como profesora en el colegio de la zona turno noche, con el dinero del credito comprara abarrotes por mayor, fideo, arroz, azucar, etc. ella es  soltera y no cuenta con ningún hijo por el momento pero es uno de sus deseos.                                                                                                       Secretaria es la  Sra. Arnilda de edad de 21 años vive en la zona su  Actividad es la venta  de pescado cuenta con esta actividad hace 7 años en la zona del mercado Estado civil: convive con el señor Marco hace 10 años el señor cuenta con la actividad de profesor en la zona del torno, con el dinero dle credito comprara electrodomensticos para su casa, Los señores están muy agradecidos con la institución con el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Ilusión” (The Illusion) is starting its second loan cycle with eight members who live in the District of El Torno. All eight of these clients have established business activities. The group president is Sra. Regina. She is 27 years old and originally from the Department of Oruro Poopó Totoral, but she currently has been living in the Miraflores neighborhood of the town of El Torno for the past 19 years. Regina has been selling groceries out of her home for four years and also has a job teaching classes at the local school at night. The money from her loan will be used to buy groceries in bulk such as noodles, rice, sugar, and other items. Regina is single and does not have children at the moment, but she would like to have them some day.

Sra. Arnilda is the group secretary. She is 21 years old and lives in the area. Arnilda has been selling fish at the local market for seven years. She is in a common law marriage with Sr. Marco. For the past ten years, her husband has worked as a teacher in the District of El Torno. The money from her loan will be used to buy electric appliances for her home.

The members are grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baskets of fish and firewood

loans.name: Lester Vidal

texts.es:
Lester tiene 26 años de edad, casado, padre de un hijo, hoy en día trabaja en servicio de seguridad.
Como objetivo ha sido la construcción de casa, que ah venido mejorando con ahorros y financiamiento que Afodenic está dando a través del crédito, lo que está contento por poder lograr esta mejora, ya que su sueldo es bajo, y estas cuotas son accesible por el bajo interés.
Con este nuevo crédito desea reparar el techo, que está en malas condiciones, por ser ya muy viejo. Comprara: laminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, entre otros para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Lester is 26 years old, married, and the father of one child. He works in the security service industry. 

His goal has been to improve his house. He has been improving it with savings and with loans from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner). He is happy to have been able to carry out these improvements, especially because his wages are low and the payments are accessible for the low interest rate. With this new loan he wants to repair the roof that is in poor condition and very old. He will purchase, zinc sheets, beams, nails, and other materials to start the project.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets, nails, and beams to repair the roof

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is currently in a business of selling cooking oil, onions and bread. She is 37 years old and a widow with two children; only one child goes to school. 

She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more cooking oil, onions and bread to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime L., from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya, is 51 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jaime has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over 15 years, earning approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jaime joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 18000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn C., 29, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

C. sells gasoline, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning an income of US $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $83 on food and US $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more supplements to expand her husband’s blacksmith business. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. C.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy more supplements to expand her husband business.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad, vive con su menor hija en casa de su madre en el centro poblado menor de casa Blanca que pertenece al distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz.

Marianela se a dedicado ala venta de de productos de primera necesidad, ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual ella misma atiende. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona, diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. 

El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, contando con varios años de experiencia y buen manejo del negocio. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar más mercadería y ampliar su negocio con nuevos  productos.

Marianela es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Marianela is 36 years old, a mother and lives with her youngest daughter. They live in Marianela’s mothers’ home in a small town in Casa Blanca, district of José Leonardo Ortiz.

Marianela sells basic household products; she has a small pantry in her home that she works herself. She sells to her neighbors and customers in the area. Marianela sells various products for daily consumption like basic household goods and groceries.

The business is well accepted and Marianela has various years of experience and manages well her business. She needs a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to be able to buy more merchandize and to stock her business with new products.

Marianela is a very hardworking woman, easy going, and the people who know her hold her in high esteem and are fond of her.

loans.use: buy more merchandize and to stock her grocery store with new products.

loans.name: Marcial Heriberto

texts.es: El  Sr. Marcial acudió con nosotros para solicitar nuestra ayuda para mejorar la barda  de  su  domicilio ya que  la  que  tiene actualmente  es muy pequeña y  tiene  miedo  que  su  hijo  se  pueda salir del  domicilio  ocasionando  un accidente,  además   le   gustaría   instalar  un portón  para la  mayor  seguridad  de  su  domicilio,  agradece   el  apoyo  brindado  para  la  realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Marcial approached us to request our help to improve a wall in her house. The one that is there is very small and they are afraid that their son might be able to get out, causing an accident. She would also like to install a gate to increase the safety of their home. She is thankful for the support provided for their project.

loans.use: to build a wall on their property.

loans.name: Batochir

texts.en:
Mr.Batochir is a 43 year old truck driver.  He lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He owns a small land plot and the family house on it.  His only son Ankhbayar, age 19, who is a student at the National Science and Technology University. 

Until 2009 Batochir used to run a small grocery shop nearby his home but had to give it up due to the increase of rent price. Then in 2009 he bought a truck using his savings and started running a building material delivery business.  Each year Batochir plans and completes some small building project. Within last two years he built two garages in his backyard.  This time Batochir is planning to extend his house, making a separate room for his son.  The loan he is taking will be used to buy the necessary building materials to extend his house making separate room for his son who is student.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials to extend his house making a separate room for his son who is student

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Ester is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She has been selling charcoal fuel for the last 10 years. Ester intends to use her loan to purchase more charcoal that she plans to resell.  

Ester plans to use the profit she makes from her business to expand her existing business. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler of charcoal. Ester describes herself as innovative.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a widow with six children, four of whom attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, Mupa has operated a grocery selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a retail shop business which contributes as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Mupa dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruits, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 32-year-old woman; she is married and has three daughters and six sons. Muna's husband is a taxi driver; he drives a taxi in the city of Gaza. 

As Muna's husband doesn't have enough cash money to cover the maintenance and repairs his taxi needs, she took out the amount needed to cover the repair expenses. 

FATEN's loan will allow Muna's husband to have the maintenance done and resume working in his taxi. It is the only source of income for his big family.  As Muna is a conservative woman, her husband appears in the photograph in her place.

loans.use: To pay for taxi maintenance and improvement

loans.name: Davronbek

texts.ru:
Компания "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" искренне благодарит социальных инвесторов и Фонд Кива за всестороннюю поддержку и помощь в финансировании своих клиентов. Благодаря вашим усилиям, Давронбек успешно развивает свой бизнес в разведении скота, который позволил выплатить первый кредит по линии Кива без просрочек.
Давронбек родился в городе Ош (Ошская область, Кыргызская Республика). Женат и воспитывает двоих детей. 
Давронбек родился в семье фермера. С детства Давронбек помогал отцу по уходу за скотом. У отца в то время было большое хозяйство, и ему нужна была помощь, поэтому Давронбек привык к этому делу и мечтал, когда вырастет, тоже будет содержать собственное хозяйство.
Окончив школу, Давронбек отправляется служить в армию. В 1995 году, в возрасте 23 лет, Давронбек женился и в этом же году, у него рождается сын. Затем, в 1998 году у него рождается дочь. В первое время, Давронбек проживал со своей семьей в доме своих родителей. Постепенно, путем откорма крупнорогатого скота и продажи, у него получилось накопить денег. В 2002 году, он решил вложить их  в покупку собственного дома в селе Чалдовар (Панфиловский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызская республика), куда и переехал жить. Со временем и его родители, распродав весь свой скот и купив дом, переехали жить в село Чалдовар, недалеко от сына.
В данное время, благодаря предприимчивости и упорству Давронбека в хозяйстве насчитывается 5 дойных коров и 2 быка. В целях увеличения поголовья коров и быков, Давронбек обратился в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом  (KGS). 
Давронбек мечтает со временем купить дом в городе г.Карабалта и переехать туда жить, так как в городе есть хорошие школы, больница и скотский рынок. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners sincerely thanks social lenders and Kiva for its comprehensive support and assistance in the financing of its borrowers. Thanks to your efforts Davronbek is successfully growing his cattle breeding business which allowed him to pay off his first Kiva loan without delinquencies.

Davronbek was born in the town of Osh in the Osh province of the Kyrgyz Republic. He is married and is raising two children.

Davronbek was born in the family of a farmer. Since childhood Davronbek helped his father take care of the cattle. At that time his father had a large household and needed help and this is why Davronbek got used to this type of business and dreamed that when he grew up he will also have his own cattle business.

After graduating from school Davronbek went to serve in the army. In 1995 when he was 23 years old Davronbek got married and in the same year his first son was born. Later in 1998 he had a daughter. 

During the first years Davronbek lived with his family and in his parents' home. Gradually by breeding and selling large horned cattle he was able to save money. In 2002 he decided to invest the money in purchase of his own house in the village of Chaldovar in the Panfilovsky region, Chuysk Province, Republic of Kyrgyzstan where he moved to live. In some time his parents sold out all their cattle and bought a house in the village of Chaldovar where they moved to live not far from their son.

At this time because of his entrepreneurship and tenacity Devronbek has five milk cows and two calves. For the purpose of increasing the headcount of cattle Davronbek has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners to take out a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS. Davronbek dreams to buy a house in the town of Karabalta and move there in the future because the town has good schools, a hospital and a cattle market.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gladis Hermelinda

texts.es:
Gladis Hermelinda tiene 45 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 12 años de edad, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

Gladis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es tener casa propia, coprar un carro y un negocio estable.


Le gusta viajar y esta con la familia.
texts.en:
Gladis Hermelinda is 45 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 12-year-old son in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) meet in the neighborhood of “Jesús del Gran Poder” (Jesus of Great Power) in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-term farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Gladis is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Roca Commercial Center in Ventanas and sells her products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Gladis is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She plans to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic composts, and seeds (corn, beans, and rice) for producing her crops. With the financial assistance given to her entire family, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include pests and diseases that could impact her crops. Her dreams are to have her own house, buy a car, and have a stable business.

Gladis enjoys traveling and being with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic composts, and seeds.

loans.name: Arzikan's Group

texts.en:
Arzikan is the treasurer of this group. She is 46 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has two sons and four daughters. Two younger daughters live with their mom and the other children went to work in Russia.  In order to earn additional money for her livelihood, Arzikan cultivates agricultural products. She grows sunflowers, corn and rice. Selling some part of the harvest, she earns about 3,000 soms per month. Arzikan applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a door and window frames to repair her house. In the future, she wants to see that all her children are married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a door and window frames

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 71 years old. She is married and has three children.

Florenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries, in her sari-sari store.

Florenda has borrowed and paid twenty-four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Florenda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, age 36, runs a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have six children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 3,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.
  
Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a conscientious 35-years old woman.  She is married and has five children. All of her children are single, but some attend school. 

Keo makes products that help people produce fire, especially for housewives in and around the community.  She typically earns $1.50 per day.  Her husband is a policeman. 

Keo wants to obtain a $600 loan to purchase a second hand motorcycle for her husband, as well as for the use of her family. 

In the future, Keo plans to use her profits to expand her business and to repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married with five children. She is 44 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. Jocelyn has a general store that helps her earn a living, and she has had this business for three months. Each month, she earns 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase stock for her general store. Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Patrick Arnaud Gildas

texts.fr:
Client de 37 ans , celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 13 ans. A la fin de ses etudes il se lance dans la vente des poissons de mer fumes comme le hareng et la maquerelle.Ses ventes ont largement augmentes, il a des recettes de 150.000 a 450.000 frs par jour et a commence a faire la vente en gros et demi gros, des cartons de poissons qu'elle va acheter a Pointe Noire.

Il a déjà bénéficié de trois cycles de prêt, il a rembourse son prêt avec succès et a fait des épargnes énormes.
Avec ce nouveau prêt , il va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises, il va acheter 25 cartons de hareng et 20 cartons de maquerelles qu'il livre chez vendeurs du marche.
Tres ambitieux, il tient a aller jusqu'au bout devenir un grossiste et un homme d'affaire important de ce pays .
texts.en:
This customer is 37 years old, single with 2 children aged 13 and 3 years. At the end of his studies he began to sell smoked salt-water fish such as herring and mackerel.

His sales have greatly increased, to the point where his income is now between 150,000 francs and 450,000 per day. He has begun selling cartons of fish wholesale or semi-wholesale, which he buys in Pointe Noire.

He has already been granted three loan cycles, successfully repaid his loans and made huge savings. With this new loan, he will strengthen his stock supply by purchasing 25 cartons of herring and 20 boxes of mackerels he then delivers to market retailers.

Very ambitious, he wants to go all the way : become a wholesaler and a prominent businessman in this country.

loans.use: Buy smoked fish: herring, mackerel

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Borey, 42, is a silk weaver. Her husband, Saroeun, 51, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1989 and have four children - one son and three daughters. One of their children has full-time employment in Phnom Penh City and the others attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Borey is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to get to work.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, a 57 year old, is married and has five children. She has been practicing dairy farming for over ten years. The climate of her region has favored her farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and access loans, which has helped her to boost her business.

Martha hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years. She needs 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Savoeurn, are silk weavers. In addition, the couple also does a farming business. They have been married since 2006 and have one young son. They live in a village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokna is asking for another loan in the amount of $800 in order to continue her silk weaving business by buying silk materials. She will also use another part of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Normelita has a vegetable garden and sells vegetables like eggplants and ampalaya (bitter melon) during harvest time. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Normelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Bobomurat

texts.ru: Бобомурат женат и имеет четверых детей. Он трудолюбивый человек. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и вложил все свои силы и знания. Бобомурат выращивает лук, кукурузу, рис и арахис. В бизнесе помогают ему жена и дети. Они вместе дружно работают на благосостояние семьи. Бобомурат также занимается скотоводством. Он начал свой бизнес с откармливания овец, а теперь занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Бобомурат запрашивает займ в размере 6000 Сомони для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и закупа скота. Он надеется на вашу щедрость и благодарен вам за это!
texts.en: Bobomurat is married and has four children. He is a hard-working man. He has been in cultivation of crops for more than fifteen years and invested all his strength and knowledge. Bobomurat grows onions, corn, rice and peanuts. His wife and children are helping him with the business. Together they are working for the family's welfare. Bobomurat is also engaged in cattle breeding. He started his business with the fattening of sheep, but now he fattens large horned cattle. Bobomurat is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 somoni to buy seeds, fertilizer and livestock purchase. He hopes for your generosity and thankful to everyone!

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and cattle.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu Le Saint

texts.fr:
Client de 40 ans,marie et père d'un enfant  , a l'arrêt de ses etudes en classe de première , il se lance dans le commerce en 2000 pour subvenir a ses besoins.
Il est client de Hope depuis bientôt une année, très exemplaire , il a rembourse avec succès ses differents prêts et a fait des épargnes considérables.
Il a un bon témoignage de l'impact que  l'octroi des différents prêts ont apporte dans sa vie et a avec les benefices faites de son activité , il a amélioré les conditions de vie de sa famille
Avec ce nouveau prêt ,il va s'approvisionner en  achetant des chaussures , des baskets et des sacs de voyages.
Tres enthousiaste il a pour ambition de devenir grossiste des chaussures ,aller s'approvisionner a l'étranger et avec ses benefices ,il continue a prendre soin de sa famille et de la scolarité de son enfant
texts.en: A 40 year old man, married and the father of one child, this client stopped his studies in the sixth grade.  He started his business in 2000 in order to meet his needs.  He has been a very exemplary client of Hope for more than a year.  He has successfully paid back his loans and has made considerable savings. He has a good history of managing the different loans which he has held in his life, and with the profits he has made in his business, he has improved the living conditions of his family.  With this new loan, he is going to stock up by buying shoes, sneakers, and overnight bags.  Very enthusiastic, his ambition is to become a wholesaler of shoes and to go abroad to stock up.  With his profits he continues to take care of his family and the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase sneakers, shoes, and overnight bags.

loans.name: Ghenadie

texts.en: Walking through the hectic entranceway of the Balti market, you will always see a line outside of Ghenadie C.\'s electronic and cell phone repair store.  His store consists of a little booth, where he and his friend have been working for the last three years. They have established a solid reputation for high quality service in repairing cell phones throughout the city.  His knowledge on the products is vast, and his advice is valued by many local mobile phone users. Ghenadie is asking for a loan to purchase more cell phones and accessories for his store. He hopes that in the future he will be able to save or take out a larger loan to open up a store where he will be able to sell a wider range of products and offer more services.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a retired civil servant. He is married with six children; four of them are in secondary school and two are in primary school. After retirement he decided to employ himself by purchasing a saw mill machine. The machine is the sole source of income for his family. He buys timber logs from nearby regions and produces timber of different sizes for his clients. His customers usually demand more than what he can produce. He is in need of USD 1,200 to increase his stock of logs.

loans.use: Purchase timber for his saw mill.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the twenty women of the Femmes de Nder association, led by Ndeye D.. This group has already taken and repaid one Kiva loan – you can check out their previous journal entries and more photos of the group members at http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=154. In this loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Objectives: To make it possible for the women to remain on their land by giving them the chance to earn substantial income in order to meet their basic living needs. Activities: Harvesting and sale of local incense [note: this incense is made from the roots of the grass that grows in the Senegal River and is popular in markets throughout Senegal], in addition to small-scale retail sale of local products. [The incense-selling business] will consist of harvesting the incense roots where they grow and then processing them into incense which will be sold in the local market and in the other markets of Senegal.”

Original French business description:

«Objectifs :

- Fixer les femmes dans leur terroir

- Leurs permettrent d’avoir des revenus substantiels pour la prise en charge de leurs besoins prioritaires ;

Activités :

Exploitation de l’encens au niveau local

Petit commerce

Il s’agit de chercher la matière première sur place et ensuite le traiter avant de le vendre dans le marché local comme dans les autres localité du Pays.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Homemade incense production - harvesting expenses, storage jars, and transportation to market

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
Zebo is a 29 years old teacher, married with two children. Her husband went to the Russia for employment. He sends money for his family, but Zebo wanted to help her husband support the family so she decided to rent small food-shop.   Today Zebo lives with her mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law looks after the children, when Zebo works at the food-shop. The shop located in Isfara, Tajikistan.
Zebo teaches in the school every morning while her sister-in-law runs the business. Zebo is a very cheerful person and is very creative. Her beautiful smile attracts many clients to her food shop. Her small shop is one of the famous shops in the area. Zebo wants to expand her assortment of goods and that’s why she is requesting 1200USD.

loans.use: Business developing.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
Maria is an optimist and entrepreneurial woman. Originally from Tampico, Tamaulipas, she is married and has three children aged 14, 21 and 25 who are all going to school.

Maria enjoys selling and has had the opportunity of selling different types of products. She started 22 years ago selling furniture, then cosmetics and since 6 years ago she sells natural products.

Her character and her will to move on with her family have helped her increase her sales and make an effort to grow her business. That is why now she has a strong customer base.

In order to supply the demand of her clients, Maria is currently requesting a loan for $475 which she is committing to payback in 4 months. Be an important part of this business, Maria and her family really appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maria es una mujer emprendedora y optimista, originaria D. L. localidad D. Tampico en Tamaulipas, es casada y tiene tres hijos, D. 14, 21 y 25 años D. edad, quienes están estudiando. A Maria le gustan mucho las ventas y ha tenido L. oportunidad D. vender diferentes tipos D. productos, inició hace 22 años con muebles, después cosméticos y desD. hace 6 años comercializa productos naturistas, su carácter y sus ganas D. salir adelante con su familia le han ayudado a incrementar sus ventas y a esforzarse mucho por hacer crecer su negocio por lo que ahora cuenta con una amplia cartera D. clientes.

Para poder cubrir las demandas D. sus clientes, en estos momentos Maria está solicitando un préstamo D. $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo D. este negocio, Maria y su familia te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Siradji

texts.fr:
Mr. Siradji S. was born in 1965 in Bassar, Togo, and is now living in Lomé, or more precisely in the Agoè Houmbi district. He is married and has two children. His wife is a retailer. After his secondary schooling, he went into an apprenticeship and he is now a master carpenter in the business where he works (E2M). He is excellent at his work and his charges are fair. This brings in a great many customers. He would like to be able to have enough wood on hand to make furniture for resale, and for that purpose he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur S. Siradji est né en 1965 à Bassar, résident à Lomé plus précisément dans de quartier de Agoè Houmbi. Il est marié avec (02) enfants. Sa femme est commerçante. Après les études secondaires il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage, il est aujourd’hui maître menuisier de son entreprise (E2M). Il a une parfaite maîtrise de ses activités et sa prestation est sans reproche. Ce qui fait augmenter sa clientèle. Il cherche les Moyens pour faire des stocks de bois pour fabriquer les meubles et revendre. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1000.

loans.use:
purchase of wood to use in making furniture for sale

Achat de bois pour confection de meubles à vendre

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke A. is a 39 year old mother of 3 that hails from Mushin, urban sector in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells fabrics, shoes and bags. She began her business in 1995 and needs a loan to buy more clothes, shoes and bags to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun O. and her husband, Mr. Lorn Nao, have been married since 1991. Savun and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. She is in the business of selling fish and weaving silk. She started her business in 1991. Her husband does farming and fishing. They have five children—one son and four daughters. One of the daughters is married and lives in a separate house. Another one of the daughters weaves silk at home, and the other two are studying in the local school. The son helps with the farming.

Savun is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her daughter’s loom.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
Ni Luh S. has sold items in the Sempidi Market for 10 years. In the beginning she sold awnings for storefronts. Now she is leasing a place where she can live and sell at the same place. She sells from 5A.M until the market closes. She is in need of funding to make a one-time purchase of inventory of 2,500,000 Rupiah. The funding she receives will be used to add on to the funding she is already using.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Luh S. telah berjualan di Pasar Sempidi selama 10 tahun. Pada awalnya dia berjualan di emperan toko. Sekarang dia sudah menyewa ruko untuk berjualan sekaligus tinggal. Dia berjualan mulai pukul 05.00 sampai dengan pasar tutup. Modal yang dia perlukan dalam sekali belanja untuk barang – barang dagangannya senilai Rp 2.500.000,00. Modal usaha yang dia terima akan digunakan untuk menambah modal usaha yang sudah dia miliki.

loans.use: to increase business capitol

loans.name: Carlos Luciano

texts.es:
Aside from working as a messenger, Carlos decided to take up another job so that he could support his children, who are 8, 5, and 2 years old. In June of 1992, he talked to his dad about his idea of having a taxicab, and he supported him. Little by little, he started his business, later realizing that this job was the best way to earn income for his family. At present, he works in this field.

However, his vehicle needs some repairs in order to offer his customers more safety, which is way he is requesting $300.00 USD to be repaid in 6 monthly installments. With this loan, Carlos will be able to get his cab fixed so that he can continue to work. With your help, Carlos will able to move his children forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

A parte de trabajar como mensajero, Carlos, decidió comenzar a realizar otra actividad para poder sacar dinero para pagar los gastos de sus hijos que actualmente tienen 8, 5 y 2 años. En Junio de 1992 le platicó a su papá de la idea que traía, de tener un carro de ruta y fue así como lo apoyó. Poco a poco comenzó con este negocio y después se dio cuenta que así era la mejor manera de obtener ingresos para su familia. Y actualmente se dedica a este oficio.

Sin embargo la unidad con la que cuenta necesita que se le hagan unos arreglos para poder brindarles más seguridad a sus clientes. Es por eso que Carlos está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Carlos podrá arreglar su carro para poder seguir trabajando en esto. Con tu ayuda Carlos podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Repair his taxicab

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Hernández was preoccupied by his family's financial difficulty. She decided to increase her income since two of her three children are at college. She resolved to set up a home business and started selling various gift items. Subsequently, she rented a space to sell her goods and was able to increase sales. It has been 5 years she has started her business.

Now, she seeks a loan of $475 which she will repay in 6 months so she can continue to buy inventory and offer a variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Alma Hernández preocupada por la situación económica de su familia y decidida a aumentar las entradas de dinero, debido a que dos de sus tres hijos estaban en la universidad resolvió poner un negocio en la sala de su casa. Empezó vendiendo regalitos, posteriormente rento un local y surtió con artículos de papelería aumentando las ventas del negocio todo esto principió hace 5 años,

Ahora solicita un apoyo económico por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para seguir comprar mercancía y ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness is 31 years old, married, with a 13-year-old child. In 2003, Happiness opened a small clothes shop where she works from 7am to 6pm daily. She can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia N. has a wholesale shop in Katosi that she has been running since 1998. She is married with six children, and she cares for two orphans. She has been our client for ten years as a member of Kewerimidde women’s group, and she is 100 percent reliable. She would like to transform her wholesale shop so that it is more stocked to the brim with everything that customers would ask for. If given a loan, she would like to increase the quantity of sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, and maize flour, and also pay school fees for her children. In the shop, she works with her husband and one of her boys to help with the lifting of heavy bags.

loans.use: To increase her stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, and maize flour, and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married and has a 2-year-old son. His family lives in Drogobych. Roman works in the sphere of transportation services and travels all over the territory of Ukraine. His business does well because Roman works only uses new vans and which helps him save on maintenance costs. They do occasionally require repair work. He launched his venture only 3 months ago, and he already has about $3000 of gross income. More than $15,000 has been invested in assets. 

One of Roman’s plans is to get official permission to travel to Lviv and back. Obtaining this permission is pretty difficult as it requires much paperwork. However, Roman is not the kind of person who backs off and gives in to circumstances. He is willing to persist and get all the documents needed to be able to expand his business and increase his income as a result. Roman is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to repair his vehicle so he can take advantage of his new travel permission.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Hadija's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Hadija is a 29-year-old, divorced woman with 3 children (aged 13, 9 and 3 years old). She began selling food in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 am to 11 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $125 from her sales.

Hadija now seeks a loan in order to buy more food items, such as rice, maize, flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business. Importantly, she will share the loan proceeds with her subgroup member, Monica , who also has a food sales business.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional food

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia Touré est une veuve âgée de 64 ans qui vit avec ses 11 enfants au domicile de son feu époux au 3ème quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Comme beaucoup de femmes du continent Africain d’une manière générale et en république du Mali en particulier, elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle fut obligée dès son jeune âge de s’essayer à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus. Après beaucoup d’échecs, elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente des boissons gazeuses de fabrication moderne et de la glace depuis maintenant 20 ans. 
En relation avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans, elle a bénéficié de trois prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) avec une association de son quartier et deux prêts individuels tous remboursés correctement.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 12 casiers de boissons gazeuses, un moteur pour son réfrigérateur avec lequel elle a commencé l’activité et une charrette (pousse-pousse) pour le transport de la glace et des casiers de boissons fraîches. Cette activité est menée chaque jour et la vente se fait à domicile au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle variée.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 42 000 FCFA qui sera essentiellement utilisé pour renforcer le fonds de commerce. Dans l’avenir elle compte ouvrir un dépôt de boissons.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadidia Toure is a 64 year old widow who lives with her 11 children in the house of her late husband which is located in the third district of Segou (the fourth administration region of the Republic of Mali).

Like many women of the African continent in general and those of the Republic of Mali in particular, she did not have the opportunity to attend school. She was obliged at an early age to try many different business activities to earn an income. Twenty years ago, after a number of set-backs, she decided to specialize in the sale of the latest soft drinks and ice.

She has had an association with the Soro Yiriwaso microbank for three (3) years and has made three (3) group loans as part of a neighborhood association and two (2) personal loans. All of these have been successfully repaid. With this new loan, she plans to buy 12 crates of soft drinks, a motor for her refrigerator (the one she started the business with), and a push cart to transport the ice and soft drink crates. Her business is increasing each day, with sales being made from her home, at the market, and door-to-door to a wide variety of clients.

With this loan Mrs.Toure expects to earn a monthly profit of 42,000 francs CFA which will be used mainly to increase her operating fund. In the future she would like to open a soft drink warehouse.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, es una mujer con deseos de superación, pues quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio en lo posible, puesto que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona. Mediante esta actividad educó y crió a sus 6 hijos, quienes ahora son profesionales e independientes. En  la actualidad, se quedaron solos ella y su esposo José Antonio, quien la apoya mucho en este, su negocio. Leonor a sus  58 años de edad demuestra ser una mujer proactiva que contagia entusiasmo a todo aquel que la conoce, sin embargo para llegar a cumplir con su objetivo, estima de un capital, dinero que invertirá en su negocio y de esta manera cumplir con su meta trazada. Apoyemos a esta madre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Leonor has worked selling food for a long time. She is a woman with the desire to advance in life as she wants to expand her business however possible because it is located in a good location. Through this activity she educated and raised her 6 children who are now professionals and independent. She is currently alone with her husband José Antonio, who supports her very much in her business. Leonor at 58 years old demonstrates herself to be a proactive woman whose enthusiasm is contagious. However, to achieve her objective she needs capital, money which will be invested in her business and in this way she will meet her goal. Let’s support this mother that demonstrates her will to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and improve her food sales business.

loans.name: Denis Alberto

texts.es: Denis habita en el barrio Jardines de Veracruz, tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero y tiene cuatros hijos de 3, 5, 6 y 8 años de edad. Don Denis es mecánico, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de lubricantes, servicio de auto lavado. Tiene seis años de estar dedicándose a las ventasde estos productos, el negocio lo empezó de ahorros obtenidos de su actividad como mecánico y también con préstamos hechos a AFODENIC, con los cuales ha logrado mantenerse en el mercado. El préstamo solicitado es para invertir capital de trabajo, en la compra de lubricantes para ampliar su inventario. Sus planes futuros son seguir ampliando el negocio y brindar servicios integrales en el ramo automotriz.
texts.en:
Denis lives in the Jardines neighborhood of Veracruz, is 43 years old, single, and has four children ages 3, 5, 6 and 8. Denis is a mechanic, he has a small business selling lubricants and a car wash. He has had this business for 6 years, a business he began with savings from his work as a mechanic and also with loans from AFODENIC, with which he has been able to support himself in the market. The current loan is to invest it as working capital, buying lubricants to expand his inventory. His future plans are to continue expanding his business and providing needed automotive services.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lubricants to expand his inventory

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline G., dried fish dealer and 32-year-old entrepreneur whose husband is a tricycle driver from Surallah, South Cotabato, never stops doing business to be able to send their 2 children to school.

In 2001, she got herself started up in a fish-vending business and humbly started out with only Php 2, 000 capital. From the profit she earned, she was able to support all her family needs. 

She is a top-performing CEV client who needs the additional capital of Php 21,000 for her dried fish business. She believes that through her CEV loan she will be able to add to her inventory of dried fish and make more sales. “I need to invest more to accommodate all my customers,” she says. “Competition is really tough nowadays, so I need to do something to sustain my business for my family,” she added.

loans.use: To purchase all kinds of dried fish

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Đào năm nay 55 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và ba con đã trưởng thành tại xã Tân Hưng huyện Sóc Sơn Hà Nội. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư mua lưới đánh cá. Từ năm 2003 đến nay gia đình chị đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.  Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị Đào đang chăn nuôi  lợn nái, lợn thịt tại nhà, các con chị cũng đều có công việc làm ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng  kinh tế gia đình chị Đào đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn đựoc vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm lợn giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Đào, 55 years old, lives with her husband and three grown children in Tân Hưng commune, Sóc Sơn district, Hà Nội. In 1996, she became a member of the TYM Fund and borrowed money to buy fishing nets. Since 2003, she and her family have invested capital in raising animals to improve their financial situation. Today, Mrs. Đào and her husband raise both sows and porkers (pigs raised for meat) by their house, and their children all have steady employment. The total family income is now about 3,000,000 VND (180 USD) per month and the financial situation of the family is steadily becoming more secure. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (600 USD) to purchase more breeding pigs and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Filomena Rosario De

texts.es: LA SRA. FILOMENA QUE CUENTA CON 55 AÑOS VIVE EN SU PROPIA CASA UBICADA POR LA ZONA NORTE DE WARNES, CERCA DEL HOSPITAL GRAL. JUNTO A SU ESPOSO DE 61 Y SUS HIJOS DE 33 Y 23 AÑOS DE EDAD. ELLA ES AMA DE CASA Y SU ESPOSO ES RENTISTA, JUBILADO DE LA EMPRESA MADERERA SOBOLMA LTDA. NO TIENE COMPETENCIA YA QUE ES AMA DE CASA Y SU ESPOSO RENTISTA (JUBILADO). LA SRA. DE F. A COMPRADO ARTEFACTOS PARA SU HOGAR, DONDE HA INVERTIDO TODO EL MONTO SOLICITADO. ESTE SERIA EL SEXTO PRESTAMO DE LA SRA. ROSARIO, Y TODOS LOS ANTERIORES LOS A CANCELADO PUNTUALMENTE. ELLA NO TIENE DEUDA EN NINGUNA OTRA FINANCIERA.
texts.en:
Filomena is 55 years old, she lives in her own home located in the northern area of Warnes, near the Gral hospital, along with her 61 year old husband and children ages 33 and 23. She is a housewife and her husband is an investor, retired from the Maderera Sobolma business. She doesn’t have any training as she is a housewife and her husband is a retired investor. Mrs. De F. has purchased items for her home, where she has invested the requested loan. This will be the 6th loan for Rosario, and all the previous loans were repaid punctually. She doesn’t have debt in any other financing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Expenses

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma has been a khanga (fabric) and bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khanga and cosmetics items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business in order to save money and pay the school fees of her children.

Salma is 40 years old, divorced, and has 3 children, aged between 16 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and cosmetics items for her business

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussein is a 34-year-old married man with two children, living in Zawtar Al Gharbiah in southern Lebanon. He works as a construction worker, specialized in floor tiles.  He already had a micro-loan from Ameen, which was used to buy a floor tile polisher. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 in order to buy scaffolding.

loans.use: Buy scaffolding

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 34 years old. She is divorced and the mother of four children. Mary believes in hard work and dedication, which is the secret to her success. She is a single parent who always wants to see joy in the family. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like banku and abetie. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She needs the loan to enable her to inject more capital into her business so she can purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava dough, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She says the cost of raw materials is very high now. She also wants to save part of the loan to venture into crop farming in the near future. Her picture was taken when she was going about her normal daily chores. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Naomi’. She hope to receive GH¢800 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell baby clothes

loans.name: Similla Group

texts.es: El grupo “Similla” esta representado por la señora Maritza y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican actividades comerciales en especial D. verduras frescas, fruta, comida, venta D. edredones y a actividades como la construcción D. viviendas. Dentro D. estos rubros D. venta D. verduras existe mucha competencia ya que algunos productores prefieren salir a vender sus productos ellos mismos que a los revendedores causando competencia en los precios, es por esta razón que los socios (as) requieren del financiamiento para comprar los productos desD. su lugar D. origen a un precio mas bajo para poder competir en el mercado y también para la adquisición D. materiales y herramientas que ayuden al trabajo D. los miembros del grupo que se dedican a otras actividades. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo conocen el trabajo con grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron anteriormente con instituciones similares a la fundación  Agrocapital, por lo que conocen D. la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para que el grupo pueda adquirir los fondos y poder así realizar un trabajo D. mejor calidad para ingresos mayores que coadyuva al mejoramiento D. la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Similla" is represented by Mrs. Martiza and formed by 12 members who work selling fresh vegetables, fruits, food, bed sheets and other activities like construction of houses. There is a lot a competition on vegetables prices, this is why the members need a loan to buy the products at lower prices so they can compete in the market and to buy materials and tools to help the ones that work in other activities. Most of the members know the work of the similar solidarity groups like Agrocapital, so they know the responsibility and commitment required for the group to get the funds in order to produce a better quality job and get more income to improve their families quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Солиева Мухаё 1972 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей.  Высшего образования не имеет. Муж помогает разводить скот. В основном она сама ухаживает за скотом, помогают и сыновья. Муж или дети выводят только на продажу и выгуливают на пастбище. Кредит получил на покупки скота.
texts.en:
Muhayo S. was born in 1972, she is married with three children. She does not have higher education. Her husband helps her raise cattle. She mainly takes care of the cattle and her sons also help her. Her husband and children take the cattle out only for sale and for grazing. She received the loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es: La Señora Rita S. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, madre soltera, tiene dos hijos. Con gran esfuerzo ha salido adelante y tiene proyectado a corto plazo la construcción de su vivienda. Tiene su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace dos años lo inicio ya que la situación de encontrar trabajo esta muy difícil por tal motivo su meta es tener su tienda de variedad. Agradece a Afodenic por el apoyo que le ha brindado para crecer como comerciante. Este es su cuarto ciclo y el préstamo que solicita es para capital de trabajo con la compra de productos como: pacas de damas y variadas, zapatos, cosméticos y otros. Y poder ofertar a sus clientes una variedad de productos a si como atraer clientes nuevos.

loans.use: Comprar pacas, zapatos, cosmeticos

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Ana junto a su esposo venden condimentos, especerías como canela, clavo de olor, hongos, productos que son embolsados en pequeñas cantidades, los cuales los venden en las ferias y también reparten a las tiendas.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hongos y canela.
Los sueños de Ana son tener una tienda propia y comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Las Gaviotas Community Bank. She is 23, in a common law marriage, and has one son. Ana and her husband sell condiments and spices like cinnamon, cloves, mushrooms, and products bagged in small packages. They sell these items in the fairs and they also distribute to stores. Ana needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy mushrooms and cinnamon. Ana’s dreams are to have her own store and to buy some land.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mushrooms and cinnamon

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en:
Anatolia L. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is a fifty-nine-year-old widow with seven grown children. To make a living, Anatolia owns and operates a business selling different fruits in the community. Anatolia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $145 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anatolia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to give her the ability to engage in business activities. Anatolia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Anatolia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.en:
Pictured here is the communal bank "Rubi" whose members have been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for just four months. This communal bank was created on March 2009.  The majority of its members live in Pucallpa in a neighborhood called "26 de Enero" (26th of January). Señora Medita Chávez R. is 24 years old and is the president of "Rubi."

"Rubi" has 11 members. The members have confidence in one another. The group is small and the women are cheerful.  They take their commitments seriously and view their businesses optimistically. The members of "Rubi" are requesting a loan of 4800 Nuevos Soles in total, which each woman will invest in her business. This will be the second loan that the members have received from Manuela Ramos. The members of "Rubi" dedicate themselves to a variety of business ventures, including selling plantains, other fruits and vegetables, rice, handicrafts, fish, basic grocery items, and cooked food.

The members of this bank are pleased to be receiving economic support from Manuela Ramos. Manuela Ramos also gives educational sessions during each monthly meeting, programming which helps the women to continue developing their businesses.

loans.use: Additional products for sale (including fruits and vegetables, other grocery items); investment in materials for handicrafts and a restaurant business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar A. sells music and video CD’s in Hohoe. Oscar has received tertiary education.  He is married and has four dependants. His wife is a trader. Oscar has been selling CD's since 1993. He is responsible for the financial needs of the entire family. His loan will be used to buy more music and video CD's to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to buy land and build.

loans.use: To buy music and video CD's to sell.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.fr: G. Etienne est né vers les années 1955 à Abomey au centre du Bénin. Etienne est Etienne est père de 7 enfants tous scolarisés et dont 5 sont encore à sa charge. Etienne est marié à KPODOZAN Urbaine,  une revendeuse de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Etienne vend depuis 3 ans de charbon de bois et de pétrole lampant. Etienne est aussi un agent de sécurité bénévole dans une structure de la place. Etienne  et sa famille résident depuis 23 ans à  Agla, un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Etienne s’approvisionne en pétrole lampant dans les stations des sociétés pétrolières de la place. Etienne s’approvisionne en charbon de bois dans les villages du Bénin. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce  Etienne a avait bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé qu’il a bien remboursés. Aujourd’hui encore Etienne sollicite un troisième crédit d’ALIDé pour agrandir son stock de charbon de bois et de pétrole lampant.

loans.use: Achat de charbon de bois et de pétrole lampant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cook and serve porridge

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca Beatriz Bàez Morel lives in the Roque González Neighborhood in Immaculada Concepción. She is 22 years old and a university student. She lives with her mother and sister, and works with her mother selling door to door all types of merchandise. Blanca says that she always acompanies her mother and they know many districts in her area to sell to. She wants to start a small business with her mother, who will help facilitate the business. She has acquired many good clients, and she hopes with the profit that she can pay for her studies. Their products are made of good quality and are well-liked by the buyers. With the loan she plans to buy covers to sell door to door with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy covers

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady M., 36 ans, mariée, avec 5 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de NIAFOR depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle a été 15 fois bénéficiaire de prêt et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe un commerce de poisson frais et d'huile de palme. Son objectif est d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d'assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Khady M. is 36 years old, she is married and is financially responsible for 5 children. She has been a member of the village Bank NIAFOR for seven and a half years. She has received 15 loans and has never had a problem to pay them back. She is developing a retail business of fresh fish and palm oil. Her goal is to improve her family' s living conditions and to guarantee her children' s school fees.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her small retail activity

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes S. is from the village of P-4 Villaflor Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Lourdes is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business selling corn and vegetables to local community members. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Lourdes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.en:
N. Suraiyo is a 36-year-old mother whose husband has no fixed income. So, to cover day-to-day necessities, she processes and sells dried apricots with the help of her elder son. She uses all the money she makes to care for her three children and provide for their education. Suraiyo has 15 years of experience processing and selling dried apricots. She is very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Suraiyo requests $1200 USD to purchase more dried apricots to process and increase her range of goods. Suraiyo and her son express their gratitude for everyone supporting them and they promise to repay their loan in a timely manner.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: http://www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots

loans.name: Rosa Katy

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Katy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun están a cargo de ella. .

Rosa Katy, se dedica a la venta de mercería, lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, nos cuenta que le va muy bien. 
Rosa Katy, es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día, se esfuerza mas para así cumplir sus demás sueños y darle a sus hijos, una buena educación.

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará mercería muy variada como: cuadros, portafotos, flores artificiales, artículos para regalos, accesorios como pulseras, anillos y collares. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá, en la compra de mercaderías de ropas.

Rosa Katy, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Katy belongs to the "Las Nazarenas" Community Bank in the Bellavista District, Bellavista Province, San Martín Province. She lives with her partner, is 37 years old, and is mother of two children who she still cares for. Rosa Katy works at a store selling small articles and has done so far many years. Her store is situated in a very good location to serve her customers. She says that her business is going very well for her. Rosa Katy is a very hard-working woman who exerts herself day after day to be able to fulfill her dreams and give her children a good education. Currently she has a faithful clientele who go to her stand daily to shop and is it Rosa Katy who personally attends to them with the charisma that she characterizes her. With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy various small articles like: wall hangings, picture frames, artificial flowers, various gifts, and accessories like bracelets, rings and necklaces. Today Rosa Katy feels like an accomplished woman with more will to to move ahead and make her dreams reality. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and also for helping many woman who want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small articles

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan” desde hace 4 meses atrás (reingresante), del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudiò primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales.
Teresa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital y asi comprar ovejas y chanchos.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1000.00 con el que podrá comprar una ternera.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprar un carro y tener su negocio independiente.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el préstamo y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Teresa, 32, has been a member of the "San Juan" communal bank in the Yunguyo district and province, Puno department, for 4 months (returning member). She is married and has 3 children. She finished elementary school and she raises small farm animals. Teresa tells us that she used her first Manuela Ramos Movement, 300 new sol, loan to buy sheep and pigs. She now requests 1000 new soles to buy a calf. Her dream for the future is to buy a car and have her own independent business. What she likes best about her communal bank is the loans and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal Triunfadoras pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch se agruparon hace poco para acceder al préstamo y el servicio de Salud de Pro Mujer, todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de golosinas, comida, fruta, ropa y atención de tienda de barrio.
René L. de 47 tiene el oficio de albañil hace 2 años y requiere el préstamo para comprar herramientas de trabajo. Angélica J. de 20 años se dedica a vender diferentes artículos en su tienda de barrio y ella quiere comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
The community association "Triunfadoras" (Winners) belongs to the German Busch regional office. They recently formed this group to access loans and health services from Pro Mujer. They all have various businesses like selling candy, food, fruit, and clothing, and running neighborhood stores.

René L., who is 47 years old, has been a bricklayer for 2 years and needs a loan to buy tools to work. Angélica J., who is 20, sells different items in her neighborhood store, and she want to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and fixed assets

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena C. is from the village of Antonino, Alicia, Isabela. She is 57 years old, is widowed, and has six adult children. Filomena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Filomena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas.
