Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Crisoslogo

texts.es:
Crisoslogo tiene 65 años, es casado, tiene seis hijos, pertenece al banco comunal “Yanapakuy” de la Asociación Arariwa (Yanapakuy es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa “ayudemos”) y tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comida. Su esposa Ignacia nos cuenta que esta encargada del comedor de trabajadores de la empresa “Backus”, ella prepara almuerzo para 150 empleados. Ya son dos años que se dedican al negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen su trabajo. Crisoslogo requiere el préstamo de los 700 dólares, que invertirá en comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar.
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

(En la foto, el socio esta acompañado de su esposa).
texts.en:
Crisoslogo is 65 years old. He's married and has six children. He belongs to the communal bank "Yanapakuy" of the Asociación Arariwa (Yanapakuy is a Quechua word which translated to English means "Let's help"). He has a small family business selling food. His wife Ignacia tells us that she is in charge of the dining room of the employees of a business called "Backus". She prepares lunch for 150 employees. They have been doing this business for two years and it is going very well for them thanks to the effort they put into the work. Crisoslogo needs a loan of 700 dollars, which he will invest in buying rice, oil and sugar. He is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and he is committed to making the payments according to the schedule. (In the photo, the member is accompanied by his wife).

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crisoslogo needs the 700 dollar loan which he will invest in purchasing rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Santosa

texts.es: Santosa es una jovencita que cuenta con 25 años de edad, el estado civil de Santosa es soltero, no tiene hijos y aún vive en la casa de sus padres. Santosa se dedica al negocio de la lechería, es decir comercializa la leche al por mayor la producción la efectúa desde su domicilio, Santosa cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Su competencia es media debido a que otras personas ofertan lo mismo, pero la diferencia es que ella es muy responsable en cuanto a la entrega del producto final y por eso se ganó la preferencia de muchos clientes que se consideran como fijos ahora. El presente crédito Santosa lo utilizará para la compra de ganado lechero, que formará parte de su actual actividad. En sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, no tiene obligaciones con otras Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Santosa is a young woman, 25 years old and single. She has no children and still lives in her parents' house. Santosa works in the dairy business, milking the cows herself at home and then selling the milk wholesale. Santosa has two years of experience in this line of work, She does have some competition, as there are others who offer the same service. What differentiates Santosa from the rest is that she is very responsible about delivering the final product. This has made her the preferred provider for many people who are now her regular customers. Santosa will use this loan to buy dairy cows for her milking operation. She has repaid all of her previous loans promptly and has no outstanding debts to other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Kabotar Group

texts.en:
Bebe Asefa is a member of Kabotar Group. She is a 50 year old woman, married with six children, who lives in 9th district of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Bebe Asefa is a hardworking woman. She has a quilt-sewing business and she has been involved in this business for more than twenty-five years. She is very skillful and quite popular among her neighbors.

Bebe Asefa needs the loan to purchase different kinds of cloth and necessary materials for her business because mostly she designs the quilts of brides which is a custom in Afghanistan. She hopes to expand her business and to open a shop instead of working in her house.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Jared Ochieng

texts.en:
Jared G., 26 years old, is an experienced artisan. He is married to Jane Achieng, a tailor, and they have a two-month-old baby girl. Jared moulds and assembles charcoal burners (locally known as ‘Jiko’) in Lurambi, Kakamega town. Jared enjoys a booming business because of his high quality burners, and also because of the popularity of the burners in the area. 

Jared is grateful that he is able to access credit from KADET to improve his business. He will use the loan to buy raw materials for the burners, for example, iron sheets and molding materials. His wish is to find a lender to enable him advance his business 

Jared has a dream to diversify to retail business by opening a shop and also to help his wife expand her tailoring business. They believe that through this loan, they will be able to generate more income and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for charcoal burner manufacturing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman who is 58 years old with 6 children. Her husband also works to support their home. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

She rears pigs for commercial purposes. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more feed to boost her business.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more feed to boost her business

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarat C. is 53 years old and has been selected as the leader of her group by the eight members who are located in Koh Chamroeun village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Sarat C. is a fruit seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In this business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to enlarge her business. With this loan she hopes to increase her income to improve her family living.

Mrs. Sarat C.’s husband, Mr. Lay Loch, is a construction worker who receives a mall salary to support his family. This couple has six children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, two are laborers, while the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel A. C.  tiene 32 años, es casado,  tiene  4 hijos que se llaman  Abran de 10 años, Brayan de 8 años, Jonathan de 5 años y Valeria de 2 años,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y pastoreo de ganado bovino.
Miguel Ángel  trabaja en la agricultura como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, maíz, trigo, cebada, habas.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en la ciudad de Guaranda. 
Miguel Ángel  solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra de sus productos.  Su meta es de mejorar sus cultivos y así dar un mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son falta de ayuda al agricultor, ya que cuando llueve mucho se pierde la cosecha se daña los productos y no hay ingresos  económicos. Miguel Angel  manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta compartir con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel A. C. is 32, married, and has four children. Abran is 10, Brayan is 8, Jonathan is 5, and Valerie is 2. They live in the town of San Francisco de Rumí Pamba, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar. He is a member of the San Francisco de Rumí Pamba Communal Bank. It is comprised of 25 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture and raising cattle. Miguel Ángel works in agricultural as the primary source of income for his family. The crops that excel the most in the area are potatoes, corn, wheat, barley, and beans. He sells the products from each harvest in the city of Guaranda. Miguel Ángel is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant his products. His goal is to improve his crops. That way he can give his children a better quality of life. The challenge that he faces is not having farm help. Another challenge is that when it rains a lot he loses the harvest, the products are damaged, and there is no income. Miguel Ángel says that he likes to share his free time with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Porfirio Alejandrino

texts.es:
Porfirio Alejandrino G. P. tiene 57 años, vive con su esposa y 3 hijos, Freddy de 16 años, Mario de 14 años y Danny de 11 años, en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  
Porfirio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas y fréjol, como principal fuente de ingresos de la familia. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado de San Miguel. 
Porfirio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abonos y urea. Piensa que el préstamo cambiara la situación económica de la familia. Su meta es comprar un terreno para el mejoramiento de la vivienda. Los desafíos que enfrente son la plaga en los productos y les fenómenos naturales
Le gusta las fiestas del carnaval, el deporte y también cantar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Porfirio Alejandrino G. P. is 57 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province with his wife and three children: Freddy (age 16), Mario (age 14) and Danny (age 11). He is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Porfirio is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, potatoes, and beans to generate income for his family. He buys and sells his products at the market in San Miguel. Porfirio is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies, compost, and urea. He believes the loan will help change his family’s financial situation. His goal is to buy land so that he can make improvements to his home. The challenges he faces are pests that impact his crops and the occurrence of inclement weather and other natural phenomena.

He enjoys the Carnival festivals, sports, and singing in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies, compost, and urea

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es: Gaby, de 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente siembra alfalfa que produce en sus extensiones de terreno. En esta actividad toda su familia le ayuda, y  todos aportan cuando llega el tiempo de siembra o de cosecha, y también al momento de repartir la alfalfa a sus clientes. Además, paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ovejas que alimenta de sus cosechas de alfalfa. Después de las ventas observa que los ingresos económicos le resultan bastante rentables, es por eso que para el futuro tiene planeado continuar  extendiendo sus terrenos de cultivo.Es la 11ava vez  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Gaby tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono que necesita  para sembrar más extensiones de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Gaby is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children in her own home. For 10 years, she has been working in agriculture. She mainly plants alfalfa on her land. The whole family helps with this activity and everyone pitches in when it is planting or harvesting time, and also when the alfalfa is delivered to customers. In addition, she raises sheep, which she feeds from her alfalfa harvests. After the sales, she has seen that her income has been very profitable, and that is why in the future she plans to continue expanding her crops. This is the 11th time that she has had a loan with MFP, and she promises that she will be very responsible in making her payments. In addition, she thanks all of the people who made the loan possible. It will be very useful in the progress of her business. Gaby is planning on investing the money she has asked for in purchasing fertilizer that she needs to plant more alfalfa crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer she needs for her crops

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mr. Yi U., age 51, lives in Choes village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sorng Bou, are farmers who own a hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Mr. Yi U. has a sugar palm house business. 

In order to increase their income to improve the family living, Mr. Yi U. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy a cow for breeding. 

This couple has four children: one is a construction worker, two are seamstresses in the garment factory, and the youngest is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. is from the village of Canitoan, Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Letecia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling used clothing, or ukay-ukay, to the local community members. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Gladys Victoria

texts.es:
Gladys tiene años D. edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Chepén, una zona agrícola D. regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, dentro D. la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra situada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace doce años a la venta D. verduras D. modo ambulante dentro D. uno D. los mercados D. la ciudad en donD. vive, ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo D. verduras frescas todos los dias desD. tempranas horas en la mañana. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el negocio y al buen trato que ofrece, actualmente cuenta con un grupo D. clientes fieles que siempre acuden a adquirir los productos que ofrece. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para ayudar a sostener económicamente a su familia.

Gladys desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas verduras para seguir ofreciéndolas a sus clientes, por ell ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden con la realización D. sus objetivos.

Gladys es una mujer bastante empeñosa y con ganas D. seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando se ha ganado la confianza D. sus compañeros D. trabajo, los que la consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Gladys lives with her family in the Chepen district, an agricultural zone with regular commercial activity which is located in the province of the same name, in the La Libertad region. This zone is an hour from the Chiclayo city, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For twelve years she has sold vegetables in one of the street markets in the city where she lives. She offers her customers all types of fresh vegetables every day, starting in the early morning hours. Given the time she has worked in this business and the good service that she offers, she now has a group of loyal customers who always purchase the products that she offers. The income that she earns is used to help with her family's finances. Gladys wants to expand her business with the purchase of more vegetables to continue offering them to her customers. For this reason she has decided to request her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa: 1500 soles, which will help her to achieve her goals. Gladys is a very hard-working woman who wants to keep working to improve the quality of life of her family. During the time that she has worked, she has gained the confidence of her co-workers, who consider her a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N., 37, is a mother of six children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are enrolled in a local school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sam Oun Tet, is a construction worker. They live in Pou village in Takeo province. Sokhom is also the leader of a loan group selected by five members. Each member will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their current businesses.

Sokhom’s problem is that her field is ready to grow rice, but she does not have enough rice seed. So to improve production, she is requesting a loan to buy more rice seed and fertilizer and to rent a machine to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to rent a plow

loans.name: G.s. Sergio Martinez Numero Dos Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Sergio Martínez Numero Dos está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Juan forma parte de este grupo tiene 3 hijos menores de edad él se dedica a brindar los servicio de albañilería hace 11 años, en donde realiza trabajos favorables. Su otro compañero que es Francisco se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, pero debido al poco capital que tienen deciden juntarse y realizar un financiamiento para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group named Sergio M. Number Two is made up of hard working and entrepreneurial individuals that look tirelessly for advancement opportunities. With hard work every day they hope to provide a better future for their children. Juan is a member of the group. He has 3 young children and he has been a construction worker for the past 11 years. His colleague, Francisco, has provided public transport for the past 8 years. Given their insufficient capital funds they decided to join forces and request a loan together to invest in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 55 years old and married. She has 10 children; the younger ones still go to school. To make a living, Gregoria owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gregoria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years.

Gregoria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gregoria has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gregoria is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa B. is a 26 years old, single woman.  She lives with her parents and sister in a Mongolian nomadic dwelling called 'ger' in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Both her parents are retired and her sister, Navchaa, is currently pursuing a master's degree in university. Ariunaa stopped attending university because she was not able to pay her tuition fees.  

Ariunaa manages a grocery trading business in a rented space in the local community. She has been operating her business since 2009 after working as a salesperson at a shop. Her business has grown quickly within a short period of time.  She sells cell phones in addition to food stuff. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her sister's tuition fees and to contribute to her family's income as well. In the future, she wants to continue studying and to purchase her own land with a fence. Ariunaa is a diligent and hardworking woman. She says: "I am planning to complete my undergraduate degree."  

Ariunaa is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to become an official distributor for a cell phone service provider and sell cell phones through her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 37 years old and a single mother of a 9-year-old who attends school. She has been farming for the last year and employs one farmhand. Her farm currently produces eggs, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of horticultural products to the local market. She says the poultry farm is time-consuming and needs a lot of attention and this has been her biggest challenge. Her other challenge has been diseases, which are too costly to treat. She has requested this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farm. She says the proceeds from this project will assist her in paying school fees and providing for the basic needs of her family. In the future, she would like to purchase a hatchery that produces 100 chickens since the potential is high in the region. She is happy with Juhudi and says that she wants Juhudi to diversify its loan offerings to include school fees and biashara (business) loans to enable her to obtain her needs under one roof.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Nahima Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Nahima del Carmen G. M. es trabajadora Activa de la  Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como secretaria tiene catorce años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para gastos personales en su hogar, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs Nahima del Carmen G. M. works for the City of San Rafael del Sur as a secretary.  She has been working for them for fourteen years.  She is married.  She has had four loans from CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy building materials to extend and improve her house.  She is requesting her current loan for personal household expenses.  Her loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her since they have enabled her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Maria Rene

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rene vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la zona de Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en una empresa como secretaria, el esposo tiene una empresa unipersonal y viaja constantemente.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar la matrícula y pensiones en la universidad para su hijo menor, en la carrera de auditoria

Es cliente de Impro, paga muy bien y por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Maria Rene lives in her own home, with her husband and two children, in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria zone in the city of La Paz.  She works as a secretary at an enterprise, and her husband has his own business and travels constantly.

The loan she is requesting is to pay for her youngest child’s university expenses, towards a career in auditing.

Being an Impro client, reliable with payments, and of good character, have qualified her to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To pay for university expenses for her youngest child, towards a career in auditing.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en: Rafiq S. is a 58-year-old man who lives in Sabirabad. He is married and has a big family. He is a father to three sons and one daughter. Rafiq receives a monthly pension of 113 AZN. Since that is not enough to support his family, he started his own poultry business 10 years ago. His whole family helps him in his business, especially his son. This loan of 1000 AZN, to buy feed for his chickens and turkeys, is his first with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He plans to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy feed for chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Martha Elva

texts.es: La. Sra. Martha le acaban de dar su casa y ella se encuentra muy contenta pues vivía con su mama y ahora que le dio su casa Infonavit quiere aprovechar su saldo para levantar una barda en la parte trasera de su casa ya que su esposo trabaja la mayoría de los días fuera de la ciudad y ella se queda sola con sus hijos y la ubicación de su casa esta a las orillas de la ciudad por lo cual se sentiría mas segura de su persona y patrimonio con la construcción de la barda  pues ella tiene que salir a trabajar.
texts.en: Martha has just been given a house and she is very happy because she used to live with her mom.  Now that she has received a house from Infonavit (a government program that provides low-cost mortgages to working families so they can buy small starter homes), she would like to use her wages to build a perimeter wall around the back of the house since her husband works outside of the city most days and she is left alone with the children.  Her house is located on the outskirts of the city and she feels that she would be personally safer and her home would be safer if she could build a wall since she has to go out to work.

loans.use: To build a perimeter wall outside her home

loans.name: Maria Grimaneza

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años, de estado civil viuda, tiene 01 hijo que depende económicamente de ella, la señora realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja  con el  Movimiento   Manuela  Ramos desde hace 04 meses su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de golosinas, galletas y productos de belleza.

Su nuevo crédito fue de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que aumentará al capital de su negocio para comprar galletas, aceite, huevo, champús, detergentes, etc., lo realiza sola.

Su sueño es ser mayorista en abarrotes.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el apoyo de las socias.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank “12 de Agosto” ("August 12th") which is in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 40 years old, is a widow, and ha one child who depends on her economically. María completed her secondary school education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four months. Her initial loan was for 500 Peruvian Soles, which she will use in her business, which sells sweets, cookies, and beauty products. She will use the loan to add to her store's stock, buying cookies, oil, eggs, shampoos, detergents, etc. She runs this business on her own. Her dream is to be able to be a grocery wholesaler. What she likes most about her community back is the support of the members.

loans.use: To purchase supplies like cookies, oil, eggs, shampoo, and other products for her store

loans.name: Ilham

texts.ru:
Ilham M. 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka  kotoriy uchistay v 1 klasse. Ilham yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy.
 
Ilham uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya  etim biznessom skotovodstva. Otec Ilhama toje bil skotovodom i  poetomu on s destva lubil jivotnix lubil smotret kak otec rabotayet i s podrostaniye nachal pomoqat otcu , seychas je on sam skotovod. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit korovi. Ilham izqotavlivayet yogurt , kefir i sir i moloka i prodayet ix u sebya doma, yeqo pokupateli v osnovnom yavlyayustay yeqo sosedi kotorim nravitsya yeqo produkti.
texts.en:
Ilham M. is thirty-two and married with one child in first grade.  He is an IDP [Internally Displaced Person] from the city of Fuzili and now lives with his beloved family in the Fuzili region.

For the past six years Ilham has been in the cattle business.  His father was a cattleman, so from childhood Ilham has loved animals and seeing how his father worked.  He started helping his father out when he was a teen, and now he's a cattle farmer himself.  Ilham needs 2000 AZN to buy cows.  He produces yogurt, kefir, cheese, and milk and sells them from home.  His clients mainly include his neighbors, who like his products.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
El señor Julio César M. T. habita en la ciudad de Granada, en el Departamento de Granada, ahí también labora como Operador de Equipo AS desde hace tres años y ocho meses en la empresa ENACAL, es casado y su núcleo familiar es de dos personas (esposa y un menor).

Este señor se acerca a CEPRODEL con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejoramiento de vivienda ya que sus sueños es ir mejorando poco a poco el lugar donde vive para crear las condiciones necesarias para que su hijo vaya creciendo y se desarrolle, y de esta forma darle un nivel de vida adecuado.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar M. T. lives in the city of Granada, in the department of Granada. He has been working there for three years and eight months as an AS equipment operator at the company ENACAL. He is married and his nuclear family is made up of two people (his wife and a child). 

This man is requesting a loan from field partner CEPRODEL to make improvements to his home since his dream is to slowly improve his home to create the necessary conditions so that his son can grow and develop and thus provide for him an adequate standard of living.

loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Collabinas” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene 02 hijos (1 independiente).  La señora estudio educación secundaria. 
Hace cuatro meses trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de animales vacunos y ovinos.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, comprará 02 animales vacunos y también lanas para la fabricación de sus tejidos como chompas, chullos, bordados y fundas.  Ella recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y el intercambio de palabras con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of Las Collabinas communal bank in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 48, in a common-law marriage, has 2 children (1 an adult) and she studied through secondary school.  Four months ago she started working with the Manuela Ramos Moviment. Her first loan was for 500 new sols which she used for her business of cattle and sheep sales.

With this loan of 1,500 new sols, she wil buy 2 cows and also wool that she uses to knit sweaters, hats, embroidery and, cushion covers.    Her husband helps with expenses as well with his work as a magistrate.

Her dream is to improve her business and get better earnings.

What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings, the punctuality, and the friendly exchanges among the other members.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle and also wool for her knitting business of sweaters, wool hats, embroidery and pillow covers

loans.name: 'favour' Group

texts.en:
Garmai Koinquwe, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Favour'.  She is 35 years old, single, and has three children who are between the ages of 19 to 5 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial difficulty. 

For three years, she has been operating a mini-restaurant in the 'Pipeline Community' on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 27,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, charcoal, tomato, and seasoning.

She describes herself as a jovial woman whose dreams are to grow her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, charcoal, tomato, and seasoning.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, una zona con movimiento comercial y agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a más de quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella  cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí el ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes.  Asimismo ellas se dedica  a la artesanía específicamente a la elaboración de sombreros, El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de dos años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. 

Elva desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes asi como comprar insumos para elaborar sombreros. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elva is 35 years old, married, and she lives together with her family in the district of La Victoria, a commercial and agricultural region located more than fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the region of Lambayeque. 

She has a convenience store installed in her house. From there she sells to her neighbors a variety of products that are of daily use and basic needs and groceries. She is also an artisan, specifically involved in the production of sombreros. Her business is two years old and she has a loyal and stable client base.

Elva wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise in order to satisfy her clients’ demands. She will also purchase materials to make sombreros. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store and to acquire materials to make sombreros.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Ben, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans,  4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de bétail et de condiments.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Ben sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.                                                                     FATOUMATA C. compte acheter des habits pour enfants et adultes avec les revendeurs de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Ben group are all married and average 43 years of age and four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Tomba, a village in Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They trade in clothes, livestock and food condiments. The women of the Ben group are seeking their second group loan, after having repaid the first one without problems.

FATOUMATA C. intends to buy children's and adults' clothing from resellers in Dioïla. She sells in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30) to be used to repay the loan and pay her contributions to social ceremonies, while the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy children's and adults' clothing

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo I. tiene 25 años de edad y vive en el barrio el centro de Marcovia Choluteca, Juan es una persona emprendedora y muy dedicado a su negocio propio, que es venta de abarroteria en general, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion desde hace 4 años,  su pulperia se encuentra en punto estrategico, la afluencia de personas es muy buena y esto hace que tenga muchos clientes.
Juan es honrado y trabajador.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y tener una bonita familia.
texts.en: Sr. Juan Pablo I. is 25 years old and lives in the central neighborhood of Marcovia in Choluteca department. Juan is an enterprising person and very dedicated to his business, which is selling groceries out of his house. He has done this for 4 years. His store is in a strategic location, where the people are very well off, so he has many customers. Juan is honorable and hardworking. He will use the loan to purchase groceries to stock his business. His goal is to make his business grow and to have a nice family.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, butter, margarine, oil, bread, salt, churros, sodas, chicken, sausages, milk, cheese, beef and pork

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam L., 43, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known as one of Angkorean Temples. L. is employed as guard to look after the temples, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a gardener, earning an income of USD 4.5 per day to help cover the famiL. expenses. Each month, the famiL. has to spend USD 41 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie M. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 22 years old. Elmie is single. To make a living, Elmie owns & operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Elmie has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Elmie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmie is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Elmie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Delia Rosa

texts.es: La señora Delia de 34 años de edad, es madre soltera con carga familiar, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con mas de 01 año y medio dedicada al alquiler de la moto taxi, antes tenia una moto taxi que se la vendieron y no tenia los documentos a su nombre y estaba muy usada la cual la vendió y con ahorros que tenía compro una nueva y la da en alquiler actualmente cuida a una niña con lo cual genera otros ingresos, su meta en el futuro es adquirir otra moto taxi para que así le genere mayores ingresos, el préstamo lo utilizara en comprar puertas de la parte del conductor y del pasajero y así brindar una mayor seguridad y mejor servicio a sus clientes ocasionales, la señora delia esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old.  She is a single mother who has two school-age children to support.

Delia has been hiring out a motorcycle taxi for one and a half years.  She used to have a motorcycle taxi which somebody sold to her but the documents were not in her name and it had been very well used.  She sold it and, with some savings that she had, she bought a new one which she hires out.

Delia currently looks after a young girl which earns her additional income.  Her goal for the future is to acquire another motorcycle taxi so that she can make more income.  She will use her loan to buy driver- and passenger-side doors so that she can provide better safety and a better service to her customers.  Delia is very grateful for the trust that is being placed in her.

loans.use: to buy driver- and passenger-side doors

loans.name: Luzvimenda

texts.en:
Luzvimenda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Luzvimenda has a shop that sells spices, vegetables & bananas. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy vegetables, spices & bananas.

Luzvimenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Luzvimenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices & bananas

loans.name: Johnsthan

texts.en:
Johnsthan is a 51-year-old married man.  He runs a food café in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for five years and has been a success. 

Johnsthan has been a KADET LTD client and this marks his third loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to renovate his business premise.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business.

His dreams for the future is to become prosperous and to be able to sustain his family.

loans.use: renovate his business premise

loans.name: Anar's Group

texts.en:
Anar, 48, is the leader of this group. Anar’s family is a typical Kyrgyz family with average income. Anar is a seamstress, while her husband is a construction worker. Despite not having a very high income, Anar is happy with her choice of profession, because she enjoys the process of sewing and designing so much that it’s not even considered as a burden by her. 

Anar’s husband is the main breadwinner, constructing buildings and in addition driving a cab. This is a slow time for Anar’s sewing business, which allowed her to get involved in repairing the local high school. The school was built several decades ago, and is currently in a deplorable condition. Anar, along with other residents of the town, have invested some of their savings in repairing the school building. Presently, the construction is coming to an end. Anar plans to purchase building materials for the roof. With this purpose she approached Kiva lenders. She believes it’s noble work and promises to repay the loan on time without any violations. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a hardworking 44-year-old business lady. She is single and the proud mother of two children who are going to school. She has been selling second hand clothes for the last 20 years to make a living. In the next 5 years she wants to have increased the number of bales she stocks and sells so that she is able to realize her dream of being a major importer of clothes.

She is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to buy second hand clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access funds to inject into her business.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en: Sicily, a 39-year-old single mother of two children, has been running a pharmacy for 14 years. A monthly income of KES 7,000 allows her to support her children. Sicily is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD to increase her stock of medicines. She will use the anticipated additional profit to benefit her children, for whom she hopes to provide a stable life and a good education.

loans.use: to increase her stock of medicines.

loans.name: Betty Gisella

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro  se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 9 y 2 años y medio, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo son socios de una cadena de locales donde venden pollos asados, ellos administran uno de esos locales, allí trabajan todos los días desde las 12 del día hasta las 12 de la noche y cuentan con personal para la atención de los clientes, todos los locales de  esta cadena de asadero de pollos es muy reconocida dentro de la provincia por la calidad de los alimentos que brinda a sus clientes. Ellos llevan seis años trabajando como socios de esta marca y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para invertir en su negocio, van a comprar pollos, papas, arroz, sodas, cervezas y otros productos que se comercializan en su local. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy agradable y las socias son buenas amigas.
 
Sus sueños son seguir mejorando en su negocio y creciendo más con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The communal bank Empresarias con Futuro (Businesswomen with a Future) meets twice a month in El Palmar in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are well visited in every season of the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Señora Betty, who is 34 years old, lives in this place. She is married and has three children, ages 10, 9, and 2 and a half. The two older children are in school. Her husband is a businessman.

She and her husband are members a chain of locations where they sell roasted chicken. They administer one of the locations. They work there every day from noon until midnight, and they have a staff to attend to the customers. All the locations of this chain of chicken-roasting stands are well known within the province for the quality of the foods that they offer their customers. They have been working as members of this chain for six years, and it is going very well for them.

This loan will be invested in their business. They are going to buy chickens, potatoes, rice, sodas, beer, and other products that they sell in their stand. This is their third loan cycle in the communal bank, and they like it because the group is very pleasant and the members are good friends.
 
Their dreams are to continue improving their business and growing more as time goes on.

loans.use: to buy chickens, potatoes, rice, sodas, beer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sheep in order to expand his project and increase the family's income.

loans.name: Bernadet

texts.en:
Bernadet is 36 years old and lives in South Poblacion, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married with three children.

To earn a living, Bernadet has a business selling food and snacks.  She earns about 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Bernadet has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase assorted ingredients for her food vending business.

Bernadet has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight months.  In the future, Bernadet would like to have brighter future for her children and be able to pay the tuition fees for school.

loans.use: to purchase assorted ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 59 years old, and married to a faithful man in their community. The couple is blessed with four children and their youngest is currently studying. To earn an income, Aniceta engaged herself in sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful because she earns about P1,000 every day which is usually used for their daily expenses and allowances.

She wants to increase her usual income, so she requested a loan amount P5,000 to purchase bread and soft drinks as additional products to offer. Hopefully, she can save for her family especially for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase bread and soft drinks as additional products to offer.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 
Flordeliza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Flordeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her son’s laundry business. With the loan, he will buy washing powder, bleach and an iron because he offers his customers an additional service of pressing their clothes.
 
Rasoolan is a very active lady who sells buffalo milk to her community clients. She has kept a buffalo for that purpose at her home. She takes its milk and sells on profit. 

Her son started his business three years ago and is still working hard to get established in his business. Rasoolan is hopeful that after the loan investment, he will be able to increase his profits and improves his clientele base. She always remains worried about the future of her children because she couldn’t provide quality education to her children due to poor financial conditions. That’s why she wants them to do well in their business and secure their future.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rasoolan.

loans.use: To buy washing powder, bleach and an iron for her laundry business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is a fruit seller at Elmina. She fries fish as an accompanying food that she also sells (see the picture above). She is married to a driver and together they live with their 2 children. She helps her spouse to pay the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to acquire fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.use: to acquire fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.name: Arlan

texts.en: Arlan, a 41-year-old married loving father of four children, is a responsible and patient person who grows corn and is requesting a loan of P27,000 to  purchase fertilizer, certified seeds, insecticides, and herbicides, and to pay the labor costs involved in transplanting corn crops for his corn field. Arlan would be thankful to Kiva lenders if they grant him his request, as he can think of no other source for the needed funds. With the help of the loan, Arlan could give his family a better future and educate all of his four children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, certified seeds, insecticides and herbicides and pay the labor costs involved in transplanting corn crops for his corn field

loans.name: Astanakul

texts.ru: Астанакул 59 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он занимается посевом пшеницы, кукурузы, картошки и лука. В этой области он 40 лет. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Astanakul is 59 years old. He is married and has six children. He harvests wheat, corn, potatoes and onions. He has been in this line of work for 40 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Nai, 57, lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a motor-taxi driver and raises chickens. His wife raises pigs at home. Nai is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to provide transportation services more efficiently. By doing so, his family will be able to generate more income. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to provide transportation services more efficiently

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is in her early fifties. She is married, with ten children and six grandchildren. She has been selling fish and charcoal for ten years now. She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly income.

This will be Mwanamkuu’s eighteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to open a new business selling charcoal, and paid back that loan successfully.

She hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and fish. Mwanamkuu’s dream is to one day be able to open a food shop. Mwanamkuu will share this loan with her loan group, "Parachichi," which has seventeen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and fish.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a Palestinian single man.  He has an internet cafe which is the only source of income for him. It is located in a refugee camp where there is good customer movement, and it is a profitable project for him.

Mahdi wants to expand his cafe by purchasing an additional number of computers. That will bring more customers and so increase his income, so Mahdi will take a loan from FATEN to pay. When Mahdi gets the loan, he will be able to expand his cafe by getting an additional number of computers.  This will mean more customers and an increase in income, so he will create for himself better living conditions. Mahdi is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase additional computers for the internet cafe he has

loans.name: Sabali C Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Sabali C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans , 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAZANGASSO, un des villages du cercle de Bla  , 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 2eme  prêt avec l’institution, le prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec MARIAM,  1ere assise de la gauche vers droite  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,50 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Bla et Dougouwolo, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Frais de labour,  achat d’intrants et de semence

loans.name: Jose Cesar

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, tiene cinco hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente José no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace varios años, José trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, José puede trabajar por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general y la compra de llantas nuevas para su auto; de esta manera José tendrá su mototaxi en mejores condiciones, así podrá seguir brindando sus servicios y en poco tiempo espera poder obtener otra motoaxi, para alquilarla y seguir generando ingresos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José is a 50 year old man who lives in Chiclayo.  He has five children whom he loves and who are his reason for living.  He is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic man who puts forth all his effort to getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately José was not able to study for a professional career and had to go to work when he was very young in order to help his parents with the household expenses.  He likes to watch educational TV shows in his spare time and sometimes likes to cook a rice with duck dish to share with his family.

He’s been working as a moto-taxi driver for several years, providing transportation services.  He works every day from early morning and goes out to travel along the streets in search of passengers.  He works about 12 hours daily and believes that things are going well for him because of the good and respectful service he gives his customers. 

José is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to them he is able to maintain his vehicle and buy new tires.  In this way José can have his taxi in better conditions so that he can continue generating income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Madam Ablavi T. is married and mother of three (03) children and one dependant. She was living with her senior sister who was exercising the toothpick selling of which she got the taste. This trade, which exercises today with love and proud, helps her somehow to provide for her needs and to bring a touch to her husband efforts for the household expenditures. She is at her fourth credit of which she has succeeded to well managed and repaid promptly. She is a woman of trusty who deserves to be backed financially. Currently, with this credit of $650 requesting, she will go and buy the toothpicks in whole in Ghana and resell them to retailers at place. She could also expand her activities to small trade of essential products (soap, milk, sugar, etc.). This will allow her to increase her incomes to provide for the family needs.

Madame T. Ablavi est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants en plus d’une personne à sa charge. Elle était restée chez sa grande sœur qui faisait ce commerce de vente de cure dent dont elle a eu le goût. Ce commerce qu’elle exerce aujourd’hui avec amour et fierté, lui permet tant que mal de subvenir à ses besoins et d’apporter un coup de main à son mari pour les dépenses du ménage. Elle est à son quatrième crédit dont elle a su bien gérer et rembourser avec promptitude. Elle est une femme de confiance qui mérite d’être soutenue financièrement. Actuellement, avec ce crédit de $650 sollicité, elle ira acheter les cures dent en gros au Ghana pour les revendre aux détaillants sur place. Elle pourra étendre également ses activités au petit commerce de première nécessité (savon, lait, sucre, etc.). Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour subvenir au besoin de la famille.

loans.use: To buy the toothpicks in whole in Ghana

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Kanyi would like to buy eight more steers.

loans.name: Karani

texts.en: Karani I. is 48 years old and lives with his family in the village of Babuk, near Silistra. His two sons live abroad. He and his wife keep four cows and 3 calves in a cowshed near their house. His small dairy produces about 40 liters of milk a day, which he sells to one of the biggest milk companies in the region. Karani I. is asking for a  loan of $1200, which he will use to make some repairs to his cowshed.

loans.use: To make some repairs to his cowshed

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. José sells groceries from his store, which is located in his home. He learned how to be successful in this trade from his parents, working hard from early in the morning. In addition, he also works on his land cultivating rice, corn, fruits, etc…. He works all day long, without fixed hours. Since the seeding time for rice already passed, at this moment he focuses on his store.

Loan Use

Mr. José wants to use the loan to buy much more merchandise. This way, he will make sure that his assortment is larger than that of other stores to reduce competition, as at this moment all that sets his store apart is his service level. José feels and thinks that with the loan, the future of his store is bright. He builds on his experience to improve his business.

Personal Information

Mr. José is 45 years old and married to Mrs. Juana. They have 3 children, and they pay for the studies of the youngest one thanks to the efforts of himself and his wife. The other children are older. His house is very ordered and cozy, even though it is made of wood. José’s aspirations are to buy more land to make it produce, and this way generate another income that will allow him to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Descripción del Negocio

Don José se dedica a la venta de víveres en su local que se encuentra en su domicilio, ya que es una actividad que por enseñanza de sus progenitores la a sabido aprender y a ejecutar correctamente, trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana. Además llevado de la mano también trabaja en sus tierras cultivando y produciendo cultivos como arroz, maíz, frutales, etc…. Su trabajo lo realiza todo el día sin un horario fijo, aunque la temporada de la siembra de arroz ya paso, solo se dedica de lleno al comercio en su tienda.

Uso del Préstamo

Don José desea adquirir c0n el crédito mucha mas mercadería, de tal manera que tenga su tienda mas surtida que las demás y así no sentir mucho la competencia, ya que la diferencia de su tienda con las demás es la atención que el les brinda. José siente y piensa que con el crédito que solicita el futuro de su tienda mejorara, llevado de la mano con la experiencia que el posee llevara adelante su negocio.

Información Personal

Don José tiene 45 anos de edad esta casado con la Sra. Juana. En la actualidad tienen 3 hijos que gracias al esfuerzo que el realiza junto a su esposa mantiene al menor estudiando. Porque los otros son mayores de edad. Su casa a pesar de ser de estructura de madera es muy ordenada y acogedora. Las aspiraciones de José es comprar tierras para así llegar a producirlas, generando otros ingresos que le permitan darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy more  merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more green maize for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her small business

loans.name: Liz Delzi

texts.es:
Liz is a multitalented woman and has always worked with the purpose of forging a better future for her children. She wants to provide them with economic security. Liz is a single mother and has managed to overcome many obstacles with dignity and without the support of her husband. Her daily motivation is to procure a promising future for her children by way of her work. She has always been able to count on the support of her loving mother in every one of the activities that she has decided to take on. Liz is dedicated to the upbringing and feeding of animals. On the weekends she takes advantage of fairs in neighboring towns to sell typical meals. During her free time she gives out beauty products. Now she wants to move forward with all of the projects she has in mind and she wants to finance a tourist recreational area so that she can secure herself economically and get on with nursing animals. Support this hard-working mother that always wishes to give her best.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Liz, es una mujer multifacética, siempre ha trabajado con el propósito de forjar un futuro mejor para sus hijos y brindarles seguridad económica. Ella es madre soltera y con mucha dignidad ha logrado superar grandes cosas, sola sin el apoyo de su pareja; su motivación diaria es otorgarles a sus dos hijos un futuro prometedor a través de su trabajo y para lograr sus propósitos siempre contó con el respaldo de su querida madre en cada una de las actividades que decidió realizar. Liz en su compañía está dedicada a la crianza y engorde de animales y los fines de semana aprovecha las ferias de cada pueblito aledaño al suyo para vender platos típicos y en las oportunidades y tiempos libres expende productos de belleza.Ahora quiere seguir adelante con todos los proyectos que tiene en mente y desea habilitar un recreo turístico en un terreno que tiene para establecerse mejor económicamente y por ello seguirá trabajando en la crianza de animales.Apoya a esta trabajadora madre que espera dar siempre lo mejor.

loans.use: To fund various ideas and establish a tourist restaurant

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mr. N. Noun is a widower with five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of his children are married and living in different houses with their families. Two sons and one daughter are currently living with him in Po Mongkul village. He is in the business of buying firewood from other provinces and reselling it to a brick kiln at Ponhea Leu district. He started this business in 1995. From 1979 to 1995, he was a farmer and grew rice.    

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now he is requesting another loan in the amount of $500. He will use this money to expand his business, by purchasing more firewood from other provinces and reselling it to a brick kiln at Ponhea Leu district.

loans.use:
To buy firewood from other provinces and resell it to the brick 
kiln at Ponhea Leu district.

loans.name: Roger Cruz

texts.es:
Mr. Roger D. dedicates his life to the selling of spices such as cinnamon, clove, raisins, vinegars, etc. His business got started at teh outskirts of the Leon central market. As time has gone by, he's been able to add his own business in this local market.

He is married and has two children. He works very hard in order to provide them the basic needs. His wife supports him greatly eventhough she's a housewife. She packages the spices in order for him to take them to the market.

Very intelligently, Mr. Roger D. has gone to Ceprodel in order to apply for a loan. These loans have been used to purchase spices. His biggest hope is to purchase more spices that will be sold in his market, this will help him support his family. He's had a record of 20 loans so far.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Roger D. se dedica a la venta de especies como canelas, clavo de olor, pasas, vinagres, etc. Su negocio inició en las aceras del marcado central de León pero a medida que ha transcurrido el tiempo ha logrado un local propio en dicho mercado.

Es casado y padre de dos hijos que se esfuerza día a día para llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación. Su esposa lo apoya grandemente y a pesar de ser ama de casa le envuelve sus productos en bolsas para que luego él los venda en su local.

Muy inteligentemente el señor Roger D. ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de sus especies, hoy en día su mayor anhelo es comprar estos productos para seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar. Su record es de 20 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of spices

loans.name: Elisabeth Saida's Group

texts.en:
Elisabeth, Dionesia, and Elisa are members of the community bank Rumichaka. They have all been members for less than one year. All of the women live in the rural area outside Ayacucho. In that time they have learned to be punctual and responsible, as well as the importance of saving.

Elisabeth is 41 years old, married and has four children. She has several fields where she grows vegetables that she later sells in Ayacuhco.

Dionesia is 36 years old, married and has six children. Like Elisabeth, Dionesia grows vegetables. She sells them to an intermediary who sells them in Ayacucho. Dionesia would eventually like to buy a car so that she can transport her vegetables herself.

Elisa is 22 years old. She lives with her partner and their two children. Elisa also has a field where she grows vegetables. In addition, Elisa grows flowers and raises guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru.

Elisabeth, Dionesia, and Elisa need a loan of $775, which they will use to buy seeds, a car, and animal feed.

Their dreams are to continue improving themselves and their businesses, and that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, a car, and animal feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a single mother of four children. She was unable to acquire basic education which made her unemployable. With her skimpy income from her odd jobs, the needs of the family could not be met. She decided to take a loan from GHAPE with which she invested in the selling of fried puffballs and beans. It also raised money to pay school fees for her children.

She plans to invest in the selling of puffballs and beans. Her business will provide the community with breakfast at a cheaper cost since she is centrally located. Also she is the only one doing the business where she is located. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and repayment shall commence from the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, yeast , groundnut oil, and beans

loans.name: Amina's Mtegemee Mola Group

texts.en:
Amina, age 43, is married with three children (ages 12, 10, and 5). Seven years ago, she began her business selling clothing, juice, bread, and other snacks. She works from 4am to 7pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Amina hopes for a loan to purchase more clothing and ingredients for her business. She will share this loan with Salama, as they are members of loan group Mtegemee Mola. The members of this group guarantee one another to pay back loans.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and clothing to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing O. runs a restaurant, a place where cooked food and drinks are sold. She acquired her skills over eight months. She is 31 years old and married with no children. For her business to keep booming, she must have good customer service. She has been offering this since the commencement of her business in 2005. She lives at Ilufe in Ojo Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan for $850.00 to buy more drinks and food to sell in her restaurant. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger does welding work and makes metal bars to go over windows. He is a widow and has two small children. He is the only one who generates income in his family.

His home is located in the Irpavi II zone in the city of La Paz. He doesn't have his own house, so he lives in a rental house.

This is the first time that he is requesting a credit. It will go towards working capital (purchase of iron and electrodes). Because of his analysis and cash flow, Roger meets the conditions to pay back this first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Roger, realiza trabajos de soldadura y elaboración de ventanas metálicas, es viudo y tiene dos hijos pequeños, es el único que genera ingresos en su familia.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. Y no cuenta con casa propia por lo cual vive en alquiler.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de fierro y electrodos). Por su analisis y evaluación de flujo de fondos, Roger está en condiciones de pagar este primer préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of iron and electrodes for his welding and metal window bar business.

loans.name: Fatuma's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 21, 26, and 17. She is also the caretaker of one other child who is 5 years old. She has owned a small general store since 2005. She works from 8am to 8:30pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $165 from her sales.

Fatuma now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who own cafes, shops, and food businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace F. has been a GHAPE client for nearly seven years.  She is 49, widowed and has six children. 

Grace's first loan was for $38, and she used it to grow yams on her farm. Since that time, she has used other loans to expand her businesses and increase her income. GHAPE has a policy of increasing loan size only when borrowers have shown they are responsible. As a long-standing member with an excellent repayment record, Grace has consistently been able to apply for larger loans over the last two years. 

Grace plans to invest her new loan in a machine for inflating car and motorbike tires. She also plans to hire someone to operate the machine when she cannot be present. 

Sadly, Grace lost her husband when her sons and daughters were very young, but she has used money from previous loans to help buy books and pay her children's school fees. In addition to educating her children, Grace says that she wants to maintain a good house, and save some of her profit to invest in building her business and creating a larger income for herself and her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy a machine to inflate car and motorbike tires.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: Amanda (37), se dedica a la confección de ropa interior (Lencería) desde ya hace muchísimo tiempo, sus prendas las lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de su zona, y desde luego cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo Rolando, quien es trabajador dependiente en una empresa de su zona. Amanda es madre de 4 hijos, los mismos que están estudiando y desea apoyarlos hasta que puedan ser profesionales y sean unas personas buenas y felices.Ahora tiene un propósito, que es poner un taller de lencería, ya que cuenta con una buena gama de clientes, para ello le es necesario un capital, por lo que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Amanda (37) has been making undergarments (lingerie) for a very long time. She sells her garments throughout her zone, counting on the unconditional support of her husband, Rolando, who works for a company in the region. Amanda has 4 children, who are all studying. She wishes to support them until they receive their degrees and become good and happy people. She now has the goal of setting up a lingerie sewing workshop since she has a well-established client-base. For this, she needs to have capital, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Implement lingerie sewing workshop

loans.name: Emily Dickinson Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Emiliy Dickson esta integrado por e mujeres emprendedoras que comparten el deseo de ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, la Sra. Olga es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella inicio con su negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Comenzó hace 4 años ayudando a una vecina a vender calzado después decidió iniciar por su cuenta obteniendo buenos resultados.
