Leonor inicio el negocio ya que en aquel entonces su deseo era tener un negocio en su propia casa y así poder darles la atención necesaria a sus hijos, es por esto que hace aproximadamente hace 15 años empezó con la elaboración y venta de arreglos y manualidades para días festivos, actualmente también vende regalos y hace manualidades a precios muy económicos lo que le permite tener muchos clientes.

Diana inicio con este negocio para poder ayudar un económicamente a su esposo. Comenzó con la venta de calzado por catalogo hace mas de 1 año por que una vecina se los recomendó y actualmente le vende a sus amistades y vecinas.

Ellas necesitan un préstamo de US $850 que pagaran en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con sus negocios. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrán adelante.
texts.en:
The Emiliy Dickinson Group is made up of enterprising women that share the desire to offer a better quality of life to their families. Olga is the coordinator of the group. She started her business to be able to help her husband with the family expenses and to give a better quality of life to her son. She began four years ago helping a neighbor to sell shoes and later decided to sell them on her own obtaining good results. Leonor started the business because back then her desire was to have a business in her home and that way be able to give the necessary attention to her children. It's for that reason that approximately 15 years ago she started making and selling arrangements and handicrafts for holidays. She now also sells gifts and makes handicrafts at very economic prices and that allows her to have many clients. Diana started this business in order to help her husband economically. She started by selling shoes by catalog more than a year ago because a neighbor recommended that and now she sells to her friends and neighbors. These women need a loan for $850, which they will repay in four months, to purchase merchandise and to be able to continue with their businesses. With your help they will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bruna

texts.es:
La señora Bruna es socia del Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  hace 9 años , vive en el Jr. Daniel Espezua Velasco Nº 451 del Distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito- Puno. Tiene 41 años, es separada y madre de 5 hijos que apoya en sus estudios. Bruna con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro materiales para trabajar con  bordados en bayeta. Ella empezó con este negocio cuando se separo de su esposo, tuvo que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y con el apoyo del Banco construyo su casa.

Actualmente vende los trabajos que realiza en Los Uros  y cuando no le alcanza el tiempo  compra bordados hechos de otras personas para no perder a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo  de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara mas material para bordados como lana de diferentes colores, bayeta, etc.
texts.en:
Ms Bruna has been a member of the Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” for the past 9 years. She lives at Nº 451 Jr. Daniel Espezua Velasco in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito-Puno. She is 41 years old, separated, and the mother of 5 children whose schooling she pays for. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($100.00 USD), Bruna increased her working capital and bought materials for embroidery. She started this business when she separated from her husband, as she had to work hard in order to raise her children and with the help of Banco Comunal she built her home. She currently sells the finished embroideries in Los Uros and when time is short, she buys embroideries made by others in order to not lose customers. With this loan of S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles ($500.00 USD) which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy more material for embroidering such as wool of different colours, embroidery fabric, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and embroidery fabric

loans.name: Kaniz M.sharif Group

texts.en:
Kaniz baji is a 58 year old lady and resides in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan.  Pakpattan city is famous for its saint places.  Most people come to this city to visit the saint places for making wishes.  

Kaniz baji is an uneducated woman, but she knows the value of education and knowledge.  She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter.  Her elder son completed his education up until the 8th standard, and started his own work of selling fruit salad.  The next son to him is completing his 10th standard.  Her youngest son is in kindergarten, and her daughter reads in the 5th standard.  Kaniz baji’s husband’s name is M. who is a tailor by profession.  

She wants to see her children well settled.  For this purpose she does embroidery on dresses and sells in cloth shops.  She works day and night to complete one dress.  She sells each embroidered dress for $3.  

She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine to expand her husband’s tailoring business. 

She is a group leader of a few more members from her locality.  Sheema baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy wheat and rice to resell.  Azra baji wants a loan to buy furniture (chairs and a mirror) for her salon.  Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture making business. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan se dedica a la produccion y venta de Batanes, la Esposa se dedica a la produccion y venta de linaza en la avenida suecia, tienen 7 hijos desde 26 a 9 años de edad, los cuales colaboran en las actividades, poseen una casa en la avenida suecia.                                         
Tienen mucha competencia en ambas actividades, pero han logrado establecer una clientela la cual los busca por la calidad de sus productos. Con el credito solicitado ellos compraran materia prima con la cual ampliaran sus negocios lo que les proporcionara mayores ingresos con los cuales seguir mejorando su domicilio y manutencion.                                                         
El anterior credito en Agrocapital se cancelo sin demoras, se trata de clientes muy responsables, los cuales tienen un solo dia de retraso debido que exisitia un embotellamiento y no pudieron llegar a tiempo al Banco.
texts.en:
Juan produces and sells grinding stones (motars). His wife produces and sells flaxseed on Suecia Avenue. They have 7 children, ranging in age from 26 to 9, who help in these activities, and they have a house on Suecia Avenue. They have a lot of competition in both activites but have been able to establish a customer base who buys from them because of the quality of their products. With the loan requested they will buy materials with which they can expand their businesses; this will give them more income with which they can continue to improve and maintain their home. Their previous loan with Agrocapital was repaid on time. They are responsible clients who were behind on a payment only once due to a traffic jam which caused them to not be able to arrive on time to the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital and to purchase materials.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa N., 45, is married and has eight children - two girls and six boys - three in senior high school and the rest in junior high and elementary school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small farming and commercial town not far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

For the past eight years, Yaa has worked very hard trading in bananas and oranges to help her husband take care of the family. Buying bags of oranges and unripe bananas from farmers in the nearby villages, she ripens and then sells the produce to retailers in the local market. Since it has long been her dream to save enough money to support her children in school, she is requesting a loan to procure bananas and oranges in bulk in order to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure bananas and oranges in bulk.

loans.name: Vu

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vụ  năm nay 34 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại huyện Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Sau một thời gian vay vốn và sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả gia đình chị đầu tư vốn  để kinh doanh. Hiện tại chị đang là chủ cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian giúp vợ trong công việc kinh doanh anh còn có thêm nghề sửa chữa đồ điện. Với thu nhập 8.000.000đ/ tháng, cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua thêm dụng cụ, thiết bị phụcvụ cho công việc sửa chữa đồ điện của chồng, phần còn lại chị sẽ sử dụng để kinh daonh hàng tạp hoá
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Vu is 34 yrs old, and lives with her husband and 2 young children in Phuc Yen District in the town of Vinh Phuc. In 2003, she joined TYM fund and secured a loan to invest in raising animals. After a period of utilizing the loan program, her family used the money and invested in doing business. Currently she is the owner of a grocery store. Her husband, in addition to helping her with her store, also has a business in electronics repair. With income of 460 USD per month, her family's living standard is improving everyday. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD with a portion used to purchase additional parts and supplies for her husband's electronics repair business, and the remainder to invest in her grocery store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora tiene la venta D. artesanias (ropas, plata, joyas etc),  en zona turística D. San Francisco D. la ciudad D. La Paz, hace 15 años, trabaja D. lunes a domingo, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, es separada por lo tanto es la unica que trabaja para los gastos familiares ya que el esposo no le ayuda en ningún gasto, es cliente D. nuestra institución hace bastante tiempo demostrando puntualidad en sus créditos, viven en alquiler en unos cuartos en la misma zona con sus tres niños.
texts.en:
Ms. Teodora sells crafts (clothing, silver, jewelry etc.) in the tourist area of San Francisco in the city of La Paz and has for 15 years. She works from Monday to Sunday, has 3 school-age children, is separated and consequently is the only one working to proviD. for the family expenses because her husband does not help her with any expense. She is a client of our institution and has for some time demonstrated punctuality in her loans. She lives in rented rooms in the same area with her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the rent for her business

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Katia es soltera, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Katia se dedica a la venta de pescado en la ciudad de Andahuaylas a donde viaja todos los días sábados. Además Katia se dedica a la preparación de jugos de frutas.
Katia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Katia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 42 years old and is single with 2 children. Every Saturday, Katia travels to the city of Andahuaylas to sell fish. She also makes and sells fruit juices.

Katia is requesting a loan of 1000 soles ($325) to purchase fish. She dreams that her children will obtain good jobs and that her family will become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es: Castulo tiene 44 años, es padre soltero, para progresar y velar por el bienestar de su hijo tiene que trabajar muy duro dejando a su pequeño al cuidado de sus padres, con quienes vive. Al separarse de su pareja su hijo era muy pequeño, pero con el apoyo de sus padres tuvo la posibilidad de trabajar y ahora está dedicado a la venta de ropa para caballeros, y la mayoría de sus clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo. También viaja a algunas provincias para dejar prendas solicitadas que luego cobrará mensualmente, con el benéfico de vender aprecios que  cubran sus gastos de movilidad. Es así que desde hace 5 años esta actividad le está dando la posibilidad, no tan sólo de mantener su hogar, sino también de tener un negocio rentable que pronto estará ubicado en el mercado de su localidad. Castulo no dejará de viajar y ni dejar de atender a sus clientes, pues sus anhelos son de abrir varias tiendas de ropa para caballeros ofreciendo las mejores marcas para distintos gustos y edades. Es nuevo en su grupo, le dieron la oportunidad de ingresar, porque es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, y todas sus compañeras trabajan con suma responsabilidad logrando ganarse la confianza de MFP. Comprar mayores cantidades de prendas es ahora su prioridad, pues pronto llegará el día del padre y quiere tener el capital necesario para atender los diversos pedidos que realizan sus clientes, en ello que invertirá los 1000 soles de su crédito.
texts.en:
Castulo, 44, is a single father. He has to work very hard to progress and watch over the well being of his son. He lives with his parents, and they take care of his son when he works. His son was very little when the boy’s parents separated. But, with the help of his parents, Castulo could work. He now sells men’s clothing. Most of his customers are his colleagues from work. He also travels to some provinces to leave ordered items, and he collects monthly. He benefits from selling at prices that cover his traveling expenses. After 5 years in this business he has the possibility of not only maintaining his home, but he can also have a profitable business that will soon be located in the local market. Castulo will still continue to travel and tend to his customers. His goal is to open various men’s clothing stores offering the best brands for different tastes and ages. He is new to his group. They gave him the opportunity to join because he is a hard working, responsible person. All of his colleagues work responsibly, and they have gained MFP’s confidence. Buying bigger quantities of clothing is now his priority. Father’s Day will soon be here, and he wants to have enough capital to take care of his customers’ diverse orders. He will invest the loan of 1,000 PEN to that end.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: "Before I started tilling my farm, I had been into a lot of struggles. I didn’t have job to support my family and my children are growing and so are their needs," says Edwin D., 30-year-old father of two children. He has been a farmer for five years already. His harvest is what he uses to feed and clothe his family. Edwin is asking a loan of Php 4,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase herbicide, fertilizer and seed. He is also looking to some other possible income areas to supplement their earnings. CEVI aims to help small business grow. It provides not just loans to its clients, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide, fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Jurgen Greyley

texts.es: Jurgen es casado de 36 años de edad, realiza actividad de compra y venta de ganado, habita en estos momentos en casa de los padres de su esposa, esta solicitando este credito para utilizarlo en la construccion de una tapia en la casa que tiene en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan, ya que quiere darle mas seguridad a su esposa, porque ella tendira que estar sola, pues el sale mucho por la actividad que realiza, no tienen hijos, pero su interes es darle mayores condiciones a su vivienda para cuando lleguen los hijos.  Plantea que una vez cancelado este credito continuara trabajando con la institcion, porque le faltan muchos detalles importantes a su casa, una vez concluidos etaran habitandola con mas comodidades.
texts.en:
36-year old Jurgen is married, and his job is buying and selling cattle. At the moment he lives with his parents-in-law. He is asking for a loan to construct a wall around the house that he owns in the neighbourhood of Bosques de Juigalpan. It would provide his wife with greater security because she tends to stay there alone as he is often away because of his work. They don’t yet have any children, but he would like to give them a better place to live in when they do arrive. Once the loan is paid back, Jurgen plans to continue working with the institution (Kiva partner, Afodenic) because his house lacks many important details. When he has completed them, the family will have a much more comfortable house to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas
Mercedes es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes vende frutas en el mercadillo Sr. De Arequipa de manera ambulatoria en una carretilla, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas.
Los sueños de Mercedes son comprar una casa, educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Hormigas Community Bank. Mercedes is 33, married, and she has two children. Mercedes sells fruit on foot from her cart in the Sr. De Arequipa market. She sells every day with some help from her children. Mercedes needs a loan for 400 PEN to buy fruit. Mercedes’ dreams are to buy a house, educate her children, and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mr. Sophat Y., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Phalla Kong, 36, live along National Road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school, and the other one is still very young. 

Sophat and his wife have been selling kachay cake in their village for 26 years. It is a kind of fried cake of Chinese origin. He is applying for his first loan of $1,200 to build a new house with concrete for its foundation.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Eddy Francisco

texts.es: El señor Eddy G. de 42 años de edad, reside en el  reparto los Cedros, comarca Villa del Carmen del municipio de Managua, casado su esposa ama de casa tiene tres hijos de 22, 15 y 18 años, todos los tienen estudiando. Los planes para su familia es brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, mejorando sus condiciones de  vida. Don Eddy se desempeña en el cargo de sub-director catastral desde el inicio del nuevo Gobierno en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen, anteriormente trabajaba como Maestro de obras de un proyecto para el desarrollo. Se le ha presentado dificultades para culminar su meta de construir su vivienda por falta de financiamiento. Da las gracias a  Afodenic por el préstamo,  ya que es un beneficio para  hacer las mejoras para de su vivienda el cual realizara la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, ladrillos y piedrines para el cambio de piso en la parte de la cocina y sala.
texts.en:
Eddy G., aged 42, lives in Los Cedros in the neighborhood of Villa del Carmen in Managua. His wife stays at home. They have three children, aged 22, 18 and 15, who are all studying. He strives to provide his children with a better future by improving their living conditions. Since the institution of the new Government, Eddy has been working in the city hall of Villa del Carmen as a deputy director in the land registry office. Before that he managed a development project.

Eddy was confronted with difficulties to complete the building of his home for lack of funding. Thanks to Afodenic, he will use this loan to make improvements to his home. He will buy building materials such as cement, bricks and gravel to get a new floor in the kitchen and the living room.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to get a new floor in his home

loans.name: Isaura Suyen

texts.es: La joven Isaura Suyen de 27 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, el cual inicio con fondos propios que su marido ayudo, poco a poco ha ido creciendo y son tres años en este negocio. Reside en el barrio Reparto España en la capital de Managua con dos hijos de 4 y 9 años los cuales estudian en la escuela del barrio, con este crédito quiere comprar variedad de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y seguir en las ventas. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener su propia tienda grande. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad con el préstamo que gracia a esto ha logrado superarse y tener sus propios ingresos que son de mucho para su familia.
texts.en:
Young Isaura Suyen, 27, operates a business, selling clothing and footwear, that she started with her own and her husband's savings. The business has grown, little by little, over the last three years. She lives in the Reparto Espana neighborhood of Managua with her two children, 4 and 9, who are studying in local schools. Isaura will use the loan to buy clothing for men, women and children so that she can continue operating her business. In the future, she would like to own her own store. She's grateful to Afodenic for giving her the chance to borrow money for a business that has allowed her to get ahead in the world and have an income that she can use to help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma H., 36 years old, from Malibay, Pasay City.  Her husband Eric, 39, is an auto mechanic.  They have three school-aged children.

Vilma sets up a table in an alley near their house and sells food items which she herself cooks every day.  She also serves fruit shakes of different flavors.  She makes good sales every day primarily because of her business location.  She earns at least P13,000.00 a month.  Recently, she added selling French fries.  At times, she also provides home-based manicures and pedicures services to customers, which is another sure source of additional income for her.    

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2003 and has since been enjoying the many benefits it provides for its members.  Vilma has applied recently for a loan from CCT for P15,000 for expanding her business.  

Vilma works hard because she wants her children to finish school.  She hopes to formalize her stall into a full-blown restaurant someday.  She also dreams of having her own parlor.        



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents Family.

loans.use: For additional capital for her food business

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 1 Group

texts.en:
Arturo is the group coordinator of the solidarity group Unidos Venceremos (together we succeed) based in the rural area surrounding La Romana, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here he makes his home with his wife and three teenage children in a modest home of wooden walls and a tin roof. 

He came to Esperanza a year and a half ago, because he felt that our interest rates and services were significantly lower than the moneylenders in his neighborhood. He has successfully completed two loan cycles with Esperanza and is now requesting his third loan. With this loan he intends to purchase more clothing in bulk, which will cost less and allow him to gain more profits. This will support his business of selling clothing for adults from his home, a trade which he has been successfully plying for over a year now. He will use the profits from his business, which is his family's primary source of income, to purchase better food and school supplies for the children, to paint his house (an important first line defense against termites and weather) and if there is some money left over he would like to purchase a television for his family to enjoy (when there is power of course). His long term goal is to continue growing his business and provide a stable income in the future. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Mr. Hugo lived in the neighborhood of Sta. Margarita around the city of Carapeguá. He is 31 years old and lives with Mrs. Victoria. They have two young children, one of school age and one two years old.
He works as a builder by trade and learned from his father, and he knows many people in the area that he can work for. 
He wants to buy a mixer with the loan to help his work. With the profit he wants to make a modest house where he can live with his family.

loans.use: He wants to buy a mixer

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope U. is 30 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. She also cares for a dependent who is 14 years old. The U. family lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

In her community, Hope owns a small shop selling a variety of different kinds of products as seen in her photo. In this business she has two years experience and employs one person as a helper.

Hope is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more inventory such as rice and cooking oil as well as equipment like a fridge which will allow her to sell more cold products, beverages, etc. This will help to expand her business to serve more customers.

With the profit she hopes to make from this loan, Hope plans to pay the school fees of her child and to save money for the future.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and additional inventory

loans.name: Nedee

texts.en:
Nedee T. is from the village of  Batangan, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 26 years old and married. To make a living, Nedee owns & operates a business  in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products like cosmetics, ladies wear and other items in the local community. Nedee has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nedee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nedee is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nedee from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of cosmetics and ladies wear to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia S. is from the village of Seti, Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years-old and married with four school-aged children. Lilia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, soft drinks and toothpaste in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lilia joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: 02.06.1.4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Phụng  N. Thị is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Phụng is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.06.1.4 Nam Ngạn.

Phụng  is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Phụng operates a family member's repair service business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members.  Phụng  has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Phụng  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Phụng  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Phụng  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị Lan (20) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.
2.  Lê Thị Dần  (21) is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.
3.  P. Thị Thu (22) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.
4.  T. Thị Phượng (23) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.
5.  N. Thị An (24) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Phụng  N. Thị (19) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Phụng  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.06.1.4 Nam Ngạn (02.06.1.4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Phụng  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Phụng  kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Phụng  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Phụng  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Ngô Thị Lan (20) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.
2.  Lê Thị Dần  (21) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.
3.  P. Thị Thu (22) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.
4.  T. Thị Phượng (23) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.
5.  N. Thị An (24) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Kaindi

texts.en:
Kaindi is married with two children, who are both attending school. She has a small grocery business in the Embakasi Village area of Nairobi. She has been in this business for six years and has two employees. She also earns some income from a boutique in Kitui. She recently successfully repaid a loan from Faulu for KES 20,000 and is requesting this loan for KES 60,000 to buy more tomatoes, Irish potatoes, and onions. 

She describes herself as hardworking, honest, and brave and says that since she became a member of Faulu her business has grown. Her hope for the future is simply to provide a quality life and education for her family.

loans.use: buy tomatoes, Irish potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Doris Susana

texts.es:
La señora Doris  R. es socia del  banco comunal Sucre del cantón Montecristi, ella se dedica al comercio informal vende  ropa para niños desde hace cinco años, la mercadería la compra en Guayaquil a los distribuidores  por docenas según el pedido de sus clientes, se maneja con   para dar facilidad de pago  y cobra  por semana. Doris comparte su tiempo entre las ventas  y dar clases porque es maestra en una escuelita de su comunidad.

Su mayor sueño es poder  incrementar su negocio con otras líneas de ropa, este negocio le gusta lo que hace,  le va bastante bien, y le deja buena rentabilidad.

Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá todo en ropa para los niños menores de diez años como pantalones, camisas, y blusas y más.
texts.en:
Ms. Doris R. is a member of the Sucre del Canton Montecristi Communal Bank. She's been selling clothes for children over the past 5 years. She buys merchandise in Guayaquil by the dozen according to her clients orders, and manages payments charging on a weekly basis. She divides her time between her business and her job as a teacher in a school in her community. Her biggest dream is to improve her business and offer other types of clothes. She loves what she does and the business is going well, generating her some profit. With this new loan she will buy new clothes for children under 10 like pants, shirts, t-shirts, and more, in order to resell.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Children's Clothes

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Mrs.Vilma R. is 42 years old. She is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married to a farmer and blessed with four children.  The family operates a sari-sari store and has kept it going for three years. They are fortunate to have a monthly income of PHP 3,000 that they use for their daily consumption. 

Vilma joined Paglaum for their credit services. Now, she is applying for a loan to purchase additional items for her inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To expand her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
United Women is a group of five borrowers led by Oretha D.. She is 41 years old and is married with six children aged 6-21 years old.  Their educational levels are 1st grade to senior high school.  Oretha is now attending the adult literacy school program.

Oretha makes fried doughnuts and sells them to residents of her community in Old Road, Monrovia. She has been running this business for more than two years and hopes to improve her business by purchasing more goods.

Oretha says her doughnuts taste very good which encourages customers to continue buying from her. Oretha will use this loan to purchase more ingredients to increase her doughnut production.  She would eventually like to open a dry goods business, and she dreams of giving her children a good future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making doughnuts.

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu A. (0) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Banyubiru, Jembrana, Bali. Ni Putu is the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ratna S. Group (MUK-0008).

Ni Putu is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK.

Ni Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


 About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


*****************************************************
NI PUTU A. (0) merupakan 34 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota BANYUBIRU-JEMBRANA-BALI. NI PUTU adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah RATNA S. (MUK-0008).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. NI PUTU sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI PUTU menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2008, NI PUTU bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. NI PUTU meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,400,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.

Tentang MUK:
Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old. Her husband is a commercial driver and they have 2 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She sells drinks and groceries to earn a living in Benin City, Edo state. She needs a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

Her dream is to see her business expand and also to see her family have a better standard of living. She says thanks to all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Hacia el Progreso (Women Toward Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, the Dominican Republic's second largest city. Santiago's economy is based around agriculture, and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Maria makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Maria is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothes-selling business by purchasing blouses, underwear, and pants in the main markets and then selling them at a profit in her community. She will use the profits to invest in her goal of owning a vehicle, which will help her continue to expand her business as well as to make her life easier. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear, blouses, and pants to sell

loans.name: Iyn

texts.en:
Iyn M. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao Lanao Del Sur. She is 28 years old. Iyn is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Iyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Iyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Iyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Iyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. Iyn decided to request a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Iyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y  dos hijos menores en su casa propia. Anteriormente apoyaba a su esposo en la sastrería, pero hace 2 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de productos comestibles en su bodega. Desde entonces cada fin de semana acude a los mercados mayoristas para adquirir y abastecer su bodega, siempre con el cuidado de comprar productos que estén dentro de la fecha límite, eso le da mayor seguridad a sus clientes. Este negocio le es rentable, además que le facilita el tenerlo dentro de su domicilio, permitiéndole trabajar todo el día sin descuidar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, para tener más surtida su negocio. Este es su primer crédito es con MFP y por tanto se compromete a pagar oportunamente todas sus cuotas. En su grupo espera contribuir con el bienestar de esta organización. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos comestibles y cumplir con la demanda del cliente.
texts.en:
Edith, 37, is a very cheerful and hard-working woman; she lives with her husband and two minor children in their own home. She used to help her husband in his tailor shop but for the last two years she has sold food items in her grocery store. Every weekend she goes to the wholesale markets to buy stock items for her store always being careful to buy products that are still within their “sell by” dates; her customers feel more secure this way. This is a profitable business and, having it located at home, allows her to tend to it without neglecting her family. Her greatest wish is to increase working capital so that she can have a wider selection of goods available. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She hopes to contribute to her group’s wellbeing. She will use the requested funds to buy food items to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a su unico hijo dependiente en el anexo Las Mercedes del caserío Lagartera, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, conformado en su mayoría por un conjunto de caseríos que distan mucho uno de otro. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años, el cría ovejas y cabras en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, para asegurarse el buen desarrollo de sus animales les brinda alimento balanceado y pastos naturales. Cada quince dias se dirige al mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo para ofrecer a sus animales en venta. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para su economía,adicionalmente se dedica al trabajo agrícola en los diversos campos de cultivos de la zona.

Hipólito desea adquirir mas animales y alimento balanceado para criarlos y venderlos. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro de su objetivo.

Hipólito, al igual que la mayor parte de pobladores de la zona, es una persona honrada, de vida sencilla y apacible. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and only son in the Las Mercedes annex of the Lagartera living area, a rural area in the Mórrope district. It is located in the Lambayeque province and is one hour and 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo He has been raising sheep and goats in corals behind his home, for more than years. He makes sure to provide his animals with a balanced diet in order to ensure their good development. He travels to the Moshoqueque market in Chiclayo every two weeks to sell his animals. He also raises crops in the nearby fields. Hipólito would like to acquire more animals and feed, so he has requested this loan of 2,000 PEN ($700) through Edpyme Alternativa, to help him reach his goal. Hipólito, like most of the other people in his zone, is honest and leads a simple life. His greatest desire is to continue to work in order to offer his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock and feed

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María Concepción A. P., tiene 37 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es casada y vive con sus cuatro hijos  Héctor, Dani, Emely, de las edades de 11, 13, 15 y 18 respectivamente, ella tienes una tienda donde vende productos de la canasta básica.
El negocio lo empezó hace cinco años, cuando vio que no había una tienda cercana, decidió comenzar a invertir sus ahorros y con ayuda de su esposo, emprendió su negocio donde comercializa productos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, jabón, desinfectantes y otros productos de primera necesidad.
María es una persona responsable y trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado manejar bien su tienda, actualmente ella se ha visto en la necesidad de adquirir un préstamo para invertirlo en compra de artículos y tener variedad de productos en su tienda, ella quiere comprar al mayoreo a un precio más bajo (arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, jabón, desinfectantes), aumentar las ventas.
Sus aspiraciones de negocio es tener una tienda surtida para poder aumentar sus ganancias y apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando, y que ellos puedan lograr ser personas profesionales, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
María Concepción A. P., 37, lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazan department. She is married and lives with her four children: Hector, Dani, Emely, ages 11, 13, 15 and 18 respectively. She has a store where she sells basic staples. She started her business five years ago: when she saw that there was no store nearby, she decided to start to invest her savings and with her husband's help she launched this business where she sells products such as rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, ham, disinfectants and other basic needs products. Maria is a responsible and hard-working person who, thanks to her hard work, has achieved good management of her store. She now finds it necessary to acquire a loan to invest in the purchase of products to have a variety of products in her store. She wants to buy wholesale at a lower price (rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, ham, disinfectants) to increase her sales. Her aspirations are to have a well-stocked store to increase her earnings and support her children who are studying; and for them to become professionals, since she did not have the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, ham, disinfectants and other items

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin S., age 27, lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two and a half hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. To support this farm, Mrs. Sarin S. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy a harvesting machine to support her farming crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Phay Oeng, breeds ducks. He is able to help support his family by earning a small income selling duck eggs in the community. 

This couple has three children: two are very young and one is attending the local school. Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a harvesting machine

loans.name: Wolale Vii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE VII est constitué de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la  préfecture SAN, (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 46  ans et au moins 8  enfants. Elles cultivent  de l’arachide, du fonio et du sésame. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents qui étaient des prêts solidaires, elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne.
ZELE D. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de fonio d’arachide  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe WOLALE VII comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de11000 à 13000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Wolale VII Group are married women living in Cinzara, a village in the prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. On average, they are 46 years old and have at least eight children. They grow groundnuts, fonio and sesame. In order to ensure that their agricultural investments are profitable, the members of Wolale I Group decided two years ago to participate in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having properly repaid their previous loans, which were solidarity loans, they apply now for their first farming loan. Zele D. wants to use her loan to buy adequate quantities of fonio and groundnut seeds, small equipment and farming supplies at the great market in San. After the rainy season, the harvest will be warehoused long enough for its value to increase, before it is sold at the great market in San and at the nearby markets, retail (or often wholesale) for cash to customers who mostly come from big towns. After their produce is sold, the members of Wolale VII Group expect to make a profit of 11,000 to 13,000 CFA francs each, which they will use to pay the interest on the loan and ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Fátima es madre soltera de 30 años de edad, el pequeño estudia la primaria, ella se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, y así mismo es asalariada de una zona franca, con sus ahorros fue que consiguió el dinero necesario para empezar su pequeño negocio el cual hoy en día le representa un ingreso importante en su vida.

Ella habita en una casa humilde que ha construido de su esfuerzo propio, pero las limitaciones económicas no le permiten terminar las edificaciones de las regeneraciones de su vivienda, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, esta inversión le beneficiara al desarrollo optimo de su pequeño hijo sobretodo que no tiene a ningún familiar que le apoye económicamente.
texts.en:
Fátima is a thirty-year-old single mother. Her little one is studying in primary school. She works selling cosmetics and is employed in a tax free zone. With her savings she was able to begin her small business which today represents an important part of her income. She lives in a humble house that she has built of her own initiative, but her economic limitations do not allow her to complete the building or the repairs to her home. This is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials. This investment will benefit the development of her young son above all else because he has no family members who support him economically.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall, construction materials

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran helps to support her family through her work as a seamstress. She receives orders from her neighbors and relatives, and earns between 100 and 150 PKRs for each dress she makes. This allows her to pay for her family's utility expenses.
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah in order to help her husband, a private entrepreneur with a fruit-vending cart business. He visits different streets of the city with his cart, selling his wares. With this loan, he will buy seasonal fruits in bulk. Manzooran is hopeful that by adding more seasonal fruits to his cart, her husband will be able to increase his income and, as a result, improve the family's standard of living.
  
Manzooran is in her fourth loan cycle and is a very responsible Asasah borrower. She has paid all her installments on time and has never missed any meetings.

Manzooran lives in the city of Borewala, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. For the past 30 years, she has lived in a three-room brick house with her husband and their two sons, who for financial reasons were unable to complete their educations and help to support the family financially. Her eldest son is a street hawker who sells edible items such as nimko and chips, and the younger son works in the manufacture of furniture.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits for sale

loans.name: Judith Aracely

texts.es:
Judith de 46 años, ella tiene un taller de confección y costura en la sala de su casa. Vive en una zona urbana llamada “Suburbio” caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.  

Empezó hace 15 años cociendo ropa poco a poco con la insistencia de la mama pudo comprar unas maquinas de coser y ubicar el taller de confección en la sala de su casa. Confecciona todo tipo de ropa como camisas, busas, vestido.  Su horario de trabaja ahora es variado porque tiene un hijo de 9 años que todavía esta en escuela. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y pinturas para remodelar su casa y tener mas espacio para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su negocio y tener una pequeña papelería.
texts.en:
Judith, 46, has a sewing shop in her living room. She lives in an urban zone called “Suburbio” that is characterized by most of its residents being informal merchants. She started sewing gradually 15 years ago and thanks to her mother’s insistence was able to buy sewing machines and set up a shop in her living room. She makes all kinds of clothes like: shirts, blouses and dresses. Her work schedule is variable because she has a 9-year-old son who’s still in school. She will use the loan to buy cement and paint to remodel her house to have more space for her business. In the future she’d like her business to be larger and also to have a small stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and paint.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion M. is a 32-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store business. She lives in Brgy. Guiwang, Alcoy, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Salvacion is now borrowing 11,000 PHP so that she can purchase more goods for her general store. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Salvacion aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase of stock to sell

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 34 years old. Jimmy is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jimmy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jimmy is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Gina is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling both food like canned goods & instant noodles & daily use products like candles and bath soaps in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es:
La señora Juana Isidra G. B. es comerciante se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en un tramo en la esquina del Mercado frente al Mundo Elegante, vende tomates, cebolla, chiltomas, zanahorias, churros, cajeta de leche y frutas peladas empacadas en bolsitas.
Doña Juana G.  es una señora de unos 70 años es acompañada tiene 6 hijos en total pero ninguno depende de ella todos son independientes y casados, lleva ya trabajando con CEPRODEL desde el año 2004 y ha obtenido 41 creditos.
texts.en:
Juana Isidra G. B. is a merchant who sells fruits and vegetables from a stand at the corner of the market in front of the Mundo Elegante store.  She sells tomatoes, onions, chiltomas (small peppers), carrots, churros, milk caramel and peeled fruit packed in bags.  

Juana G. is a 70 year-old woman who has a partner and 6 children.  None of her children are are dependent; they are all married and live independently.  She has been working with CEPRODEL since 2004, and over that time she has taken 41 loans.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
ALICE MFOULOU N.

Madame Alice est dans l’habillement des enfants depuis 18ans, son stock est souvent renouvelé car elle fait des commandes dans les pays comme : la chine,  Cotonou et l' Afrique du sud.
Le prêt passé lui a permis d’acheter : des robes, des pantalons jeans mixtes, des chaussettes, des  chemisiers et polos, des sandales,  chaussures et autres articles pour enfants.
Ses revenus journaliers sont passés de 25000f à 60000f car elle avait les articles de qualites, rares a des prix abordables.   

Le prêt prochain sera le bien venu car il  arrive au moment des fêtes des enfants, car idéal pour elle serait de s'approvisionner en robettes, des robes, des culottes des ensembles vestes,pantalons, jupes, des chemises,
Sandales, chaussures, slips…
Elle a reçu les enseignements sur la gestion de son commerce et veut en profiter  pour faire plus de bénéfices.
Elle est entrain de s'investir pour aller a bout de son projet; devenir une femme d'affaire de renommee.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alice has been in the children's clothing business for 18 years. Her stock is constantly changing because she orders from places such as China, Cotonou (Benin), and South Africa. Her last loan allowed her to buy dresses, pants, men's and women's jeans, socks, men's shirts and polos, sandals, shoes, and other children's clothing.

Her daily income has gone from 25,000 to 60,000 francs because she has quality clothing, rare at affordable prices. The upcoming loan will be most welcome, as it comes at the same time as the children's holidays. Ideally she will be able to stock pinafores, dresses, pants, suits, trousers, skirts, blouses, sandals, shoes, and underwear.

She has received business management training and would like to use it to increase her profits. She is committed to reaching her goal:  becoming a well-known business woman.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for children, women, and men

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group, Con Dios Adelante 1 & 2 (Forward with God). She lives in a modest home with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge was when she became a widow. She enjoys attending church and worshiping God and plans to continue to do so in the future.

Marie is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for five years, starting when she first decided to sell clothes and bought a bag of used clothing. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying more clothes. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to respond to her household's needs.

This Esperanza associate set out with us because she wanted to start a business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Alyeri

texts.es:
Alyeri  B. Lopez estuvo 8 trabajando en tiendas comerciales, pero su liderazgo y deseos de superarse  la llevo a montar su propia tiendita de ropa hace 3 meses.
A sus 27 años y solo con el apoyo de sus 2 hijos Alyeri ha logrado crear su propio negocio, pero ahora ella se ha dado cuenta que necesita un microcrédito para mejorar las condiciones de la tienda y hace crecer como micro empresaria. Es por eso que ella necesita ₡600 000(seiscientos mil colones) para  la compra de mas ropa y mercadería en general para tener más variedad en su tienda.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Alyeri  B. Lopez worked for 8 years in commercial stores, but her leadership qualities and her determination to succeed led her to start up her own clothing store 3 months ago.

At 27, with no one to assist her except her 2 children, Alyeri has managed to create her own business.  But she now realizes that she needs a small loan to improve her store and make her small business grow.  For this reason she needs 600,000 colones to buy clothing and general merchandise, so that she can have a greater variety of goods to sell in her store. 

She is a member of the communal bank "Manantial de Santa Fe," which is one of the 100 groups that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Yemira

texts.es:
Yemira es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene un hijo que depende económicamente de ella, realizo estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja desde hace siete años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el primer préstamo que solicitó fue S/.300.00 nuevos soles la que invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes, ahora se dedica a la venta de chanchos y quesos.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma  de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, comprará ocho unidades de chanchos regulares y 70 kilos de quesos, es ayudada por su hermana en el negocio y su esposo tiene otro empleo.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia, tener un carro para pasear y tener ahorros para su hijo.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la solidaridad, la puntualidad y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Yemira is a member of the "12th of August" communal bank, from the district, province and region called Puno. She is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and has a son, who depends upon her to provide for him. She completed her education to college level. 

She has been working with [the field partner] Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years. The first loan she sought was for 3,000 Soles, which she invested in her grocery store. Now she dedicates her time to selling pigs and cheeses. She is seeking a loan of 1,200 Soles, money that she will invest in her business. She will buy 8 pigs and 70 kilos of cheeses. 

Her sister helps with the business and her husband has other employment. Yemira dreams of having her own house, a car to go around in, and savings for her son. What she likes about the communal bank is the solidarity, the timeliness, and being able to access a loan from the communal bank's internal account.

loans.use: To buy 8 pigs, and cheeses

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Issa D.  40 ans, polygame et père de six  enfants dont 4 garçons et 2 filles, il réside avec ses quatre femmes et leurs enfants à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture et autres, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de Pois Sucré, noix de karité et de céréales il y a 10 ans. Avec cette grande expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et renommée et reçoit beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. 
Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant  2 ans  et a bénéficié  de trois prêts qui ont été correctement remboursés. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite ainsi ce quatrième prêt au niveau de l’institution qui lui permettra d’acheter, 10 sacs de pois sucré, 3 tonnes de maïs, 5 sacs de mil et 10 sacs de noix de karité. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso et les stocke dans son magasin situé au nouveau marché de  Médine Sikasso, ensuite il les ramène à Abidjan et à Bobo Dioulasso (respectivement dans les république de Côte d’Ivoire et Burkina Faso) sur commande des usines de fabrique de jus de pois sucré et de beure de karité. Il vend les céréales à la fois en gros et en détail.    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa D. is 40 years old, he is polygamous and the father of six children, 4 boys and 2 girls. He lives with his four wives and their children in Medine, a popular quarter in the village of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

After having tried many different business activities without success, notably agriculture and others, he soon started out the business of storage and sale of sweet peas, shea nuts, and cereal grains. He has been 10 years in the business. With this great amount of experience in the field, he enjoys a solid reputation and fame, and he receives many out of country orders. But he lacks the necessary resources to satisfy the demand.

Therefore he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) two years ago and since then he has accessed three loans, all of which were successfully repaid. 

With the goal of satisfying the demand of an ever growing clientele, he requests a fourth loan from the institution. He will be able to purchase 10 sacks of sweet peas, 3 tons of corn, 5 sacks of millet, and 10 sacks of shea nuts. 

He makes his purchases in the surrounding regions of Sikasso and he stores the products in his store located in the new market of Medine Sikasso. He later transports the products to Abidjian and Bobo Dioulasso (located in the Republic of Ivory Coast and Burkina Faso, respectively) on demand from sweet pea juice factories and shea butter factories. He sells cereal grains both on wholesale and in retail. 

With the help of this loan he expects to earn a monthly income of 200 000FCFA. This income will serve to provide for his basic needs and those of his family, as well as to repay his loan and to invest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase sweet peas and shea nuts.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es:
Don Omar Enrique M. S., es trabajador de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillados, desempeñando el cargo de Operador de Planta de Tratamiento de Aguas Residuales, desde hace dos años y medio.

Es acompañado, de 35 años de edad, tiene dos personas a su cargo. El vive en la Ciudad de Managua Municipio de Managua en la comarca de Cuajachillo.

Este crédito lo utilizará para la compra de materiales de construcción para edificar su vivienda. Agradece a CEPRODEL por darle este préstamo que es el primero.
texts.en:
Don Omar Enrique M. S. has worked as a water treament plant operator at an aqueduct and sewage company for two and a half years.

He is 35 years old, has a partner, and two people under his care.  He lives in the city of Managua in Cuajachillo county.

He plans to use the loan to buy construction materials to build a house.  He is grateful to CEPRODEL for granting him this first loan.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his house

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio M. de 48 años es el propietario de la panaderìa refresqueria y salsamentaria “EL Triunfo”; èl es casado y  padre de 3 hijos en la edades de 13 a 17 años. Procedente de Concordia  en el departamento del Magdalena, pueblo donde naciò , llegò desde muy joven a la ciudad de Barranquilla con sus padres,  estudiò aquì su bachillerato para  posteriormente graduarse como tecnico en sistemas, actividad en la que trabajò para una empresa por varios años, tiempo en el que tambien  contrajo matrimonio. Cinco años despues decidiò desarrollar su espiritu emprendedor mediante  una iniciativa de negocio de panaderìa, en la que hoy tiene una experiencia de 15 años, actividad ha ido ampliando complementandola con comidas ràpidas y asadero de pollo.
En la actualidad esta aplicando a su tercer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organizaciòn con la que ha logrado formalizar y legalizar su negocio, e incrementar su capital de trabajo.
