Con este, su credikiva comprarà harina, grasa, mantequilla, azucar, sal levaduras, queso, inversiòn que proyecta ser exitosa por el sitios estratègico donde se encuentra ubicado y por su gran experiencia en el manejo de la fabricaciòn de estos productos, que resultan ser una delicia al comerlos diariamente calienticos. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales exitosos y gente de bien , por eso unido con su familia trabaja persistentemente para lograr este gran desafio de prosperidad personal, familiar y empresarial. Su negocio se ha sostenido aunque la competencia en la venta de pollos asados es muy fuerte, pero la calidad en el servicio y en la oferta que Juan Antonio tiene  siempre se ha impuesto. Asì ha sostenido la rotacion de sus cuentas de un dia, rotaciòn de sus  inventarios en 7 dias,  su rentabilidad en un 25% , su capacidad de pago es del 69%,  mientras su endeudamiento actual es de 31% y futuro aplicandole este financiamiento es de 33%. Para Juan Antonio cada dia representa un reto personal al que se enfrenta para cumplir con las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio M., 48, owns a bakery/snack shop/cured meats shop called “El Triunfo.”  He’s married and the father of three children whose ages range from 13 to 17.  He is originally from Concordia in Magdalena department, the town where he was born.  He came to Barranquilla very young with his parents.  He studied high school here and later graduated as a Systems Technician, a job he worked at in a firm for several years, time in which he also got married.  Five years later he decided to develop his entrepreneurial spirit opening a bakery.  To date he has 15 years experience.  He has added to the main activity fast food and roasted chickens.

Presently he’s applying for his 3rd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which he has managed to formalize and legalize his business and increase his working capital.  He will use this Kiva loan to buy flour, shortening, butter, sugar, salt, yeast and cheese.  He projects that the investment will be successful because of the strategic location his business has and because of the vast experience he has manufacturing these products that have become a delicacy when eaten daily warm from the oven.

His dream is that his children become successful professionals and upstanding citizens.  This is why, together with his family, he works persistently to overcome this great challenge of personal, family and business prosperity.

His business has survived even though competition in roasted chicken sales is very heavy but the quality of the service and of the goods Juan Antonio offers has always stood out.

Thus he has maintained an account rotation of one day, inventory rotation in 7 days, his profit margin is 25%, his capacity of payment is 69% while his current debt is 31% and applying this new loan his future debt will be 33%.  For Juan Antonio each day means a personal challenge that he faces to meet the goals he’s established for himself.

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of wheat flour, shortening, butter, sugar, salt, yeast and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fees and to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Djurabek

texts.en: Djurabek lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. He is married and the loving father of 4 children. He works very hard because he wants to expand his business. He has been in this business for 5 years. He sells foodstuffs such as pasta, sugar, coffee, sweets and others in the market. Djurabek is requesting a loan of 2,200 USD to purchase foodstuffs for his store. He is hoping to see his business expand and grow consistently. Djurabek has a cheerful personality which is always a positive factor in his work with his customers. He is willing to work really hard to see his business flourish in the future. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for his store.

loans.name: Edgar Alexander

texts.es: Edgar tiene una tienda en el Barrio Santo Domingo, al suroccidente de la ciudad e Barranquilla,  donde vende al detalle todos los productos de la canasta familiar; desde que iniciò este negocio siempre pensó en lograr satisfacer las necesidades de alimento de los hogares vecinos, porque antes de su emprendimento  las amas de casa, no tenian como hacerlo de una manera economica, en unidades de medias posibles de comprar y sobre todo que estuviera muy cerca su casa. Su sueño ahora es adicionarle una gran miscelanea, hasta convertirla en un almacen, asi mismo conseguir un sitio para construir un establecimiento donde funcione  su granero. Mientras tanto trabaja diariamente en amplias  jornadas y con un margen de rentabilidad  no menor del 20%, para lograr alcanzar sus metas personales y familiares. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará ranchos, viveres, carnes, bebidas y licores, para surtir su tienda y aumentar su capital de trabajo, pues con esta compra de contado, logrará sostener los precios a sus clientes y obtener unas mejores utilidades en su negocio, lo cual garantiza el éxito de esta inversiòn.
texts.en:
Edgar has a store in the neighborhood of Santo Domingo, in the southwest of the city of Barranquilla, where he sells all of the staple goods. Since he began this business he has always thought about satisfying the food needs of the neighboring homes, because before he began his store the housewives didn't have a place to go and buy things that were affordable, on a small scale and, most importantly, very close to home.

His dream is to add a great selection of things, until he becomes a warehouse. He would also like to get a site to construct a building for a granary. Meanwhile, he works long shifts every day and maintains a profit margin of at least 20% to meet his personal and familial goals. 

With his Kiva loan, which is his first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, he will buy food, provisions, meat, drinks and liquor to stock his store and increase his business capital. With this cash purchase, he will be able to maintain prices for his customers and get better profits from his business, which guarantees the success of this investment.

loans.use: to buy food, provisions, meat, drinks and liquors

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San H. is 30 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than six years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing activities, or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Toem Sim, 37, who works as a fisherman in and around the lakes of his community. They have three children: two are single and live with them, while the third child is married and lives independently. 

Currently, San H.'s house has broken in a few places, making it so difficult for her and her family to live there. Because of this reason, San H. requested a loan in order to buy some planks for mending her broken house.

loans.use: to buy some planks for mending her broken house.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the village of Gaston, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Erlinda is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Juan, el es originario del departamento de León, de 46 años de edad, esta casado, es padre de familia, tiene 5 hijos, el mantiene a 3 de ellos pues el resto son mayores y viven independientes de el , don Juan se dedica a la tapicería de muebles y asientos de vehículos. Inicio este negocio cuando el tenia 18 años de edad cuando se caso con su primera esposa  el heredo el negocio de su suegro , el enviudo a los 23 años, fue cuando el instalo por su cuenta en un nuevo lugar el negocio propio de tapizar muebles, después se fue a los Estados Unidos a trabajar en una compañía donde elaboraban muebles esa experiencia fue de 4 años después regreso a su ciudad a trabajar y poner su negocio empleando sus conocimientos adquiridos. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar material de trabajo como cuero, damasco, rollos, hilos, grapas, alfombras, esponjas para tapizar (forrar) muebles y vehículos. Este crédito le ayudara a desarrollar su negocio, tener más productos que ofrecer y a comprar mas material de trabajo para producir mas. El planea en lo futuro poner una mueblería, pues le gustaría expandirse en la zona de occidente instalar mini tiendas en Chinandega.
texts.en:
Juan is originally from the department of Leon. He is 46 years old, married, and he is the father of a family. He has 5 children although he supports 3 because the others are grown and they live independently. Juan is a furniture and automotive upholsterer. He started this business when he was 18 years old and when he married his first wife he inherited the business from his father-in-law. He became a widow when he was 23 and that is when he moved his business to his own space to work upholstering furniture. He went to the United States to work for a furniture company. That experience lasted 4 years and later he came back to his city of origin to work and to put into practice the skills he acquired.

He requested a loan to purchase materials to work with, such as leather, damask fabric, rolls, threads, staples, carpeting, upholstering foam (liners) for furniture and vehicles. This loan will help him to develop his business and to have more products to offer. He will be able to purchase more materials for his business to increase production. In the future he wants to start a furniture store. He would like to expand into a western region and to start up a small store in Chinandega.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as leather, damask fabrics, rolls, threads, staples, carpeting, and sponges to upholster furniture and vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the construction of a dairy unit

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a businessman and is 46 years old. He is married to Purity who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children. He has been a farmer and a retail shopkeeper for the past thirteen years with the monthly income of about $220 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Richard will use the loan to purchase farm supplies; i.e. farm manure and seedlings, and he will also purchase more stock for his retail shop; e.g. sugar, rice, flour etc.

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. 

His hope and dream is to concentrate on his children’s education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase farm manure, seedlings and more stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Ayesh

texts.en:
Ayesh is a 22-year-old man from the Jabalia refugee camp in the Gaza Strip. He lives with his parents. Ayesh wants a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase his own bedroom furniture. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee in the Jabalia Refugee camp; while his salary isn't enough to buy the furniture outright, paying back FATEN on a monthly basis will be doable.

Ayesh is pictured in FATEN's office in the Jabalia Refugee camp.

loans.use: to purchase a new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase piglets and construct a unit for housing them

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 26 years old and supports two members of his family. He buys and sells second hand clothing and has been in the business for a period of two years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first term loan and hopes to use the money to purchase a bale of quality jean trousers and tshirts.  

The profits will be used to start a barber shop and purchase a lead battery charger for his business.He hopes to be self sustainable and improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of second hand clothing

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene 31 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene 5 hijos, uno mayor de edad y cuatro que estudian en colegio y escuela, todos sus hijos viven en Colombia país en el cual vivió por muchos años pero que por motivos personales dejo y regreso a esta linda ciudad. 

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario y así poder salir delante de una forma honrada hace más de dos años decidió instalar un pequeño restaurante en la ciudad de Manta, en el cual prepara variedad de platos que son degustados por sus clientes que día a día acuden a su local, vende almuerzos y platos a la carta. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de una persona a quien le paga un sueldo. Ella está muy contenta con su negocio ya que le encanta la cocina y todo lo que prepara lo hace con mucho amor por eso le quedan mucho más deliciosos sus platos.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos así como también sodas, aguas, jugos, cervezas y otros productos que vende en su local. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos a pesar que se le hace complicado ir  a las reuniones quincenales.
 
Sus sueños son tener una casa y local propio ya que donde esta es alquilado.
texts.en: The Empresarias Con Futuro Community Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, Ecuador, which is known for its beautiful beaches and for being a city of unmatched beauty with many tourist attractions. It is here we find Luz, who is 31 and single, but has five children from a long-term relationship. One is full grown, while the other four are still in school. They all live in Colombia, where she lived for many years but for personal reasons left to return to this beautiful city. Luz, to earn her daily bread and to make headway in a honorable way, decided to open a small restaurant in the city more than two years ago. She prepares a variety of meals enjoyed by the customers who day-to-day visit her restaurant, selling lunches and dishes a la carte. She works every day and is helped by another person whom she pays. Luz is very content with her business since she loves to cook, and everything she prepares is done with a lot of love, which make her meals even more delicious. She plans the use the loan to purchase supplies to make her meals as well as sodas, waters, juices, beers and other items to sell at her restaurant. This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank, and she enjoys the loans even though it's hard to make the meetings every 15 days. Her dream is to have her own home and storefront since she currently rents.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, sodas, waters, juices, beers, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 41 years old and married to Patrick. They are blessed with one child aged fifteen years old. She has been running her green grocer business for the past two years with a monthly income of 5,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy kale, tomatoes and potatoes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy kale, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married with three school-aged children. Julieta is 36 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store at home and has had this business for one year. Her husband works as a carpenter but by project only and is absolutely not working permanently. The couple is working together to reach their dream of giving a proper education to their children and having spare time for family bonding. For all the hard work exerted by the couple, each month they earn a total of PHP 800. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional store inventory to continue serving the community members and earning in return.

Julieta is a longtime member of GDMPC, since 2007 specifically. She successfully paid in full her previous loan of PHP 5,000. In the future, Julieta hopes to sustain business operations and save a portion of her monthly earnings for future needs. She plans to repair their house to live comfortably.

loans.use: To purchase additional store inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has three children who are 7, 5 and 2 years old. In 1999, Kadiatu established her imported foodstuffs business. She began her business out of the need to service the neighbors and provide a livelihood for her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy more imported foodstuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to continue providing support to her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more imported foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 39-year-old beautician. She lives in Ho Chi Minh city. Diep runs a beauty shop from her house. She began working in this profession eight years ago.

Diep is requesting a loan to buy hair dryers, steamers, stretching machines and other basic supplies for her beauty shop.  She also wants to take part in some courses related to makeup art.   She hopes that this will enabL. her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. 

Diep hopes that through this loan she will be abL. to generate a higher income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: buy beauty shop equipment and take makeup classes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 41 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Demetria de 41 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy temprano, Juan sale a trabajar a su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo y hacer más fértil sus tierras, para así obtener una buena cosecha. Los productos que siembra son: la hoja de coca, el café y el cacao, que son vendidos en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde tiene muchos compradores, debido a la calidad de éstos frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos dañen su salud. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP; por tanto espera una vez más de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos y seguir trabajando. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y le gusta ser participe de las reuniones que se realiza.
Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, podrá comprar plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man, 41 years old, who lives in his own house together with his wife, Demetria, 41, and his two dear children who are the reason for all of his efforts.  Juan leaves to work on his farm very early. He knows that he has to put all his efforts into making his lands more fertile in order to have a good harvest. He plants coca leaf, coffee and cacao which are sold in the city of San Francisco, where he has many buyers due to the quality of his crop.

What he likes most about his work is planting his fields and he does so with a great deal of patience. He has been doing this work for 21 years and considers that the most difficult task is fumigating his fields since he always runs the risk that the chemicals will damage his health. 

This will be his fourth loan with MFP and he hopes to secure their collaboration one more time in order to continue working and meeting his goals. He is very happy in his communal bank and he enjoys being a participant in bank meetings. With the 2,000 soles he requested he will be able to buy cacao and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy cacao and coffee plants.

loans.name: Rolev

texts.en:
Rolev is from the village of Mohon, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Rolev is married and has three adult aged children.

To make a living, Rolev owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products. Rolev has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rolev is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to resell.

In 2010, Rolev joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is a 40-year-old married man with two children aged 14 and 10. Hilario is engaged in fishing, seaweed farming, and rice farming. His main source of income is fishing. He works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school.

Hilario requested this loan to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets. He hopes to improve his fishing business with this loan.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Aramazan

texts.en:
Aramazan is a fifty five year old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.

His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. He has been operating a retail shop for thirty years, which he started with capital of twenty thousand UGX but which has grown to more than two million UGX. His major challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, however, he has a goal of expanding business into new markets. 

Aramazan wants a loan to buy materials to construct his house.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct his house.

loans.name: Sosorburam

texts.en:
Sosorburam is 65 years old and lives with her grandson in a ger (Mongolian yurt) on the western side of Mongolia. Her grandson is a kindergarten student and his mother works in the city. 

She started her cart-food business in 2010 by selling to office buildings. Even though she's fairly new to the business she already has many regular customers. She's known for her delicious hot soup. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "When people enjoy my food, it makes me very happy". 

She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy supplies for her cart-food business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her cart-food business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicken cuts and chicken feed

loans.name: Alexei

texts.ru:
Алексей с женой и двумя дочерьми живет в Гладковке. Она занимается сельским хозяйством, выращивая разные сельхоз культуры. На 50 сотках выращиваем ранние овощи: 4 000 огурцов, 4 000 кустов помидор, около 5 тонн картофеля. Фермерством занимается уже 7 лет. Чистая средняя прибыль составляет 5 600 гривен. 

Алексею необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, удобрения, полиэтиленовую пленку, дрова и материалы для ремонта теплиц, а также установить отопления в теплицах. Приобретение необходимых материалов для содержания теплиц и проведение отопления существенно повысит качество выращиваемой продукции, способствуя получению хорошей прибыли. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexei lives with his wife and two daughters in Gladkovka. He works as a farmer and makes a living by cultivating various crops. He owns 5,000 square meters of land where he grows the following vegetables: 4,000 cucumbers, 4,000 tomato plants and approximately 5 tonnes of potatoes. He's been a farmer for about seven years and his current average profit is 5,600 grivnas. 

Alexei needs a loan of 20,000 grivnas in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, polythene foil, wood and materials required for greenhouse repair and heating. 
Fixing up and installing adequate heating within the greenhouses will fundamentally increase the quality of his products, which will result in increased revenues.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, polythene foil, wood and materials required for greenhouse repair and heating.

loans.name: Agnetta

texts.en: Agnetta is 41 years old, married with four children aged six, eleven, thirteen and sixteen. She sells cereals such as peas and beans as well as onions to earn a living. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cereals such as peas and beans and onions.

loans.use: To buy cereals such as peas and beans and onions.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: Mrs. Xuan is a hard working woman, 49 years old. She lives with two children. She would like to improve her living standard. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from salary.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Es una señora jovial de 41 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 12 años estudia su 2 año de secundaria y un pequeño de 2 años. Su esposo trabaja como ayudante en las embarcaciones. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, estableció una pequeña, en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: chiverías, gaseosas, granos básicos, entre otros productos. Su sueño es construir un local para su negocio de concreto.

loans.use: para comprar: chiverías, gaseosas, granos básicos, entre otros productos.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akossiwa is 41 years old, she was born in Dékpo and has five (05) children to care for. The entire load of the family is on her shoulders. He husband, a qualified driver has been jobless for two (02) years. The education of the children is a problem, health care is another one. Thus this very dynamic but illiterate woman is fighting to meet the needs of her family. Very early in the morning, she prepares porridge to go and sell to students and after 9H30, she starts selling various other products. She already received four (04) credits which she reimbursed. Today, she applied for a credit of $650 to purchase a stock of canned food, soap, oil, insecticide etc. in order to restart her general business. The project will certainly help Mrs. A. improve the living conditions of her family while her husband is looking for a stable job.

Née il y a 41 ans à Dekpo, Madame A. Akossiwa a cinq (05) enfants à charge. Tout le poids de la famille repose sur elle, le mari chauffeur de formation est en chômage depuis plus de 2 ans déjà. La scolarité des enfants est un problème, les soins médicaux en sont d’autres. Ainsi, cette femme, très dynamique mais analphabète, se bat pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Très tôt le matin, elle fait la bouillie pour aller la vendre aux élèves et après à 9h 30, elle se lance dans la vente des produits divers. Elle a déjà bénéficié de quatre (04) qu’elle avait bien remboursé. Aujourd’hui elle sollicité un crédit de $650 pour acheter des boîte de conserve, savon, huile, insecticides etc. en vue de relancer son commerce générale. Ce projet sans doute aidera Madame A. à remonter le niveau de vie de sa famille en attendant que le mari ne trouve un emploi fixe pour la soutenir.

loans.use: To buy essential basic products

loans.name: Mursi

texts.en:
Mursi is a member of MBK who has requested a loan of $150. Mursi sells cut-up chicken in her village. The entire loan will be used to fund her cut-up chicken business. 1 cut-up chicken is sold at IDR2,500 and Mursi sells around 15 to 20 birds each day. Becoming a member of MBK and with its support she is able to acquire a refrigerator and motorcycle.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling cut-up chicken - Jual ayam potong

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.en:
Hello! My name is Hilda and I have a shop selling new clothing in the main square of my town. I have been in business for a number of years and have a good clientele. I am a single mother with two kids in school and thanks to my shop I can support them. Thank you!

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Hola mi nombre es Hilda, mi actividad es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de rupa nueva ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio, cuento con buena clientela, gracias a este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos familiares, soy madre soltera tengo 2 hijos los que estan estudiando gracias.

loans.use: To purchase underwear, jeans, men's shirts, women's blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia wishes to take this loan because she wants to increase the inventory of her diner. She has been in this business for 5 years. She wants to invest in soft drinks because of the hot weather. She researches the things she needs in the local market and usually sells "frias" or cold beer because that is what refreshes people the most and sells the most. She is married and has 2 children, one boy and one girl.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza U. has been selling children’s and men’s clothing for over 5 years now. Her business is located in Atushbazaar, Khujand. She brings goods in herself from Istaravshan once a month.

Dilfuza became a client of MicroInvest in March of 2007 with a beginning loan of US$ 150. Now her working capital is about $ 500. She says that her business is profitable as she is able to sell her goods in a short time.

Dilfuza wants to increase her inventory by purchasing new, up-to-date goods for the coming autumn season. For this purpose she needs a loan in the amount of US$ 400.

loans.use: purchase seasonal goods for her clothing stall

loans.name: Rocío Elsa

texts.es:
Rocío works every day to meet the needs of her family, the ones who keep her motivated to move forward. She’s sure that the great love she feels for them will keep up her efforts to succeed her work, selling alfalfa. Twenty years ago, ever since she was young, she began her long journey by working for others cutting alfalfa in other fields. Later on, a woman watching her labor encouraged her to purchase a large lot of alfalfa so she could begin her business without intermediaries. She was successful in this first venture, and this gave her more confidence to continue. Now married with five children, she has managed to integrate her family such that they work together without problems or delay. Throughout her journey, she has faced difficulties, but Rocío and her husband have overcome them in spite of her delicate health situation, and it has never impeded her in sustaining her family. Her spouse helps by raising rabbits. Like any large family, they have large dreams of improving their quality of life and providing education to all such that they can become successful professionals in the future. To do this and to achieve their dreams, they have decided to increase the amount of money they invest in beginning to build their dreams. Let’s help this family with their noble dreams of self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Rocío día a día trabaja para satisfacer con éxito las necesidades de su familia que la motiva a seguir adelante y está segura de que el inmenso amor que le brindan le seguirá dando fuerzas para desempeñarse muy bien en la labor que realiza, la venta de alfalfa.

Hace 20 años, desde su juventud, inició su larga travesía en un primer momento trabajando para otras personas cortando alfalfa en otros campos de cultivo y luego observando su hacendosa labor una señora la animó a comprarle un lote grande de alfalfa para que inicie su comercialización sin intermediarios; tuvo éxito en su primera incursión y venta y esto le dió aún más ánimos para continuar en este rubro.

Ahora ya casada y con cinco hijos ha logrado integrar una familia que trabaja en equipo con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar sin ningún problema ni tardanza.

A lo largo de su travesía se han presentado dificultades pero Rocío y su esposo han sabido superarlas y a pesar de la situación delicada de salud por la que tuvo que atravesar esta diligente madre, no se convirtió en impedimento para lograr sosteniendo a su familia y su esposo añadió a su acostumbrada labor la crianza de conejos de raza.

Como toda familia numerosa tienen grandes anhelos y deseos de incrementar la calidad de vida y educación de todos y cada uno de sus miembros con el objetivo de convertirse en unos exitosos profesionales en el futuro y para colmar los ánimos de sus queridos hijos han decidido incrementar su capital de inversión para iniciar a construir sus sueños.

Apoyemos a esta familia con nobles ideales de superación

loans.use: Increase capital for improving the sale of alfalfa.

loans.name: Dios Delante (Forward With God) – Groups #1, 2, And 3

texts.en:
Teresa, 6th from left in picture, is 53 years old. She has 10 children and 10 grandchildren. She is single and although all her children are out of her house, most of them still live in Sanchez and she helps support them and helps raise her grandchildren. She only has an elementary school education.

Teresa began her small business as a seamstress with her first loan from Esperanza. She takes orders from the people in the community and sews such items as bedding, curtains and clothes. Teresa is the “coordinator” for her group of five Esperanza associates in the larger Bank of Hope. Together with the coordinators from the other groups they form a “leadership council”, whose responsibilities incluD. involvement in community activities. In her opening prayer, Teresa gave thanks for the success of her business and for their continued growth, as well as for the health of her community

Members of these groups have been Esperanza loan associates for 7 months, and they have collectively paid back their first group loan. Ana G. is their loan officer; she makes the 40 minute trip out to Sanchez to be at their biweekly repayment meetings. The group meets in Teresa’s living room/balcony in the small fishing town of Sanchez on the Samana peninsula. Other businesses in her group incluD. clothes and shoes sales, and fishing supplies sales.

Julia C., R. E. and Joaquina E. were not present when this photo was taken

NOTE: This is a group loan. Teresa is one of 15 microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the 15 members will receive a share of this loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of the loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Naran

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Naran is single and currently living with her old parent and other four brothers and sisters. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1984. Her mother is also weaving silk and one of her sisters is weaving at home as well. Her father is assisting to spin thread and silk.  
 
She has borrowed money from MAXIMA eight times already. Now she is requesting another loan of the amount of $300. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Her and her husband did not have the money to pay for her internal career payments, rectory payments, or the preparatory school payments for her three children. For this reason, Marina decided to work. Her friend invited her to sell shoes via cataloges and was integrated as a shoe saleswoman.

Actually, she already had various clients that constantly looked to buy shoes. Still, she has little merchandise and many pending orders from her clients. For this reason, she is asking for $750 that she will pay back in 6 months. With your help, Marina will be able to pay for the costs of her sons' education in order for them to become good men.

This story was translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer. El pago de la cuota interna de la carrera, el pago de rectoría y el de la preparatoria de dos de sus tres hijos se juntaron y Marina ni su esposo tenían dinero para poder pagarlos. Fue por eso que Marina se decidió a trabajar. Una amiga de ella la invitó a una plática de venta de zapatos por catálogo y se integró como vendedora de zapatos.

Actualmente ya tiene varios clientes que constantemente la buscan para comprarle zapatos. Sin embargo tiene muy poca mercancía y varios pedidos pendientes que le han hecho sus clientes. Es por eso que Marina está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Marina podrá sacar adelante los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos para que estos sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: To supply orders.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Although Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is the oldest member of the branch, she is always an example of being hard-working, and using the borrowed money effectively. She joins the Fund since the very beginning. Her living circumstance at that time was very difficult. She and her husband only worked on the rice field and they had to send 5 children to school. At first, she borrowed 50 USD and used it in breeding animals, and selling vegetables in the market. Her life started changing when she bought a piece of land and started breeding animals, fishes and planting. After difficult years, her business is going very well. When I came down to see her, she just released a farrow of pigs and earned 1000 USD. Currently, there are 4 pigs and tons of fishes almost ready. Business is going well, her family economy is becoming stable. Her children are all grown-up and living separately. Being 58 years old, she is having a happy life. She wants to become a long-term member of the Fund so that she can borrow more money to expand her business. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more fishes and food for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Là thành viên cao tuổi nhất trong cụm nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị Hoà luôn là tấm gương điển hình về sự cần cù, chịu khó và sử dụng vốn rất có hiệu quả. Chị tham gia từ những ngày đầu khi Quỹ về với địa bàn xã Phúc thắng cũ. Hoàn cảnh gia đình lúc bấy giờ có rất nhiều khó khăn, vất vả, hai vợ chồng ngoài làm ruộng ra cũng không có thu nhập gì thêm lại phải nuôi 5 đứa con ăn học. Số tiền vay 50USD ban đầu được chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhỏ, hàng ngày mớ rau, mớ cỏ mang ra chợ bán. Cuộc sống thật sự thay đổi khi gia đình chị xin đấu thầu thêm 1 mẫu ruộng của hợp tác xã xây chuồng trại, đào ao thả cá, trồng cây ăn quả. Sau nhiều năm vất vả đến nay thành quả mà chị và gia đình đầu tư đã và đang cho thu nhập rất tốt. Khi tôi đến chị vừa cho xuất chuồng lứa lợn giá 1000USD, hiện tại trong chuồng còn hơn 4 tạ lợn thịt, vài tạ cá cũng đến kỳ cho thu nhập. Kinh tế phát triển, các con của chị cũng đã trưởng thành, xây dựng gia đình và đã ra ở riêng. Bước vào tuổi 58 chị Hòa rất vui và tâm sự được tham gia Quỹ là niềm hạnh phúc lớn trong đời chị. Chị mong muốn sẽ tham gia lâu dài để tiếp tục vay vốn phát triển dự án. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD mua cá giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy fishes, food for pigs

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en: Hanane is a 30-year-old woman who works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. She has one child. Hanane is a hairdresser. This is the second time she has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. She needs to buy material to sustain and develop her hairdressing business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to develop her business

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is 28 years old, married, and has two children (ages 4 and 8 years old). Hidaya sells cosmetics, a business she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $500 from her sales.

In the past, Hidaya has successfully serviced two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is requesting another loan to buy more cosmetic items for her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Ail

texts.en:
Ail A. is married, but her husband's income from his taxis are not sufficient for Ail and her three children. Ail sells rice and beans. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs Carmen Rosa P. M. is a member of Maria Garcia Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region, Moyobamba province and district with her mother and children. Carmen works tirelessly so that she can lead a productive and fruitful life and looks forward to a future full of possibilities.

Carmen is a teacher by profession. However, being unable to find work and with support from her husband and a loan she received, she decided to start a handicraft business from home. With this loan, repayable over six months, Carmen plans to buy fabrics with different finishes, threads, ribbons of different colours, sequins, and sewing needles of different sizes, so that she can give her customers the kind of attention to detail that they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carmen Rosa P. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MARIA GRACIA”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia Moyobamba y distrito Moyobamba, se dedica a las manualidades su negocio esta ubicada en su misma casa en el Jr. Libertad Nro 733 donde diariamente acuden su clientes La señora es de profesión Profesora pero al tener dificultad para encontrar trabajo opto por iniciarse en el mundo del negocio de las manualidades ya que contaba con el apoyo de su esposo y gracias a sus esfuerzos y al préstamo recibido logró implementar su negocio ya que sus pedido incrementaron debido a la calidad de su trabajo. Con este préstamo de S/.2,300.00 el cual será devuelto en 6 meses, compró telas propias para este tipo de acabados , hilos, cintas de distintos colores, lentejuelas, agujas de diferentes tamaños y grosor y así dar la atención que se merecen sus clientes . La señora Carmen Rosa vive con su mamá y sus hijos, trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse útil en la vida con muchas perspectivas en el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making handicraft products

loans.name: Moshi

texts.en:
Moshi is a married woman with 3 children aged 25, 21 and 14. She own a small food vendor store since in 1880. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

Moshi now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a wide variety of goods to restock her small grocery store

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: El domicilio de don Leoncio, se encuentra ubicado en la populosa zona de Villa Victoria  de la ciudad de La Paz siendo un vecino muy conocido de la zona; el sr. se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para varones sastrería, desde hace 25 años; este crédito será destinado a la compra de una máquina de coser y además para la compra de materia prima; el señor Leoncio vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que ya están cruzando estudios universitarios y dependen económicamente de el,  la esposa tiene una tienda de barrio con la que apoya en los gastos familiares, es cliente de nuestra institución desde hace 5 años y solo trabaja con nosotros, la moneda en la que trabaja es el dólar. Comenta que los créditos le sirven de mucho ya que gracias a ello logra mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Leoncio's home is located in the highly populated neighborhood of Villa Victoria in the city of La Paz and he is well known in the area. He has worked as a tailor making clothing for men for 25 years. This loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine and also to buy materials. Leoncio lives with his wife and two children who are university students and are economically dependent on him. His wife has a neighborhood store with which allows her to contribute to household expenses. He has been a client of our institution for five years and only works with us. The currency in which he works is the dollar. He says that the loans are a great help and thanks to them he is able to improve the quality of life for his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: María Romelia

texts.es:
Dedicada a la crianza de chanchos, patos y gallinas desde hace 10 años, influenciada por sus padres que están en el negocio hace muchísimos años más, la señora Romelia, de 28 años, cuenta con una vasta experiencia en dicho negocio, pudiéndole así brindar una educación a su hijo que cursa la primaria, siendo ésta su principal meta: poder apoyar a su hijo para que termine el colegio y siga estudiando en la Universidad. Es por ello que le ha puesto tanto ahínco a su negocio todos estos años, en aras de ahorrar cuanto pueda considerando que le quedan a su hijo más de 10 años hasta que termine la primaria, secundaria y una eventual carrera universitaria o técnica, según decida su hijo, el cual, nos cuenta, es uno de los mejores de su clase, convirtiéndose en el orgullo de su hogar.

Para concretar dicho anhelo, la señora necesita de 800 soles que financiarían el alimento de sus animales, primordial para una eventual y posterior venta, y más aún por la venidera campaña navideña, auge de ventas en el año, de dichos animales.
texts.en:
She has been raising pigs, ducks and chicken for the past 10 years. She took on the trade from her parents who also worked in the business for many years before. Romelia is 28 years old and she has the advantage of having a vast experience in the field. With her business she can provide her son with continued education - he is currently in primary school. Her goal is to support her son until he finishes school and keep on into University. This is why she has expended so much effort on her business this many years. She has been saving what she could, considering that her son still has more than 10 years before he finished primary and secondary school, and an eventual university or technical career, as he chooses. Her son is one of the best in his class and he is the pride and joy of their household.

To make her dream a reality, she needs 800 soles that will finance the purchase of feed for her animals, an essentias step for an eventual and future sale. And it is most important now because the holiday season approaches when there are increased sales of these animals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on animal feed for her pigs, chicken, and ducks, animals for sale for the holiday season.

loans.name: Tanya

texts.en:
Tanya is married with a son. She is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk where she works in the local bus station, selling interior doors for 2 years. She is characterized as an entrepreneur of integrity by her fellow vendors. Tanya has about 2,000 Grivnas in income. 

Some of Tanya's other characteristics are her consistency in customer service, dealing with suppliers and stress, and persistence in her business endeavors. Tanya is an entrepreneur who would never give up, but strives even harder. Tanya hopes to see her trade grow as she makes an investment in equipment for her office to facilitate her operational procedures. Tanya is seeking a 5,000 Grivna loan and is hoping to repay it in 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her office

loans.name: Naz Begum M.umar Group

texts.en:
Naz Begum resides in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan.  Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine places.  Most people come to this city to visit the shrine places and make wishes.  She has been living in this city for the past 30 years.  Her husband's name is M., and he is a barber by profession who runs a salon in the community.  He has 4 years of experience in this business.  

Naz Baji has four children: two sons and two daughters.  All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.  Naz Baji is a seamstress and she sews clothes for her neighbors.  She has been in this business for the past 15 years.  She does this work to bear the expenses of her children’s education, and her husband bears the house expenses.  She is applying for a loan to buy a hair dressing machine for her husband’s salon. 

She is a group leader of a few more ladies in her community.  Fozia Baji and Irshad Baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.  Ghulam Fatima Baji wants a loan to buy wheat and rice to resell.  Irshad Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a hair dressing machine for a barber salon

loans.name: Lucy H.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Lucy T. is 53 years old and she is from Tukuyu. She is divorced with 2 children, who are 26 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant, who is an orphan.  

Lucy has earned a living running a charcoal business since 1995. These small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth provide a good way of life for charcoal sellers, and are crucial to those who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots to cook, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

Lucy works at her business 8 hours per day, 7 days per week. Lucy currently earns about $500 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $325 USD in order to purchase additional stock of charcoal. In the future, she plans to increase the amount of charcoal she sells and open another store. Lucy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Махмудова Мавджуда проживает в  городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 33 года. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Но имеет участок земли, который засеивает пшеницей. Получаемый урожай  частично продает на рынке, а часть оставляет себе.планируемый кредит использует для покупки качественных семян и удобрений. Покупка качественной продукции даст возможность подлучить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavjuda M. lives in Tursun-Zade. She is 33, married, and has 3 children. Mavjuda is a housewife. She also has a parcel of land where she grows wheat. Part of her harvest Mavjuda sells at a local market, while keeping the rest for her family. Mavjuda will use this loan to purchase quality seeds and fertilizer. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth A. is currently in the business of selling simsim and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Elizerbeth is 40 years old and is widowed.   She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her food business

loans.name: Boko

texts.fr: Mr Boko A. est né en 1938 à Atakpamé. Marié et père de onze enfants. Agriculteur depuis très longtemps, il est bien connu dans sa localité pour la qualité de ses produits champêtres notamment la culture du haricot. Afin d’agrandir son champ et augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un financement. Les profits tirés de ses activités lui permettront d’améliorer sa situation sociale et celle de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Boko A. was born in 1938 at Atakpamé. Married and father of 11 children. Farmer for a very long time, he is well known in his area for the quality of his produce, notably for his beans. To increase his arable land adn increase his revenue, he is asking for a loan. Profits from his activity will enable him to improve his social situation and that of all his family.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow beans

loans.name: Inomiddin

texts.ru: Иномиддин вместе со своим старшим сыном занимается куплей продажей скота. У него есть профессия – он мясник, поэтому кроме перепродажи имеет торговую точку и продает там мясо. Чтобы извлечь большую прибыль Иномиддин выезжает на оптовые рынки далеко за пределы местожительства и там оптом покупает несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Если получиться продает скот вживую, а если скот остается то он забивает его и продает в своей лавке. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже 2 года, условиями кредитования доволен, и решил подать новую заявку на займ, чтобы закупить несколько голов бычков.
texts.en:
Inomiddin together with his oldest son is in the business of buying and selling cattle. He is a butcher by profession and besides the resale he also had a vendor space where he sells meat. To get high profits Inomiddin goes out to wholesale markets very far outside of where he lives and buys several heads of cattle in wholesale. If it's possible then he resells the live cattle, but if not then he butchers it and sells in his butcher shop. He has been working with MicroInvest for two years, and is very happy with the loan terms so he decided to apply for a new loan to buy a few heads of calves.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora, es Socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos , que está ubicado en el distrito de Mazo-Cruz Provincia del collao, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 44 años, de estado civil casada, con
5 hijos, y tiene estudios primarios completos.
La señora trabaja con el Movimento Manuela Ramos desde hace 12 años, y es una de las socias fundadoras, su préstamo inicial fue de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo cual le permitió mejorar su negocio  surtiendolo con mas productos requeridos por sus clientes.
En la actualidad, ella requiere de un prestamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles para poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos asi mismo poder comercializar en las diferentes ferias de su zona,  asi tambien ella desea comprar un vehículo para poder trasladar los productos con mayor facilidad, con el apoyo de su esposo.  Tanbien nos comenta que le gusta mucho su grupo ya que son unidas y muy colaboradoras, y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por apoyar de alguna manera a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora C. M. is a member of the Communal Bank Manuela Ramos, which is located in the Mazo-Cruz district, Callao province, Puno department. She is 44 years old, is married and has five children. She completed primary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years and is one of the founding members. Her first loan was of 300 nuevo soles, and it allowed her to improve her store, supplying it with more products needed by her customers.

Now she needs a loan of 3000 nuevo soles to be able to buy more products and b sell in different markets in the area. She also wants to buy a vehicle to be able to move her products more easily, with the help of her husband. She has also told us that she really likes her group because they are very close and co-operative. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women in many ways.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, rice, pasta, milk and other packaged foods

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
N. Salima is a hardworking businesswoman aged 37. She is married with four children that are all in school. She has a permanent residence at Yesu Amala Area in Nansana.

She has a cloth business at Nakasero market. She is requesting a loan to buy more cloth which she does not have in order to increase her stock to fulfill her customers’ demands.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth to increase her stock

loans.name: Gloria Graciela

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Graciela B. D. M. is 45 years old, married, and has been working from a very young age. 
Five years ago she started to run a used shoe stand in the market, seeing that she needed to help her husband with expenses. Just a short time after opening her stand she began to be very successful, giving her a demand for more capital to be able to continue her business.  
She is married to Mr. Isidoro M., who is 47 years old and works making shoes.  In this way, they buy shoes, he fixes, shines and dyes them, and she sells them.  They are a humble family that are able to pay day-to-day expenses, as well as the expenses for elementary school for their three children.

loans.use: the purchase of footwear

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Andrea es viuda, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Andrea tiene un puesto en el mercado Carmen alto en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas, Andrea tiene proyectado cambiar de negocio por la venta de cereales.
Andrea necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Andrea son ayudar a su hijo a comprar un terreno y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Yana Ñahui VIllage Bank. Yana Ñahui means "black eyes" in Quechua. Andrea is 50 years old and is the widowed mother of two children. Andrea has a stand in the Carmen Alto Market, where she sells prepared meals each morning. Andrea plans to switch businesses and start selling grains instead. Andrea needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy more grians. Andrea's dreams are to help her son buy a plot of land and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains

loans.name: Faheema Group

texts.en:
Faheema is the group leader of the Faheema group. There are four members in this group, and they hope to obtain a loan of 40,000 Afghani.

- Faheema wants to take out a loan for her husband who has general store.

- Raema hopes to receive a loan for her son who runs a Public Call Office.

- Haneta would like to use her loan for her husband, who is a taxi driver.

- A. G. would like a loan to use for his business, where he sells flour and oil.

They are all very grateful to Kiva lenders, who support so many entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding the businesses of the group members

loans.name: Patricia  Hidalia

texts.es: La Señora Patricia R. tiene 35 años de edad, habitante de Samaria una comarca de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen casada, su esposo es operador de maquinaria, le ayuda económicamente tiene cinco hijos todos mayores, los planes que tiene es mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de Directora del medio ambiente, desde hace seis meses y anteriormente en proyectos del mined. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo con el cual realizara mejoras a la vivienda en los cuartos y un pequeño anexo comprando materiales de construcción como: cemento, perlines, zinc y ladrillos.  El cual alcanzara una mayor seguridad y comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia R. is 35 years old and a resident of Samaria, an area of the Villa del Carmen community. Her husband is a machine operator. He helps her economically. She has five children, all of whom are older. Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her house. For six months, she has worked in Villa del Carmen's town hall in the role of Envrionmental Director, and before that on mining projects. She is thankful to the Institution for the loan with which she will complete improvements to the rooms in her house and a small annex by purchasing construction materials such as cement, beams, zinc, and bricks. This will achieve greater security and comfort for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand rooms.

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "El Carmen" esta representado por la señora Nelly y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales se encuentran cursando su tercer ciclo, demostrando unidad, honestidad, puntualidad y responsabilidad con su grupo y al institución. Este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida o a la cocina, otras son promotoras D. cosméticos y otras se dedican a la venta D. ropa. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias siempre están listas ofreciendo productos mas acorD. a la moda o innovando en nuevas comidas o en productos mas baratos. El crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en lo que se refiere a cada uno D. sus pequeños negocios ya sea comprando mas mercadería a bajo costo o a la compra D. insumos y materiales que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. A pesar D. las adversidades son han demostrado ser un grupo dinámico y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante con su pequeños negocios que representan el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the El Carmen community bank are represented by Nelly. The bank is maD. up of 13 members who are in their third loan cycle and have demonstrated unity, honesty, punctuality, and responsibility with their group and with the institution. The members of this bank have different businesses – some sell food or cook, others sell cosmetics, and others work in clothing sales. As in any commercial area, there always exists competition of supply and demand. However, the bank members are always ready, offering products in line with fashion, creating new foods, or selling cheaper products. This loan will be used for the diversification of products and to invest in each small business so that they can purchase lower cost merchandise, or purchase consumables and materials that help generate more income to help them give their families a better quality of life. Despite the adversities, they have demonstrated that they are a dynamic group with a great deal of desire to get ahead with their small businesses which are the means of support for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda F. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Gilda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gilda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Gilda is just starting this business.

In 2009, Gilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El grupo San Martín” esta representado por la señora Marcelina y conformado por 16 miembros a pesar D. ser un grupo numeroso son muy unidos y dinámicos como la han demostrado en su anterior ciclo. Este grupo se dedica a la actividad comercial como a la venta D. abarrotes, comida, pan, salchichas, empanadas y cosméticos, los otros socios se dedican al transporte público, a la construcción D. viviendas, soldadura D. metales y a la prestación D. servicios.  La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia ya que van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. sacar adelante sus negocios, agradecen el apoyo económico que les brinda la institución porque gracias a su confianza su familia gozara D. una mejor calidad D. vida y D. una mejor educación.
texts.en:
The group "San Martín” is represented by the Señora Marcelina and consists of 16 members. Despite being a large group they are very united and dynamic, as they have demonstrated in their previous loan cycle. This group is involved in various commercial activities such as the sale of groceries, food, bread, sausages, empanadas (pastries with meat fillings), and cosmetics. The other members are involved in public transportation, housing construction, metal welding, and the furnishing of services. The competition within their areas is very strong, and they know that they must continue to move ahead in the economic activity in which they are engaged. This loan will be used to support the growth of their businesses with the purchase of merchandise, supplies and tools in order to improve their incomes which will permit them to give their families a better quality of life. As for credit experience, the members already have experience, given that they are pursuing their second loan cycle demonstrating responsibility, honesty and the desire to carry their businesses forward. They appreciate the economic support that the institution provides them because thanks to their trust, their families will enjoy a better quality of life and a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of necessary goods such as flour, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Zam's Group

texts.en:
K. Zam is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and hardworking lady and is married with four children, all in primary school. She also takes care of her parents.

Zam is a business lady with a retail shop in Kireka that she has owned for ten years and from which she is able to earn 240,000/= in profits each month. Over the years, she has learnt to handle her customers well, plus having quality products, and this keeps them coming back to her.

Zam would like to expand her shop so that she can continue selling a variety of items and in large quantities. She is seeking a loan that will help her restock her retail shop with more goods to sell.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more goods

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma A. is 30 years of age and is from the village of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Her husband, Bell A., is 31 years old.

Gemma delivered her baby just last month but it did not survive. She said that life is full of problems but she just takes it as a challenge. At present, she is busy managing her “talipapa” or small market where she sells vegetables, meat, fish and barbeque in the afternoons.

Gemma’s husband is busy with their farm activities but also helps Gemma in selling their meats and vegetables. Sometimes, Gemma sells her food and snacks around their village by going house to house. She is almost one year in her business.

Gemma wants to borrow Php 6,000 as additional capital for the improvement of her business. She wants to have more items to sell to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to have more items to sell

loans.name: Muazama

texts.ru: Муазама Султанкулова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает в местной строительной компании. Сама Муазама у себя дома занимается павишкой одежды под заказ. Кредит просит для закупа сырья чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Muazama S. lives in the Rumy district. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband works at a local construction company. Muazama is involved in sewing clothing to-order at home. She is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Estela no estudió y se dedica a la  compra y venta de cereales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses atrás(reingresante) y su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que comprarà chuño, cebada, arvejas y habas.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una casa en Tacna y abrir una tienda.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the “San Juan” cooperative bank, in the district and province of Yunguyo of Puno. She is 46 years old, and the single mother of 2 children. She has no formal education, and dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of cereals. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 months (rejoined), and used her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles to augment her working capital. She will request a loan of 1,000.00 soles to buy potato flour, barley, peas and beans. Her dreams for the future are to have a house in Tacna and to open a store. What she enjoys most about belonging to a cooperative bank is being able to save.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato flour, beans, barley and peas.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie A. is from the village of Becor, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish to people in her local community. Elsie has been in business for over 12 years and earns about 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional fish to sell.  She is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the living conditions of her family. 
--------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 42 years old, married, and has two teenage daughters, ages 13 and 17. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES in order to buy feed for her chickens, which she raises in order to sell their eggs to residents in the surrounding area. 

Roseline also makes cleaning products and detergents for individual use and sells those products both to hotels and in residential areas. 

Her biggest challenges are lack of available capital and adequate means of transportation. She has been in her current line of business for eight years. She wants to be a major supplier of her products within 5 years and hopes to have a better life. She considers herself hardworking, patient, focused and welcoming.

loans.use: feed for chickens

loans.name: María Micaela

texts.es:
La señora María Micaela P. es una dama muy sonriente que se dedica a la actividad de pulpería teniendo el negocio en el municipio de Cinco Pinos donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana vende sus productos tales como comestibles y productos personales.
Ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de dichos productos para la pulpería entre los que se encuentran comestibles y productos del hogar y así suplir sus estantes y lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes que a diario le visitan en la pulpería que ella tiene en buen dirigir.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Micaela P. is a very smiley lady who works in her grocery store in the town of Cinco Pinos. She begins work very early each day and sells groceries and personal products. She is asking for the loan to buy products for her store, such as groceries and housewares to be able to stock her shelves and improve customer satisfaction for the regular customers who visit her well-managed store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her store

loans.name: Huguette

texts.fr: K. Huguette est née en 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à POBLI Albert, un pêcheur et commerçant, Huguette est mère de trois enfants.
