Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés.  La famille vit ensemble à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis 6 ans.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Huguette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Huguette mène comme activité, la vente des divers produits et des condiments (tomates fraîches et conserves de tomates, piments, gingembres, épices, bicarbonate, etc.) au marché de Agbalilamé. Huguette exerce cette activité depuis 13 ans.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Huguette s’approvisionne.  Huguette a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Huguette sollicite un troisième crédit en vue de renforcer ses activités et de mieux faire face à la demande des clients.
texts.en:
Huguette K. was born in 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Albert POBLI, a fisherman and trader, Huguette has three children. Not all the children are at school. The family has lived together in Agbalilamé in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji for 6 years. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Huguette has never been to school. In order to meet her needs, she runs a business selling various products and condiments (fresh tomatoes, tinned tomatoes, peppers, ginger, spices, bicarbonate of soda etc.) at the market in Agbalilamé. Huguette has been carrying out this activity for 13 years. She stocks up at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She has already had two loans from ALIDé which she has repaid. She is applying for a third loan in order to strengthen her business and to meet customer demand more readily.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
27-year-old Adelfa has two children ages 3 and 4. She has been married to her husband Johnniel for four years now. She farms for a living. Like other farmers, she also experiences failure, especially when pests attack her farm. But, she still does her best to make her rice farm productive because it is the only source of income her family has.

Adelfa is a member of CEVI and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use this loan to acquire farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and others.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 41 years old. Her husband is a plumber and they have four children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She has a good relationship with LAPO. To earn a living, she sells drinks and groceries in Benin City, Edo State. She needs a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Srey Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mom L. is a 26-year-old married woman and she has been selected by the members as the leader of this group loan, which consists of six members located in Lech Pram village in Kandal province. The member of this group will each use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Srey Mom L. is a grocery seller and also a rice wine maker. With these two businesses she is able earn a small income to support her family.

Mrs. Srey Mom now is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to resell and to buy rice to support her wine making. Her husband, Mr. Sokunthea Sakk, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell and more rice to support her wine making

loans.name: Horencia

texts.es: Horencia, de 56 años, es una mujer muy noble, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa de sus parientes. Hace más de 8 años, se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, por lo que tiene que recorrer las calles de su barrio, con fin de sus clientes compren sus productos. Su negocio le resulta rentable cuando compra al por mayor la mercadería, durante la campaña de ofertas, pasada el tiempo, estos productos son vendidos a precio normal y eso le favorece mucho en el trabajo y en las ganancias. Su mayor anhelo es progresar su negocio, así como el de implementar la imprenta de su esposo, con el fin de que sus hijos algún día se dedique a ese negocio, ya que lo considera. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar  puntualmente sus cuotas. En su grupo ha demostrado ser una socia muy responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará repuestos para su maquina Offset, para que pueda trabajar eficazmente su esposo, piuesto que lo considera más rentable que la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Horencia is 56 years old and is a very noble woman. She lives together with her husband and their two children in the house of their relatives. For more than 8 years, she has made a living by selling beauty products, for which she has to travel the streets of her neighborhood. Her business is very profitable when she buys the merchandise wholesale, during sale season. After this, she can sell them at normal price, which favors her greatly. Her greatest wish is to further her business, as well as setting up her husband's printing press, with the hopes that some day her children will be dedicated to that business. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments punctually. In her group, she has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible partner. With this credit, she will purchase replacement parts for her printing machine, so that her husband can work efficiently, given that they consider this more profitable than selling cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to fix her printing machine

loans.name: San Cayetano I Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando en varias actividades de manera conjunta para contar con fondod comunes a parte de las activides que cada una reliza con su familia.
El comité les ayuda a todas a organizar mejor sus activida, ademas de un buen manejo de los ingresos ya que reciben asesoramiento y todas agraden por ello.
Entre las actividades mas comunes que ejercen estas señoras se tiene la venta de ropas y comestibles, así también la Doña Modesta quien se dedica a la confeccion de vestidos de ropas para vender especialmen trajes, pantalones, y otros.
Ella quiere anexar a su taller venta de otros tipos de ropas para solicita el crédito que invertirá en la compra de remara de algodón y licra, jeans, camperas y otros para competir con la otras tiendas cercanas.
texts.en:
This group is working together in various activities. They are doing this in order to have common funds that are separate from the activities each one does with their family. The group helps all of them to better organize their activities. Also, they help with good management of their earnings. They receive advice, and they are all grateful for it. Among the most common activities these women do is selling clothes and food. Modesta makes clothes to sell. She mainly makes suits, pants, and other things. She wants to add on to her shop and sell other types of clothing. She is requesting the loan to buy cotton and lycra t-shirts, jeans, jackets, and other items. She wants to do this to compete with other stores that are nearby.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy t-shirts, jeans, jackets, and other items

loans.name: Rosibeth

texts.es:
Rosibeth C. A.  es una señora de 45 años de edad, quien vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico, ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; la que es conocida como una comunidad muy tranquila y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Doña Rosibeth tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual ha sembrado diferentes cultivos tales como papaya y plátano, pero en esta ocasión desea iniciar un nuevo proyecto en una hectárea de terreno que le heredo su padre para sembrar ñampí, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente doña Rosi está solicitando un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones)  para ayudarse con la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñampí. 

Rosibeth forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico; una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido 2 microcrédito que le ha permitido tener un ingreso que le permita tener una mejor calidad de Vida.
texts.en:
Rosibeth C. A. is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a rural Costa Rican neighbourhood named Abanico, located in San Isidro de Penas Blancas, San Ramon, in the Alajuela province. It is known as a very peaceful community dedicated to productive activities such as agriculture, livestock and tourism. Rosibeth has a small plot of land in which she has sown different crops such as papaya and plantanes, but she now wants to start a new project in a hectare of land that she inherited from her father to plant ñampí, a tuber with a pleasant flavour, rich in nutrients, widely grown and in great demand in Costa Rica and other countries. Rosi is requesting a loan of 500,000 colones to help her with the preparation of the soil, the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and other materials that will be necessary to guarantee the optimal growth of the ñampí. Rosibeth is part of the Credito Communal de Abanico Group; one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member, she has recieved 2 microloans which have allowed her to have an income that has given her a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soil preparation, purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married to a peasant farmer. They have seven children, all of whom go school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal in Makerere Kikoni, selling on both a retail and a wholesale basis.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business, she also owns pork joint near her charcoal store.  Agnes sells to all categories of people.  She has been with this business for five years and works six days a week.  

Her business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season.  She wants to go directly to villages for charcoal and also build her own house. Agnes joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans and because of their low interest rates.  Agnes rents and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcaol

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a grown son. She lives in Novomoskovsk and runs a construction supply store called "Construction Fittings" that is located in the central marketplace. She doesn't own the facility but has to rent it which increases her business expenses. Her rented facility is spacious enough and is located in a busy part of the marketplace which always keeps her place buzzing with customers. She has been working in this sphere of business for three years. 

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase more construction fittings, metalware, tools and instruments to diversify the assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her store. This loan will help her obtain a better variety of inventory for the busy summer/fall reconstruction and remodeling season in the Ukraine.

Ludmila's husband is actively helping her run the business. Ludmila is an optimist. She thanks God for opportunities He opened for her business and for the success she has achieved with it.

loans.use: To purchase more construction fittings, metalware, tools and instruments for her store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander se dedica a la actividad económica es la venta de semilla de jícaro.  Este no es el primer financiamiento  pues siempre está pendiente de lo que su negocio necesita. El trabaja todos los días por darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, Alexander tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos a lugares muy lejanas. El deseo de él comprar un caballo que le sirva como medio de transporte para el traslado de la semilla ya si ofrecerla a la ciudad. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Alexander's economic activity is selling semilla de jícaro [a type of drink, also called horchata]. This is not his first loan since he is always considering what his business needs. He works everyday to give his family a better quality of life. He has been working in this business for more than six years. Alexander has to get up very early to offer his products in very far-away places. His wish is to buy a horse that would serve him as a means of transport for carrying the semilla de jícaro if he would like to sell in the city. The loan is for purchasing raw materials that are needed for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia is a resident of a city called Borewala, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives in a two-room brick house with her husband and three children. She has two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is in 10th standard, the youngest one reads in 2nd standard and her daughter reads in 9th standard.  

Rafia is in the carpet-weaving industry. She collects orders from factories and different carpet sellers and weaves carpets on order to earn an income. She complete one carpet in a two-month time frame and earns a good income on it.  

She is a very good housewife and mother as well. She gives the required time to her family and takes care of them very well. 

Her husband runs a grocery shop in the market. His business is giving him a good return. In this way, they both are managing their family expenses. Although they are working very hard, still they are facing financial problems and are unable to pay for their kids' education expenses.  

Therefore, Rafia has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy the groceries in bulk and increases the profit of his business. She is hopeful that this investment will help them to save some profit for the future of their kids and they will easily pay off their education expenses as well. 

She is in her second loan cycle and is a very responsible loan user of Asasah. In the previous year, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Emina Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Emina del Carmen G. P., tiene la edad de 28 años vive en un humilde barrio, es casada, su esposo labora como Ingeniero Eléctrico y labora para Unión Fenosa con sus ingresos le apoya a los gastos del hogar,  ellos son una familia de 3 hijos pequeños que actualmente estudian la escuela primaria y el menor cursa el preescolar. La señora Emina se dedica a comercializar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y los fines de semana instalan a las afueras de su hogar, un pequeño comedor de comida popular de Nicaragua. Tiene más de 7 años de tener un ingreso económico a través de esta actividad, desea ahorrar hasta tener los recursos necesarios para la apertura de una tienda de ropa, pero solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita aumentar las ventas y sus ingresaos para la planificación de sus futuras inversiones, así mismo la mejoría continua de la economía familiar para el beneficio de los miembros de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emina del Carmen G. P., 28, lives in a humble neighborhood. She’s married and her husband works as an Electrical Engineer for Unión Fenosa; his income helps support the household. They have three small children who are in elementary school; the youngest is in preschool. Emina sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics. On the weekend she sets up a small eatery in her front yard to sell typical Nicaraguan dishes. This activity has provided income for over 7 years and she wants to save up until she has enough resources to open a clothing store. She is asking for funds to buy a large stock of merchandise to increase sales and income so that she can be planning her future investments as well as continue to improve the family’s economy for the benefit of all the family members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: M. D. Komla est né en 1983 à KPOKLOLO dans le canton de Gamé (préfecture de zio). Il est marié et a deux (02) enfants. C’est un agriculteur qui n’exerce plus cette activité parce qu’il n’arrive plus à générer suffisamment de revenus pour satisfaire les besoins de sa famille compte tenu des aléas climatiques. Disposant d’une vieille moto, il changea d’activité et se transforme en conducteur de taxi moto. Malheureusement sa moto actuelle est trop vieille et tombe régulièrement en panne. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit pour acheter une nouvelle taxi moto qui aujourd’hui est source de revenu très rapide.
texts.en: M. D. Komla est né en 1983 à KPOKLOLO dans le canton de Gamé (préfecture de zio). Il est marié et a deux (02) enfants. C’est un agriculteur qui n’exerce plus cette activité parce qu’il n’arrive plus à générer suffisamment de revenus pour satisfaire les besoins de sa famille compte tenu des aléas climatiques. Disposant d’une vieille moto, il changea d’activité et se transforme en conducteur de taxi moto. Malheureusement sa moto actuelle est trop vieille et tombe régulièrement en panne. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit pour acheter une nouvelle taxi moto qui aujourd’hui est source de revenu très rapide.

loans.use: Achat de taxi moto

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina L. lives in the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a small variety store where she sells food and other items people need every day. She has been in this line of work for more than two years, and earns about 5,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue improving and expanding her store.  

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Benrogous Mulongo

texts.en:
Benrogous is married and they have two children who attend school. They live in Kibera, an suburb of Nairobi City, and this where he sells the shoes to his customers who are mostly within his area residence and  to passerbys.  

Benrogous was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He has no history with any other MFI. He is servicing his first loan of Kshs .20,000. 

Benrogous has been in this business of shoe selling  for twenty years and has made a good income. With the loan he intends to add more stock of shoes in preparation for the Christmas season. 

With the profits, Benrogous will expand his business to other areas and start selling second hand shoes wholesale. His hopes are to educate his children, have a boutique and own rental houses.

loans.use: To add more stock of shoes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Juan Rodrigo

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Rodrigo P. G. es trabajador Activo para el Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como D.J y animador  tiene un año de trabajar para esta institución, es acompañado actualmente tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan Rodrigo P. G. works for the Hotel Barcelo Monte as a DJ and host. He has worked there for one year. He has a partner, and a school-aged son. He has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each of them has been used to purchase construction materials to expand and improve his home. He has benefited greatly from these loans, as he has been able to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: purchase building materials: sand, cement, stones, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Benito Ricardo

texts.es:
Benito de 39 años, tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende platanos. Vive con su esposa y 4 hijos de 16, 8, 6 y 5 años en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

El trabajaba con un  amigo vendiendo platanos pero como quería independizarse y ganar su propio dinero decidió invertir sus ahorros en platanos, ramas de platanos para vender en el mercado. En la actualidad tiene su puesto en el mercado en donde ramas de platano a $ 3.75 (vienen unos 30 platanos) tiene platanos de distinto precio según como sea el tamaño de la rama hasta $ 6.50.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar en un volumen mayor ramas de platanos para poder vender a mas clientes. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local en la parte delantera de su casa para pasar mas tiempo con su familia,
texts.en:
Benito is 39 years old.   He has a stall in the market where he sells bananas.  He lives with his wife and 4 children aged 16, 8, 6 and 5 in an urban area called Orquídeas (orchids).  The area is so called because when it was discovered they found many flowers there and currently there is a park of orchids there.

Benito used to work with a friend selling bananas but as he wanted to become independent and earn his own money he decided to invest his savings in bunches of bananas to sell in the market.  He currently has a market stall where he sells large bunches of bananas for $3.75 (for 30 bananas).  He sells bananas for different prices according to how big the bunch is, up to a price of $6.50.

He would like to use his loan to buy more bunches of bananas so that he can sell to more customers.  In the future he would like to have his own premises in the front part of his home so that he can spend more time with his family.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is twenty years old and a hard-working man living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of seeing his siblings educated. He has a retail shop and drugstore with an experience of two years in these businesses which have facilitated his earning money for the family. Peter intends to use the loan to buy soap, sugar and tea leaves to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing soap, sugar and tea leaves for sale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca A. de 57 años de edad esta felizmente casada con el Sr. Arselio Fleitas de 69 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores de edad, de los cuales uno también ya esta casado, los demás van a la universidad y trabajan para los gastos universitarios y ayudar en la casa.
Doña Francisca es propietaria de un negocio que consiste en venta de telas, el cual funciona hace 30 años atrás con un ahorro que tenían con su marido, quien en aquel entonces trabajaba para una empresa de la ciudad de Caaguazú. 
Su negocio esta ubicado sobre la avenida principal de la ciudad y es muy conocida por la antigüedad de la misma y por la excelente atención que brinda a sus clientes.
Ella Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas blancas variadas para vestidos de colación, ya que en esta fecha del año tiene mucha demanda. 
Desea que el país mejore y aumente la seguridad y que haya mas trabajo para todos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca A., 57 years old, is happily married to Mr. Arselio Fleitas, 69 years old.  They have 5 children, all adults, one of whom is already married.  The others attend university and work to pay their tuition and help at home.

Francisca is the owner of a fabric store that began 30 years ago with savings from her husband, who at the time worked for a company in the city of Caaguazú.

Her business is located on the city's main street and is well known for having been there a long time and for the excellent service she gives her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy various kinds of white cloth for graduation party dresses, since it is in high demand this time of year.  She wants the country to improve and become safer, and for there to be more work available for everyone.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen T., 22, raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is an electrician, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pig food to raise pigs. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more pig food to raise pigs

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar K. is married and has three children. She runs a small business selling clothing in the central market of Dushanbe. She has a variety of clothing products at reasonable prices. Mutabar started her venture six years ago and has achieved stability since then. She has many customers who  buy clothing from her because they know she does not sell low quality merchandise in her kiosk. Customer demand is constantly growing, which is why Mutabar decided to expand her trade. Mutabar's determination and desire to provide only the best quality products will help her grow professionally and increase her sales. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To Increase working capital of the clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS FOR HER EMBROIDERY WORK

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
Mr. Fausto N. is a client of our bank from several years ago. He is married to Mrs. Andresa Bogado. They are the parents of three children and are located at Kilometer 7 New Town (Ciudad del Este) as of next Monday.

Mr. Fausto is dedicated to the sale of offal by walking around the area. Through his dedication he already has his own house. His family is industrious, honest, and responsible, as reflected with the fulfillment of their loan obligations.

loans.use: To purchase meats and offal

loans.name: 'missie Group'

texts.en:
Missie G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers, called 'Missie Group'. She is 46 years old, married, and has seven children whose ages are between 26 and 3 years. She cares for two siblings.

She did not attend school. She describes herself as a loving mother whose dreams are to grow her business, educate her children and build a house.

For 17 years, she has been selling fish (dried and fresh) in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,000 LRD portion of this 35,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase modern equipment for his clinic

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Né vers 1970 à Dourou Préfecture de Bandiangara (région de Mopti), Monsieur  Souleymane S.est marié et père de six enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants dans sa propre maison à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Souleymane n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école,  et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment aux stockage et commercialisation des céréales, vente de carburant et embouche bovine il y a maintenant quinze ans. Avec sa grande expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il sollicite ce premier crédit, lui permettant d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients. 
Il compte acheter une importante quantité de céréales (mil, maïs, son de riz, etc.)  pour constituer un stock et quelques bidons de carburants pour la vente en détail.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre  les dépenses de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Born around 1970 in Douro Prefecture of Badnangara (Mopti Region), Mr. Souleymane S.is married and the fathe of xis. He lives with his two wives and children in his own house in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district of the  city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Souleymane did not have an opportunity to go to school. After trying several business activities without success, he started stocking and reselling cereals, selling fuel and raising sheep. He has been doing this for almost 15 years.  With a lot of work experience, he has a good reputation in the business and receives many orders, but lacks the necessary resources to meet customer demand. And so he decided to joint he credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, requesting his first loan. T

his loan will allow him to increase his working capital in order to better respond to customer demand. He plans to purchase a big quantity of cereals (millet, corn, rice bran etc) to build up his stock and several jugs of fuel for retailing. Wit this loan, he plans to achieve an average monthly income of 270,000 Western African francs. With this income, he plans to cover family expenses, pay off the interest on his loan, and reinvest the rest in his principal business activity.

loans.use: to purchase various articles for resale

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es: Luz Ángela C. D. F., es una mujer viuda, madre D. 3 hijos en las edades D. 25 a 30 años,  dedicada a la comercialización D. mercancía mediante guías especializadas D. productos, actividad que inició desD. el año 2007, cuando su hijo le prestó dinero para hacerlo y comenzó vendiendo cosméticos que compraba a través D. revistas y también donD. encontraba descuentos. Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará calzado, ropa femenina aprovechando que se acerca el día D. las madre y tiene mercancías encargadas,  para que las familias hagan su respectivo obsequio. Su sueño es tener una confección donD. ella misma pueda diseñar y confeccionar su propia ropa, pero su gran desafío es mejorar las condiciones físicas D. su vivienda para este propósito. Mientras tanto Luz Ángela continua esforzándose todos los días por conseguir aumentar sus ingresos  y trabajando con una rentabilidad promedia no menor del 15 %, con una proyección D. incrementarla.
texts.en: Luz Ángela C. D. F. is a widowed woman and the mother of 3 children age 25 to 30 years.  She is dedicated to the sale of merchandise by means of specialized product guides, an activity that she started in the year 2007, when her son lent her money to do it.  She began selling cosmetics that she bought from magazines and also where she found discounts.  This is her second loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy footwear and women's clothes, taking advantage of the fact that mothers day approaches and ensuring that she has merchandise in stock, so that the families can purchase their respective gifts.  Her dream is to have a workshop where she can design and make her own clothing, but her greatest challenge is to improve the physical conditions of her dwelling for this purpose.  In the meantime Luz Ángela continues to endeavor every day to manage to enlarge her income, working with an average profit margin of no less than 15%, with a projection of increasing it.

loans.use: to buy footwear and women's clothing.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom got married a few years ago with G. M. and she has a son and a daughter, who both stay at home and have not started their education yet. She lives in a 2-room brick house in a small city called Mian Channu. Mian Channu is a small city of Pakistan also known for its agriculture industry.  She is a housewife and stays at home doing her household work. She is a very active and supportive person and always ready to help her family in their time of need. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her nephew who also lives with her and operates an animal-selling business. He buys young animals, raises them and sells to butchers at a profit. Using the loan, he will buy goats & sheep for resale.
 
Kalsoom is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her nephew’s business and it will help him to grow financially.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 45 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 22 years old.

Angelita is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 22 years. Angelita works hard to help sustain her family. She also wants to save for her children's future.

Angelita needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She has requested a loan and plans to use it to fund her farm. Angelita hopes for her harvest to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, age 48, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Ry is a housewife while her husband is a recycler, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has mproved since Ry’s husband has had this business. Ry is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport recyclable materials to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's recyclable materials transport business.

loans.name: Demandovo Ste Rita Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DEMANDOVO STE RITA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone géographique au Bénin. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Victoire Ablawa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victoire Ablawa est née en septembre 1964 dans une ville du Bénin. Victoire Ablawa a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Victoire Ablawa a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis quatre ans, afin de subvenir à ses besoins et de mieux assurer les différentes charges de ses enfants, Victoire Ablawa prépare de la nourriture (riz mélangé avec du haricot, du pain), qu'elle vend dans son quartier. Parallèlement, Victoire Ablawa vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques, ce qui lui permet d'avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Victoire Ablawa s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Victoire Ablawa sollicite un autre crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DEMANDOVO STE RITA.
texts.en:
The DEMANDOVO STE RITA group consists of three people who live in the same geographic area in Benin. This is the group’s fourth time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Victoire Ablawa, the group’s representative, has her hand raised in the photo. She was born in a city of Benin in September 1964. Victoire has three children, all of whom have received formal schooling. Two of the children are still in her care. Victoire herself quit school at the secondary level. 

For the past four years, Victoire has been preparing and selling food (a dish of rice & bean, some bread) around her neighborhood in order to support herself and provide for her children. She also sells mobile phone recharge cards as an additional source of income. She gets her supplies in a city of Benin. 

In an effort to meet the needs of her customers and increase her revenue, Victoire is seeking this new loan together with the other members of the DEMANDOVO STE RITA group.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetable oil, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en:
Asel is the treasurer of this group. She is 25 and married to a private entrepreneur. Together with her husband she is bringing up two daughters and a son, all of whom are of preschool age (under seven). 

Five years ago with an initial investment of 13,000 KGS the family began to purchase various foodstuffs in Bishkek and then selling them in the village at a higher price.  At the moment the business runs well, so Asel earns about $220 per month. 

She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more foodstuffs in order to increase the commodity turnover. In the future, with the profits gained, Asel plans to enlarge a shop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 35 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She produces and sells food. For more income and for her children educational costs, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past 12 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailoring shops in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 59 years old and married. She has 6 children. With 1 child still in school, Concepcion works very hard to provide for her children.

Concepcion runs a sari sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

Concepcion has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, curls, bread, egg, etc.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. Dorcas has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and breads. She has had this business for five years, and she is a new member of HSPFI.

Dorcas requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.  In the future, Dorcas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en: Aybaniz is an internally displaced person who lives in the IDP district Bilasuvar. Aybaniz works hard because she wants to improve her life. She is engaged in a poultry business. Mostly, Aybaniz sells chicken and turkey to local vendors. Poultry is very popular among Azerbaijani people and this type of product is in high demand in autumn and winter. Aybaniz would like to purchase more poultry and increase her profit. She would like to get a loan of 1000 Azerbaijani manats to put her wish into practice.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina retails saucepans, aluminium pans, plastic containers, and others at Abura. She is a single parent taking care of four children. Having to feed, clothe and educate her children has not been easy, so she wants to increase her sales by buying more saucepans and aluminium pans to retail to get more income. She hopes to invest her increased capital into her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans and aluminium pans to retail.

loans.name: St.elizabeth Buyambi Group

texts.en:
Joyce's retail enterprise serves the interests of various demographics in her area of operation. The wide array of retail stock that the warmhearted, congenial and buoyant mother of three offers has strengthened her niche and endeared her to many. Weekly, her sales earn Uganda shillings 80,000. Joyce also subsists on auxiliary profits from farming.

In operation for only four years, the roaring trade her store enjoys is a clear testament to Joyce's diligence, mettle, willingness to listen to her clients, and pro-activeness. On the face of it, the future prospects of her business are resplendent, although the successes she has been enjoying have not come easily, as she inevitably has had to grapple with her fair share of adversity.

This Kiva loan will enable Joyce to purchase more retail commodities like maize flour, sugar, salt, beans, rice, etc. to resell. She anticipates being able to expand her business early next year.

Joyce's group is on their second loan cycle with this Micro-finance organization.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like maize flour, sugar, salt, beans, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn is 37, married and has four school-age children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to earn additional income. She wants to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children. Despite problems and difficulties in life, they are striving hard to earn and save to give their children a better future.

She wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, junk food, breads, soaps, seasonings and soft drinks to sell in her variety store. She believes that through this loan she will increase her product offerings and improve her business. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continues to work and manage her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, junk food, breads, soaps, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 58 years old. He is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City.   He earns money by buying and selling vehicle spare parts and accessories. He would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of spare parts and accessories to better meet his customers' needs. 

Kim hopes that through the loan his business will increase its income and ensure that his family members have better living conditions.

loans.use: buy vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is married and has four children. She has received senior high education. Nana sells beans, plantains and provisions at Abura, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a carpenter. Nana assists her husband to feed the home. Nana will use the loan to procure more provisions to expand her business.

loans.use: to procure more provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married woman with one infant child. Cheryl is 33 years old and resides at Pangabuan, Tangub City: Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. 

Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. Cheryl is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Cheryl wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена решила воспользоваться кредитом для закупки сезонной мужской одежды – теплых свитеров и курток. Увеличив ассортимент, она сможет привлечь больше клиентов и соответственно получить больше прибыль. 
Предыдущий кредит помог Елене закупить дополнительный качественный товар. Торговля была хорошей. Елена смогла получить прибыль и помочь своим престарелым родителям, а также дочери.
Елена любит свой бизнес и старается развивать его дальше.
texts.en: Yelena decided to use this loan to purchase men's seasonal clothing, such as warm sweaters and jackets.  Having expanded merchandise selection would enable her to attract more customers and, thus, make a larger profit.  The previous loan helped Yelena to purchase additional quality merchandise.  Her sales were good.  Yelena was able to make a profit and help her elderly parents and also her daughter.  Yelena loves her business and tries to develop it further.

loans.use: to purchase warm sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 32-year-old single lady who lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Grace has operated a beauty salon for the past 2 years; her potential clients are women from the local area. She faces a major challenge of clients not paying their debts on time. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase a hair dryer and cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and married with 5 children. With 3 children in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them all.

Grace runs a Variety Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ganzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganzul is 29 years old and lives with her family in Kherlen, a boundary town in Mongolia. She operates a meat stall in the market. Since 2007, she has been running her business. Initially she started with just one stall. Now she owns three stalls. She has many regular customers. 

Ganzul always tries to expand her business day by day. She has a plan to have a big butcher shop in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Therefore she decided to increase her working capital. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase a large amount of livestock meat from her suppliers at a low price.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of livestock meat.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 51-years-old, married to Leah and they have 8 children. He has been operating a livestock trading business where he buys, rears and sells cows for the last 9 years. He earns a monthly income of Kes 2,000.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD and he plans to use the funds to buy more stock of cows which he will later sell at a profit. With the anticipated profits he plans to save for expansion of his business and save towards the education of his children. 

He hopes to improve the standard of living for his entire family.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en: Majeda is a 52-year-old widow who is living with her son and daughter. So she can support herself and her kids, Majeda opened a small shop selling detergents and some cosmetics a year ago. Now she is applying for a loan so she can bring in better quality detergents and improve the level of service and the products she is selling.

loans.use: to buy better quality detergents

loans.name: Kalabati

texts.en:
Kalabati is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Koraput District of Odisha state, India. Kalabati is a tailor. She currently runs her business from her family’s front porch because she cannot afford to rent office space. Kalabati supports her family through her business. She is the only earning person in her family as she got married at very young stage and now her husband's age is not allowing him to do any work. She has faced much trouble in her small life and now she wants to save some money for her children's education. 

Kalabati is requesting a loan from Kiva through People's Forum to rent space and purchase more sewing materials for her business. As a result of receiving the loan, she hopes to improve her family’s standard of living and send her children to school.

loans.use: to rent space and purchase more sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Asher would like to buy packs of salt, laundry detergents, sacks of cereals, sugar, bales of flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en: A mother of one 20-year-old, Dinna loves to show off her talent of sewing and designing. As a result, she opened up a sewing business from her family house at Faleula fou to help earn enough to put her child through school and build a stable future for herself. Her designs include the modern aspects of a puletasi Samoa’s traditional wear. Because of this skill Dinna’s designs are in high demand.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment to build permanent housing for her business

loans.name: Wendy Patricia

texts.en:
I sell cosmetics, perfume and clothing. I have been in business four years. With the income I earn I can help support my family. I run the business out of my home, selling to people who work in offices.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Yo me dedico a la venta de comesticos , perfumes y ropa. este negocio lo tengo hace 4 años. Con los ingresos de venta le ayudo a mi familia. el negocio lo tengo en mi casa. Mis clientas son personas que trabajan en oficina.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
With a house under construction and all but finished, Yola Bertha M. de Quispe has a sales stall on John Paul II Avenue in the city of El Alto. She tends to her stall only on market days (Thursdays and Sundays). With her husband and 3 children, Yola is working to get ahead through the preparation and sales of typical Bolivian dishes. Her objective is to earn enough capital to be able to rent premises where she can establish a restaurant. She plans to serve lunches during the day and fast food in the evenings.

Yola has been a Pro Mujer partner for almost 2 years. During that time she has been able to invest in her food stand and substantially improve her menu, and with the improved menu, her clientele and profitability.

Yola needs capital with which to invest in improvements to her sales stand. With the rainy season upon her, she needs to improve the stand so that inclement weather will not prevent her from working. If she is able to work in all types of weather, she will be able to open her fast food restaurant sooner.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Con una casa en construcción, a punto de culminar la obra fina, la señora Yola Bertha M. de Quispe, tiene un puesto de venta de comida en la Avenida Juan Pablo II en la ciudad de El Alto, mismo que atiende solo los días de feria (jueves y domingo). En compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos, intenta progresar mediante la preparación y venta de platos típicos de la gastronomía nacional, con el firme objetivo de lograr reunir una cantidad de dinero que le permita tomar un alquiler y establecer un snack para la atención diaria de almuerzos, y por las noches la venta de comida rápida.

Son casi dos años que la señora Yola es socia de Pro Mujer, antigüedad que le permitió invertir en su puesto de comida y mejorar sustancialmente el menú ofertado y de forma inherente su clientela y rentabilidad.

Yola necesita de capital para realizar una nueva inversión en su puesto de comida, principalmente en la actual época de lluvia, para brindar la comodidad necesaria a sus comensales, de esta manera no perjudicar su trabajo por las inclemencias del tiempo, lo que le permitirá más prontamente la apertura de su restaurante de comida rápida.

loans.use: Yola needs capital in order to make a new investment in her sales stall. With the rainy season upon her, she needs to make improvements so that her work will not be threatened by bad weather. This will allow her to reach her objective and establish a fast food restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more electronic accessories, belts and men's hats

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa lives with her beloved husband and her only son. She supports herself by selling regional food on a corner near her house, which is in a highly trafficked area. Over time, she began offering a wider variety of food, which was eagerly accepted by the public; once she acquired a good number of clients, she moved from her small stand to her house since she could count on a better atmosphere for working comfortably there. Although they have detected a mental illness, she has continued to work hard, along with support from her husband, who is in charge of preparing the meals, and her son, who helps to make sure his mother recovers quickly. She needs to acquire ingredients to make the dishes that have become the family’s main source of income and sustenance. For this reason they are requesting this loan and appealing to your sense of collaboration to help keep the work going that sustains them all.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa vive en compañía de su querido esposo y su único hijo, la venta de comida se remonta a cuando ella se decidió a vender en la esquina de su casa comida regional debido a que la zona que habita es muy transitable.Con el transcurso del tiempo empezó a ofrecer variedad de platos con la gustosa aceptación de su público; cuando consiguió buen número de clientes optó por el traslado de su pequeño centro de ventas a su casa debido a que contaba con el ambiente necesario para poder trabajar con comodidad en el.A pesar de que le habían detectado una enfermedad emotiva siguió trabajando como siempre con la ayuda de su esposo que es quién se encarga de preparar las comidas, recibiendo también el apoyo de su hijo que coopera con el trabajo a fin de que su querida madre se recupere pronto.Necesita adquirir insumos para la preparación de las comidas que se ha convertido en la fuente principal de ingresos y sustento familiar. A razón de este hecho solicita un préstamo y apela a vuestro espíritu colaborador para seguir trabajando en beneficio de los suyos

loans.use: Purchase and stock of ingredients for making food

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en: Adamsay T. is 25 years old and married with 2 children.  Her husband provides transport service to the community within Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  Adamsay sells vegetables and palm oil to meet some of the family expenses.  SMT’s aim is to provide small loans to people like Adamsay for income generation so that they can improve their family’s economic status.  With her previous loan, Adamsay diversified her business to include palm oil.  She is requesting a second loan to continue diversifying her business.

loans.use: to continue diversifying her business

loans.name: Ambarniso

texts.en:
I. Ambarniso is 39 years old. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Together they are raising three children.

Ambarniso is selling clothes for kids in the central local market. She has been in this business for more then 10 years. Her business is very stable, which allows her to improve the level of living of her family. The income from her business allowed her to repair her house.

She has been the client of IMON for about 6 years. For this period of time she has shown herself to be a very accurate client with positive credit history. Today Ambarniso requests 3,400.00 Somoni ($1000 US) for purchasing new kids' clothes to sell. She thanks everybody who is supporting her and shall pay the loan in 5 months.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothes for kids

loans.name: Juliana Dorotea

texts.es:
Juliana E. is a struggling, hard-working woman. She fulfills her role selling groceries and general merchandise in the Chinandega market. Thirty-two years ago, she couldn’t find work anywhere due to the difficult economic situation, and she decided to invest her meager savings in purchasing general goods to sell them.

Her work is very rough since, although she lives in Chinandega, her business is very far from her home. So every day she has to start very early waiting for a bus that will take her to the market where she has her business.

All her efforts are for the benefit of her family, as she is a wife and mother of one small boy.

For three years she has been a loyal client of CEPRODEL, earning loans that she has used to stock more products, in this way helping care for her nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Juliana E. es una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes y productos de pulpería en el mercado de Chinandega. Desde hace 32 años por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de pulpería para venderlos.

Su actividad es muy agitada ya que a pesar que vive en Chinandega, su negocio está muy alejado de su hogar por lo que desde muy temprano todos los días espera un bus que lo lleve al mercado donde tiene su negocio. Todos estos esfuerzos los realiza con el único propósito de mantener a su familia ya que es esposa y madre de un hijo pequeño.

Desde hace 3 años ha sido una fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir más sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Kampongsvay Ler I Group

texts.en: This is a group loan that will be shared among 19 members of the Kampongsvay Ler I Village Bank. Mrs Yeang S., 58, is a farmer and pig seller and also the Village Bank president. She is married with one married child. She and the Village Bank would like to request a loan of $2725 in order to buy pigs to sell on a daily basis.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to sell.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Mr. Boubacar D. is a fashion designer originally from Guinea; he is established in Ziguinchor, where he does business that is highly valued by his customers, especially women; he is requesting a loan to modernize his sewing machine and to buy various supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mr Boubacar D. est un couturier d' origine guineenne ; il est etabli a Ziguinchor ou il mene des activites tres appreciees par sa clientele , surtout les femmes ; il sollicite un credit pour moderniser sa machine a coudre et acheter des fournitures diverses .

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and various furnishings

loans.name: Nyagu Maah

texts.en:
Born on January 25, 1954, Pa Nyagu S. is a widower who was married to Ma Angwi Grace. Before her death they were blessed with seven children, two of whom are still below the age of fifteen years. Pa S. and his family live in a seven-room apartment in the Berejei neighborhood of Bome.

Due to circumstances beyond his control he didn't have the privilege of a basic education. His parents where poor, and worst of all they died when he was still very young because of the lack of money for medication. Motivated by the need to provide for his family and the untimely death of the wife, he joined GHAPE in 2005. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid two loans and used the profit to provide for his family and pay his children's school fees.

Given a loan, he plans to buy piglets, feed, rice, soap, and fish so that his neighbors won't have to travel so far to obtain these basic items. He will use the profits to continue to educate his children and reinvest in his business. He thinks his business will succeed because he is an experienced entrepreneur.

He plans to repay his loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets , feed , rice, soap, and salt.

loans.name: Zelmira

texts.es:
Zelmira is very optimistic about working, which is why she decided to utilize a very important appliance in her home to start a business: her washing machine. She has been offering laundry services to her neighbors and acquaintances for 3 years. She mentions that she started out almost in jest, but now, it is a great relief since this business generates the income needed for her to get ahead. She is requesting a loan in order to give the last payment on her newly acquired washing machine. Help Zelmira keep moving forward with her efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Zelmira, tiene mucho optimismo para trabajar es por ello que decidió utilizar un instrumento importante que tiene en su casa para emprender su negocio, su lavadora. Es por ello que desde hace 3 años ella ofrece sus servicios de lavado a sus vecinos y conocidos, nos menciona que comenzó esto como jugando y ahora es un gran alivio ya que esta actividad en la actualidad le genera los ingresos necesarios para que ella pueda seguir adelante. Solicita un préstamo para pagar la última letra de la lavadora nueva que adquirió. Apoya a Zelmira a seguir adelante con sus esfuerzos.

loans.use: Finish paying off washing machine for business

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida belongs to “La Primavera” (The Spring) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Moyobamba. Her business is located in MZ B Lt. 3 La Primavera. Zoraida is a cosmetician and also sells beauty products in the beauty salon where she provides services to her friends and other clients. She decided to start her own business to generate her own income and grow as a person and professionally.

The $350 USD (S/.1,000) loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be used to improve the beauty salon, purchase equipment to work with; such as mirrors, professional hair dryer, professional hair cutting and styling tools, as well as wholesale beauty products (Placenta Life brand), which is her bestselling brand and the one she uses in the beauty salon.

She is 36 years old and has 3 children; she is happy with what she does and satisfied with her achievements, her clientele keeps increasing and her goal is to complement this activity with another: selling shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoraida pertenece al Banco comunal ” LA PRIMAVERA”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia Moyobamba, distrito D. Moyobamba, su negocio está ubicado en el AA.HH. La Primavera MZ B Lt 3, ella presta sus servicios como cosmetóloga, la cual complementa con la venta D. productos D. belleza, en su salón D. estética en donD. atienD. a sus amigas (os) y demás clientes que acuden a diario. Decidió iniciar su propio negocio para generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y profesionalmente.

El préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, mejoró su local, comprando materiales e instrumentos D. trabajo y equipos necesarios como espejos, cortadora y secadora D. cabello profesional, también compró productos D. belleza al por mayor (producto Placenta Life) que es la línea que mas venD. y usa para atender a sus clientas.

Tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, está contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos, hasta la fecha su clientela ha aumentado, su meta es llegar a implementar su actividad económica con otra que es la venta D. zapatos.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for beauty salon and wholesale beauty products.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 28 years. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 3. She became a rice seller in 2006. Helena works from 8am to 11:30pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.

Helena hopes this loan can help her buy more rice for her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela tiene 53 años, tiene 2 hijos que cursan estudios universitarios,  es madre soltera, pero no hay dificultad para salir adelante, nos menciona.
¿Qué hace?	Ella se dedica a vender sábanas, ropa para niños y adultos, lleva en este trabajo 3 años y le va muy bien, lleva a vender sus prendas por los distintos lugares de Pucallpa, dejándolos al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que intercambia ideas y socializa más, lo más importante es que mediante él, está pagando los estudios de sus hijos, que pronto serán profesionales. 
Ella quiere alquilar un local para la venta de sus productos, así dejar de caminar y tener una labor más tranquila.
texts.en:
Rafaela is 53 and has two sons in university, and although she is a single mother, she is having no trouble progressing in life. She has been selling sheets and adult and children’s clothing for three years, and it is going well. She sells her goods in various places in Pucallpa for cash or on credit. The thing Rafaela likes about her work is discussing ideas and socializing with others, but the most important aspect is the fact that she can pay for her son’s education. They will soon be professionals. She wants to rent premises to sell her products so that she does not have to move around. Then her work will be more peaceful.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renting premises to sell her products

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra y de esta manera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que el dinero que ganaba a veces no le alcanzaba y se desesperaba mucho, fue por eso que decidió dedicarse a una actividad en la que pudiera ganar dinero y al mismo tiempo cuidar a sus hijos. Comenzó en el mes de Marzo de 2003, vendiendo tortas en una mesita que acondicionó para poder elaborar las torta, el pan y la carne la calentaba en la estufa de su casa, pero poco a poco le empezó a ir mejor y pudo comprar un carrito tortero en buenas condiciones el cual ubicó en el frente de su casa así como unas mesitas y sillas para que sus clientes pudieran comerse las tortas ahí de manera cómoda. Con su anterior crédito en KIVA pudo comprar ingredientes para seguir elaborando sus tortas y por sugerencia de unas personas ahora también elabora tacos y le ha ido mejor.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de sus tortas y tacos que le permitan brindar una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen started the business due to the need to earn extra income and in this way help her husband with household expenses. Because the money he was making wasn't enough, he would often become desperate. Because of this she decided to work doing anything she could to make money while at the same time take care of her children. She started in March 2003 selling sandwiches from a table that she designed to use to make them. The bread and meat were warmed on the stove in her home but little by little things started going well and she was able to buy a sandwich cart that was in good condition that she put in front of her home in addition to a small table and chairs so that her clients could be more comfortable while they ate their sandwiches.

With her previous credit from Kiva she was able to buy ingredients needed to make the sandwiches and due to the suggestion of several people she now also makes tacos and business has improved.

She needs a loan for US$750 that she will repay in six months to buy ingredients to make sandwiches and tacos so that she will be able to offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Hilda Isabel

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 38 años de edad, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en la Calle 5, MZ.G, Lote 6 s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de Omnilife y Herbalife y tiene sus productos en su domicilio. Trabaja haciendo pedidos de la ciudad de Lima y brinda sus productos a sus clientes de casa en casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, pagará para que le envíen los productos, entre ellos tenemos: 5 cajas de omnilife y 2 cajas de herbalife, para poder brindar a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poner un negocio de venta de ropa junto con sus dos hijos y con su esposo, el cual es docente y también ayuda a repartir los productos.
texts.en:
Hilda is 38 and a member of the community bank fighting women, in Yungay and lives on 5th St, Mz.G, lote 6, district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash.

She dedicates to the sell of Omnilife and Herbalife products and keeps the products at home. She takes orders and fills them in the city of Lima and then delivers to clients from house to house.

With this loan of $1000, to be repaid in eight months, she will pay for the shipment of products; five boxes of Omnilife, two boxes of Herbalife, to deliver to clients.

Her biggest dream is to start a business of clothing sales with her two children and husband, who teaches and also helps in the delivery of products.


Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the shipment of products she sells.

loans.name: Editha

texts.es:
Editha pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Editha tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Es profesora al igual que su esposo, aunque ella fundó un colegio particular y abrió una bodega en su casa, ubicada en Acobamba s/n frente a la capilla de Acobamaba. Afirma que ha crecido regularmente porque empezó su bodega con un préstamo que le brindaron de S/. 1,000. Actualmente tiene invertido en su pequeña bodega alrededor de siete mil a ocho mil soles, aunque encarga el negocio muchas veces a su madre por el escaso tiempo que dispone. Manifiesta que este negocio beneficia mucho a su familia porque cuando algo necesitan lo cogen de la bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de panteones porque ya está ingresando la temporada navideña. 

Editha afirma que le gustaría recibir talleres para mejorar tanto su vida personal como su negocio, aunque por ahora no tiene mucho tiempo disponible.
texts.en:
Editha belongs to the Mujeres al Progreso ("Women for Progress") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. She is 39 years old and partnered with 2 children. Like her husband, she's a teacher, but she started her own home-based school; she also opened a small grocery in her house in Acobamba, across from the Acobamba chapel. She says that the business has grown steadily since she started it with a S/.1,000 [1,000 Peruvian soles] loan. Edith has now invested about six- to eight-thousand soles in the business even though she's often entrusted it to her mother because she has so little time. She adds that the business has greatly helped her family because when they need something, they get it from the business.

With this S/.2,300 loan, to be repaid in 8 installments, Editha will buy "panetones" [a traditional fruitcake-like bread] for the upcoming Christmas season.

Editha says that she would like to attend workshops, as much to improve her personal life as her business, even though she doesn't have much spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy panetones [a traditional seasonal bread] for resale.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Madame H. Dédé est née en 1970 à Lomé. Couturière de profession, elle en fait sa principale activité. Mariée avec quatre (04) enfants a charge, elle arrive par son dynamisme à s’occuper des besoins de sa famille par les revenus tirés de son activité. Douée dans la confection des habits, elle exerce son métier avec des moyens matériels dérisoires. 
Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement afin d'aménager convenablement un atelier et s’acheter des machines à coudre. Cela lui permettra de satisfaire dans les délais ses clients et aussi améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Dédé H. was born in 1970 in Lomé. A dressmaker by profession, she has made it her principal line of work. Married and having four children to look after, she manages to take care of her family’s need through her dynamism and the income derived from her business. Though a talented maker of clothing, she practices her trade with pitiful equipment. To satisfy her customers better, she is requesting financing to fix up a workshop appropriately and to buy sewing machines. This will enable her to satisfy her customers on time and also to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up a workshop and to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra  R. con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio de venta de agua, jugos y bebidas en el mercado la terminal de la ciudad de León donde diariamente comercializa estos productos en conjunto con algunas verduras y frutas como lo son tomates y bananos pero en menores cantidades.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por el motivo de que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio el cual le es de mucho beneficio salir adelante en este y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
With much effort and dedication Mrs. Isidra R. has managed to move ahead in her business of selling water, juice, and drinks at the La Terminal market in the city of Leon where each day she markets these products along with some vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes and bananas but in smaller quantities. Now she is seeking the support of Ceprodel since she hopes that her loan will be approved so she can continue with her business. The loan is of great benefit to her to move ahead in the business and so continue with the maintenance of her home which requires so much of her support.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase water and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Lewis

texts.en: Lewis U. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. He has been in this business for a long time, and hopes to expand the business. Lewis is 54 years old and married with 2 children. He needs the loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Nguyên 62 tuổi, gia đình chị có hai con đã trưởng thành. đầu năm 2008 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu  tư vào  buôn bán hoa quả.  Hiện nay hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn hỗ trợ từ các con nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 7.000.000đ  để đầu tư mua thêm hoa quả về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi N. is 62 years old. Her family has two grown-up children. In early 2008, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to trade fruits. Currently, in addition to income from fruit trading, she receives financial support from her children, therefore the economic situation of her family is very stable. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND7,000,000 to buy more fruits to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Poultry raising
