loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es: Norma Alicia L. D. G. D. 39 años D. edad resiD. en Ilopango junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad y su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista D. transporte público. Norma es costurera, y realiza su trabajo en su casa, ella cose para personas D. la zona y se esfuerza mucho para poder entregar un excelente trabajo a sus clientes D. manera que estos sean fieles a ella. Norma solícita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima como hilos, agujas entre otros materiales para la costura. D. esta manera ella logra contribuir junto a su esposo para todos los gastos D. la familia, y a través D. este préstamo espera mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, ya que es por medio D. este trabajo por el cual pueD. solventar junto a su esposo todas las necesidades básicas del hogar.
texts.en:
Norma Alicia G. D. L. is 39 years old and resides in Ilopango along with her three young children and her husband who works as public transportation driver. Norma is a seamstress and does her work from home. She sews for people in her neighborhood and tries hard to be able to deliver an excellent job to her clients so that they remain loyal customers. Norma is requesting a loan so that she can buy materials such as thread and needles and other materials for sewing. This way she is able to contribute, along with her husband, to the family expenses. Through this loan she hopes to improve her business and increase her sales since it is through this work that she and her husband can pay for the basic needs of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor quedó viuda a los 45 años, y tiene la responsabilidad de velar por su pequeña hija a quien trata de darle las mejores condiciones de vida con el apoyo que recibe de sus padres, quienes le brindaron un lugar donde vivir. Ahora está empeñada en convertir su tienda en una librería para los escolares de la zona, donde puedan conseguir los materiales educativos que necesiten, pero por ahora está trabajando duramente en su negocio y acaba de instalar un teléfono público que la ayuda atraer a las personas a su tienda y hacerse conocida dentro de su localidad. Su problema es el costo del alquiler del local donde está instalada hace 4 años, pues su deseo es seguir creciendo con miras a conseguir  una casa propia y trasladar su negocio. Mientras tanto seguirá trabajando como siempre atendiendo a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad, brindándoles los productos necesarios en cualquier momento del día, pues su negocio está a disponibilidad del cliente desde las siete de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y espera que su permanencia dentro de su grupo sea de gran provecho. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio de nuevos y necesarios productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leonor, a widow at 45, is responsible for watching over her small daughter. With help from her parents, who give her a place to live, Leonar tries to give her daughter the best living conditions. She is determined to convert her store into a book store so the school children of the zone can find all the educational materials they need. For now she is working hard in her business. She just finished having a public telephone installed, and that will help her attract people to her store. It will also make her known in the area. Her problem is the rental cost of her business location, which she has been in for 4 years. Meanwhile, she will keep working, like always, to kindly tend to her customers and offer them what they need at all times. Her business is open from seven in the morning until ten at night. This is her first loan with MFP. She hopes that staying in the group will be very beneficial. She will use the money to buy merchandise to stock her business with new and needed products for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila L. is a resident of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married, with six children studying at different levels.

She is a good member of Paglaum Cooperative. She is requesting a loan amounting to Php5,000.00 and intends to buy fertilizer and pesticides for corn production.

Cerila is thankful to Paglaum micro-finance for their programs and services that help poor people while encouraging them to work hard for their future. She aspires to be able to give their children a good education and future.

loans.use: Purchase corn fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Fytila

texts.fr:
K. Fytila est né le 17 Octobre 1972 à Porto Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Fytila est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. Fytila réside avec sa famille dans Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. 
Fytila est un mécanicien vélomoteur. 

Malgré la passion que Fytila a pour son métier, Fytila ne dispose pas assez de moyens financiers pour équiper son atelier de mécanique en vue d’offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle. Fytila sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé pour y arriver et aussi pour faire plus de revenu capable de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
K. Fytila was born on October 17, 1972 in Porto Novo, administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Fytila is married and the father of two children, of whom only one is enrolled in school. Fytila lives with his family in the Township of Akpro Missérété in the Department of the Ouémé. He is a bicycle repairman.

In spite of the enthusiasm Fytila has for his job, he does not have enough capital to equip his workshop so that he can offer better services to his clientele. Fytila is requesting a loan from ALIDé to manage this and also so that he do better at making a living and catering for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of equipment for repairing bicycles

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: For Dilorom the most important thing is the well-being of her family. Through her work, she tries to cover their expenses and give them peace. Dilorom dedicates herself to the production of vegetables, especially potatoes. Although her work is very hard and tiring because of the strong sun, she knows that she is being rewarded with the love and smiles of her children. Without a doubt, her labor makes her feel useful as she helps her husband sustain their family - they both make an effort to succeed and do their best at their jobs. The difficulties that they face now come from a lack of money to acquire the necessary fertilizer for their cultivated lands. For this reason they request this loan. To better themselves and to increase their production, a quality fertilizer will produce quality vegetables. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Raquel Francisca

texts.es: Raquel Francisca O. M. tiene 29 años. A pesar de su corta edad Raquel es una joven muy luchadora cada día se levanta, muy temprano para encargarse de sus 2 hijos. Y además de cuidar a sus hijos tiene que hacerse cargo de su negocio. Raquel inicio este negocio por su Papa por que anteriormente él era el dueño, pero dada las circunstancias de la vida, su Papa falleció entregándole únicamente este humilde negocio, para que ella se hiciera cargo. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrenta ya que no tiene ayuda para la elaboración del pan. Por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como azúcar, harina, huevos y mantenimiento del horno. Su mayor sueño es que su negocio sea mucho mas estable.
texts.en:
Raquel Francisca O. M. is 29 years old. In spite of her young age, Raquel is a fighter. She gets up very early every day to take care of her two children. And, in addition to taking care of her children she has to take care of her business. Raquel started working in this business because her father used to own it, but due to life circumstances, her father passed on. He left her only this humble business which she now takes care of, in spite of the difficulties she faces, since she does not have help making bread.

She is applying for this loan for capital to use to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, and eggs, and for the upkeep of her oven. Her greatest dream is that her business be much more stable.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Belcka Marilyn

texts.es:
La señora Belcka Marilyn, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años y es madre de 01 y uno que ya viene en camino y dependen de ella.  

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su esposo emprendió su  negocio de crianza y venta de ganados vacuno y porcino que los ofrece a sus clientes,  con  el carisma y la buena atención que le caracteriza. 

El corral especialmente construido para la crianza de los ganados se encuentra en la huerta de su propia casa, a donde acuden sus principales clientes que son los “carniceros” que tienen sus puestos de venta de carnes en el mercado de la ciudad. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará 03 ganados vacuno para criarlos y luego venderlos.

Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Belcka Marilyn is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes), which is located in the District of Bellavista, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of one dependent child.

Given the need to contribute to the household income, Sra. Belcka was encouraged by her husband to start a business raising and selling cattle and pigs. Her customers know her for her charisma and attentiveness.

She constructed a corral specifically for raising cattle in the field outside of her home. Her main customers are butchers who have their own meat vending stalls at the city market. With her loan of 1000 soles, she will buy 3 heads of beef cattle that she will raise for future sale.

Sra. Belcka is happy with the service offered by Manuela Ramos. She is thankful that the institution supports women like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes to continue her membership for a long time so that she can help other women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 heads of cattle

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre María Auxiliadora, se conformó en fecha 03 de agosto del 2006, gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. María Ana A., quien se dedica a la venta de pollos y panificados, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
 Una vez asesorada acerca del programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 11º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 
Durante todo el transcurso de estos ciclos han demostrado un excelente cumplimiento de pago, las mismas gracias al apoyo crediticio recibido con este programa han logrado sobresalir grandemente en cada una de sus actividades, han demostrado una vez mas que las mujeres son pilares esenciales dentro de una familia y que las mismas también pueden superarse cada día mas.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de  905.882 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.) venta de ropas, venta de plantas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de perfumes, venta de productos Avon, venta de pollos y panificados, etc. 
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias como: arroz, azúcar, yerba, lácteos, panificados, gaseosas, etc., ropas , artículos para la mercería, compra de lencerías, ,compra de frutas y verduras, compra de perfumes, compra de plantas, compra de productos Avon, compra de pollos e ingredientes para la elaboración de panificados, etc.

loans.name: Flora Cirila

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Flora es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Flora viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas, abarrotes y D. las ferias compra cereales, animales, productos que comercializa en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Flora necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa.
Los sueños D. Flora son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, mejorar sus negocios y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Alianza Microfinance Institute.

Flora is a 48-year-old married mother with 5 children. She travels to several different markets throughout her region to sell fruits, vegetables, and provisions. At those markets, she purchases grains, animals, and other products, which she then sells at the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Flora needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing potatoes.

She hopes that her children will complete their studies, that her businesses will improve, and that she will be able to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools for his work

loans.name: Maria Beneranda

texts.es:
María Beneranda M. I.  es socia del Banco Comunal Everes, vive en la comunidad  de Pueblo Nuevo  en la provincia de Manabí en la costa ecuatoriana, este sector se caracteriza por ser netamente agrícola.

María lleva treinta años de casada, tiene cuatro hijos todos casados ella junto a su esposo se dedican  a la agricultura  siembran maíz, maní y yuca, siendo la mejor época el mes de enero porque empieza la temporada invernal favoreciendo a los cultivos.

El préstamo solicitado en  esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de úrea y líquidos para combatir la maleza y plagas que atacan los sembríos así como para cancelar a los jornaleros  que le ayudan a sembrar su tierra.
texts.en:
María Beneranda M. I. is a member of the Everes Communal Bank. She lives in the Pueblo Nuevo community in the Manabí province, which is on the Ecuadorian coast. This area is known for its agriculture. María has been married for 30 years, and she has four children who are all married. She and her husband are farmers. They plant corn, peanuts, and yucca. The best time to plant is January because that is when the winter season that favors these crops starts. The loan is to buy urea and liquids to combat the weeds and pests that attack the crops. This way they will not need the workers to help them with their fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy urea and fertilizers to fight the pests on their crops

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita Q. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Nenita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: True Go Last Group

texts.en:
These are members of the True Go Last group. They are small-scale business people in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods to their stalls, making more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Abdul A. G. (second from left). Abdul was born in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has two children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are still not of school-going age. Abdul manufactures mattresses out of grass. He has been producing mattresses for the local community for more than ten years now. With this loan, he will buy bags (empty rice bags into which the grass is inserted to make the mattresses). He will sell some of the bags and use some to produce more mattresses for sale.

loans.use: Buy working materials like empty rice bags

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
46-year-old Alejandra does farming for a living. She lives with her husband and their six children. Her oldest is 17 years old and one of her goals is to give her children a proper education. She stays strong despite the hard work required on her farm. Her farm needs additional capital.

Alejandra joined CEVI to gain access to loan opportunities. She is now requesting PHP9,000. She will use this loan to finance her farm. This loan will help Alejandra save for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Jesus Antonia

texts.es:
La señora  JESÚS ANTONIA M. R. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria, refiere que dejò los estudios por falta de recursos económicos. Es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. 
Jesús se dedica a la atenciòn de su bodega que tiene en su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, aceite, fideos, menestras, etc. para surtir su tienda.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos alimenticios para su bodega como: arroz, golosinas, leche, gaseosas, cerveza,  fideos, menestras, etc. 
Ella sueña con ir ampliando su tienda y aumentaar sus ventas y ganancias, ya que necesita generar mayores ingresos para la familia y en especial para educar a sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. JESÚS ANTONIA M. R. is 35 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the community bank Esperanza del Mañana. This bank member completed her third year of high school and tells us that she had to quit her studies because of a lack of money. She is married and has five children who depend on her financially. Jesús makes her living thanks to the store she has set up in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk, candy, oil, noodles, soups and so on in order to stock her store. She now needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to buy foodstuffs for her store such as rice, candy, milk, pop, beer, noodles, soups etc. She dreams of expanding her store and increasing her sales and profits as she now needs to make more income to support her family and especially to educate her five children.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, candy, milk, pop, beer, noodles, soups, etc.

loans.name: Sokchamroeun

texts.en:
Miss SokChamroeun P., 20, is single and lives with her widowed mother and brother on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother has been selling groceries in front of her house since 1982.  

SokChamroeun is a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her aunt. She is asking for her first loan of $200 to purchase additional grocery items for her mother to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for her mother to sell

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en:
Thaong P., 30, has a business making and selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province to earn approximately US$ 3 each day. Broom are made from a kind of tall grass which grows in the forest. She learned how to make brooms from her neighbors and they started doing that business back in 2005. She told a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around US$ 30 on food and US$ 5 on utilities.

Thaong P. is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a motorbike to transport her brooms to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mame Penda

texts.fr: Mame Penda D. est âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Depuis 2 ans elle est membre de banc villageois. Elle fait de l'import, sa marchandise composée essentiellement de vêtements et d'ustensiles de cuisine est en provenance de Dubaï. Elle cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et à assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mame Penda D. is 55-years-old, married and mother of five children. She has been a member of the local « Banc Villageois » loan group for two years. She imports goods from Dubai, mainly clothing and kitchen utensils. She strives to improve her family’s living conditions and provide schooling for her children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Asunmo

texts.en:
A. is 38 years old and married with a child. She runs her business in Lagos and her family lives together in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, foodstuffs, provisions and frozen food to her customers  in order to make a living. 

She wishes to expand her business and meet the needs of her customers and meet her family's basic needs. A. hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to invest in her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 47-year-old married man and is the breadwinner in the family. He is employed as a teacher and also operates a hardware and motorcycle spare-parts shop. He has been running the business for four years.

Daniel is a member of Faulu Kenya and he wants to take a loan of Kes 20,000. He plans to buy shelves and more spare parts. He is positive about his business and he is aiming to succeed. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase shelves and more spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more alcoholic beverage inventory

loans.name: Tomato Group

texts.en:
Hamisi C., age 33, is married with four children, ages 13, 11, 5 and 2 years old.  He has had a brick business in three different places since 1997. He works from 6 am to 7 pm daily and he is able to earn a monthly profit of about $294.

This will be Hamisi’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the first loan to open a bricks shop in Chanika. He hopes for a loan to increase good stock in all three locations. 

Hamisi will share this loan with his group, Tomato, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Hamisi is first from the right in the last row.

loans.use: To increase stock in the three places where he sells his bricks

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is married to a sugarcane seller in Nalukongo. They have five children and only one is in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a one-room house where she stays with four people. She works with her husband in sugarcane and she also sells timber. She incurs transport costs to and from buying sugarcane from the villages. She uses public transport and goes shopping once a week. Teopista's business challenges include transportation of sugarcane from the villages to her stall, defaulters and the rainy season, which makes roads impassable. She sells at both retail and wholesale. Teopista joined MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital base and because MCDT was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more sugarcane and invest partly in timber. She aspires to see her business grow big and start supplying different customers.

loans.use: To buy more sugarcane and timber

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en:
Marionito A. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marionito owns and operates a business providing tricycle transport services. Marionito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Marionito joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marionito is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an engine. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an engine

loans.name: Gladys Estela

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Estela S. Q., es joven soltera de 27 años de edad, que habita en el barrio El Rodeo, es agricultora, y fue gracias al apoyo de su padre que le enseño los menesteres de esta actividad y de esta manera ganarse el sustento diario.

Dentro de los planes principales que tiene para su finca, esta la construcción de una pila receptora de agua que le permita almacenar para los días en donde no abastece el vital liquido en la región y no afecte sus cultivos,ni su vida cotidiana, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, que permitan un mantenimiento a los terrenos y la garantía de una mejor producción, que aumente los volúmenes de venta y permita la inversión para la cimentación de la pila de agua y el mejoramiento continuo de sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys Estela S. Q. is a young, single 27-year old, who lives in the El Rodeo neighborhood. She is a farmer and, thanks to her father who taught her the tasks related to this activity, she earns her daily living in this manner. Among the primary plans she has for her farm is the construction of a water tank. This would allow her to store this vital liquid for use on her crops when there is not enough of it in her region so that her harvests, and her daily sustenance, won’t be negatively affected. She requests the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides that would allow her to maintain her lands and guarantee a higher level of production from her crops. This would increase the volume of her sales, allowing her to invest in a base for the water tank and the continued improvement of her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Gloria Adela

texts.es:
La señora Gloria vive en la Sequita,  localidad de Montecristi prospero cantón manabita,  gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, Gloria se dedica a la venta informal de productos de belleza como  perfumes y otros artículos de Yanbal.

La señora Gloria está casada, lleva 5 años formando parte del banco comunal,  tiene 5 hijos, 4 mayores solo uno de ellos vive con ella, el esposo trabaja en una fábrica de pescado en la ciudad de Manta. Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de productos  Yanbal, atreves de catálogo.

  El dinero que está solicitando a la fundación podrá invertir todo en comprar los productos, a su clientes les brinda la facilidad de pagos dejándoles a créditos en dos o tres cuotas por mes, una vez que reúne la inversión sigue con mas pedidos, vende por el sector donde vive y en el puerto de Manta, con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo en sus productos, tiene varios pedidos por el mes del padre.

Nuestra socia esta conforme con su negocio, sueña con seguir ayudando a sus hijos, ya que sus  hijos estudian y quiere que sigan adelante, ella y su familia viven  en una casa propia que también aspira algún día poder adecuarla mejor.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in La Sequita, Montecristi, part of the prosperous Manabí canton whose residents are hard-working and proud of their roots. She sells Yanbal brand beauty products. Gloria is married and has five children, four of whom are independent adults and one who still lives with her. Her husband works for a fish processing plant in Manta. She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and she sells Yanbal catalogue products. She will use the requested funds to buy stock merchandise. She offers her customers credit charging easy payments two or three times a month. Once she earns back her investment she can proceed with more orders. She sells in her own neighborhood and in the port of Manta. She will use the entire loan amount to buy merchandise because she has several pending orders for Father’s Day. She is satisfied with her business and dreams with continuing to support her children since they are studying and she wants them to continue moving forward. She and her family live in their own home which she hopes someday to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap S. is 41 years old and lives in Pnov village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Doeun S., are farmers who own 3.50-hectare of land which they use to cultivate rice. In addition to being farmers, they are also duck breeders who are able to earn a small income to support their family. 

For their farm and duck breeding businesses, Mrs. Sopheap S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and duck food. This couple has four children; one is a duck breeder, two are students and one stays at home. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, duck food

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man and father of two school-age children. He has owned a furniture painting shop for the past 27 years. He has a lot of experience in this occupation. He paints all types of furniture. He is the main provider and he works hard to satisfy the demands of his family and its heavy expenses. He cooperates with some galleries and makes paintings for their furniture and he gains his own profit from it, in addition to painting used furniture upon the request of clients. He is thankful for his business income over the years. And in order to continue expanding his business, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a new painting compressor. And with the help of the loan, he will be able to take more project orders. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro- and small-business entrepreneurs and to the working poor to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Buy a new painting compressor

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia M. is 55 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Malia has 1 year of experience in this business.  Malia needs a loan of WST$1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Malia joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Malia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao V. (his wife is pictured here) is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. He has another partner in his wife, who cultivates a few crops on their own land in the village, from which she earns a living. 

The couple has four children, two of whom are married and live independently. The other two are single and work in the garment industry. 

Mao V. has been paying money for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, he is applying for a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle, which will allow him to commute to his work location.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to commute to his work location

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El Sr. Marcelino G. D. se dedica a la agricultura de granos tiene  cuarenta y un año de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para ayudarse en  la compra  de productos  para la siembra y este crédito lo está solicitando para el pago del arado del terreno donde va a sembrar todos estos crédito le han  beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelino G. D. is a farmer who has been growing grain for 41 years. He is married and has taken six loans with CEPRODEL. Each loan has helped him acquire the products for planting.

This loan he is requesting will be used to pay to have his land plowed and prepared for planting. All of his loans have been a great benefit since they have improved living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay to have his land plowed and prepared for planting

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr A. Koffi est un jeune homme très entreprenant né en 1979 à Vogan chef lieu de la préfecture de Vo. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Très entreprenant, il exerce comme activité l’exploitation d’un petit moulin à légumes fraîches dans le marché de sa localité. Sa clientèle, très nombreuse, est composée essentiellement de femmes et de ménagères. Il n’arrive pas avec le seul moulin à les satisfaire toutes. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement pour acquérir un nouveau moulin.
texts.en: Mr A. Koffi est un jeune homme très entreprenant né en 1979 à Vogan chef lieu de la préfecture de Vo. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Très entreprenant, il exerce comme activité l’exploitation d’un petit moulin à légumes fraîches dans le marché de sa localité. Sa clientèle, très nombreuse, est composée essentiellement de femmes et de ménagères. Il n’arrive pas avec le seul moulin à les satisfaire toutes. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement pour acquérir un nouveau moulin.

loans.use: exploitation d’un petit moulin à légumes fraîches

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim H. is 47 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sambath Chhorn (pictured with his wife), is 45 years old. They have been married since 1988 and have six children, one son and five daughters. One of her daughters is a garment factory worker, one assists her mother in her business and the others attend school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Two approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sim has been making porridge and Khmer noodles, or Num Banh Chok, to sell in her village for the past five years. Khmer noodles are considered the national dish of Cambodia and is served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumbers. Her husband has been a construction worker for three years; he also drives a motor taxi when he is free.

Sim is asking for a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more shoes and slippers

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es:
Luis López R. es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en el mercado Israel lewite de Managua de venta de frutas y verduras, tiene mas de 20 años de estar en el mercado, es una persona sencilla y de buenos principios morales.
Es padre de familia de  cuatro hijos y solo dos dependen de el y estos se encuentran en el colegio.
El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de frutas y verduras para incrementar su negocio.
Luis ha trabajado 12 préstamos con la institución y estos han sido para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
El trabaja de lunes a sábado de las 5 de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde.
texts.en:
Luis López R. is an enterprising person who has a business selling fruit and vegetables in the Israel Lewite market in Managua.  He has been in the market for over 20 years.  He is an unassuming person with good moral values.  He has four children.  Two of the children are dependent upon him, and they go to school.

He wants the loan to buy fruits and vegetables to increase his business.  Luis has had 12 loans with the institution.  The loans have been to buy merchandise for his business.

He works from five in the morning until four in the afternoon Monday through Saturday.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a Ugandan male who is 24 years old and married with one child. He owns a house and is a vanilla and coffee farmer. Edward also operates a retail shop of general merchandise. He has been in the business for three years. He started with an initial capital of 350,000/= but has managed to grow to 2,800,000/=.  The only challenge he has is lack of transport, however he has a plan to expand his business into a wholesale business. Edward intends to use the loan proceeds to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap to sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 30 años, vive con su madre y su hijo en casa de sus padres, ya que su esposo trabaja en otro país. Hace más de 6 años vende ropa, llevando a diversas zona de su ciudad, y cada 15 días viaja a la ciudad de Lima para conseguir la mercadería que previamente sus clientes le pidieron además que lleva también prendas con nuevos diseños. El gran gusto por la ropa y accesorios que compra le han dado ventaja ante los clientes, por eso no deja de vender. La ropa que vende generalmente es para niños, aunque también por ocasiones lleva chompas y casacas para personas adultas. Durante este tiempo de trabajo ha experimentado todo tipo de situaciones  favorables y desfavorables que la han enseñado a vender con éxito y afrontar las dificultades,  una de ellas fue la de conseguir un local estable en la ciudad de Lima, hoy vende su  mercadería sin dificultad alguna. En adelante desea mejorar su negocio con mayor variedad de ropa. Es el crédito número 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Irma is 30 years old and lives with her son in her parent's house because her husband works in another country. 

For more than six years, she has sold clothing in different areas of her city.  Every 15 days, she travels to the city of Lima to get the merchandise her customers ordered and also brings back new clothing.  Her taste in the clothing and accessories that she buys has given her an advantage with her customers, so she is always selling things.  The clothing she sells is usually for children, but she sometimes has sweaters and jackets for adults.  During this time, she has experimented with all types of favorable and unfavorable situations, that have taught her to sell successfully and confront difficulties.  One difficulty she faced was getting a store established in the city of Lima.  Today she sells her merchandise without difficulty.  In the future, she would like to improve her business and sell a larger variety of clothing.

This is her fifth credit with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being part of her community bank because all of the members are people who she knows, and they are responsible and supportive.  She thanks everyone who helps make this loan possible because it will be very useful in her business' progress.  

She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to stock her store

loans.name: Oscar Ubaldo

texts.es: El señor Oscar vive en alquiler con sus tres hijos quien solo dos dependen de el. El señor se dedica a la venta de libros ya bastante tiempo quien día a día trabaja muy duro para que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario, el va promocionando colegio por colegio los libros que vende, le va muy bien en la venta de libros también  deja a crédito y mejor si los vende al contado, solicito el crédito para comprar mas libros ya que tiene pedidos por los colegios. Es así como el trabaja y dio gracias a emprender y kiva por darle la mano ya que es el primer crédito que tiene.
texts.en: Mr. Oscar lives in a rental home with three children of which only two depend on him financially. He works selling books, which he has done for a long time, and everyday works very hard to make sure that his children have everything they need. Mr. Oscar goes school to school with his books and he does very well selling the books, he sells some of them on credit but he prefers to get the money upfront. He needs the loan to buy more books since he has orders from some schools. This is how Mr. Oscar works and is grateful to Emprender (Kiva’s field partner) and Kiva for giving him a hand since this will be his first loan.

loans.use: To buy books.

loans.name: Betty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Betty tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Caracucho, un zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, lugar caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población concentrada en pequeños caseríos dispersos, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Betty se dedica a trabajar como confeccionista de faldas, vestidos y blusas desde hace mas de dos años, cuenta con una máquina de coser en su vivienda donde trabaja constantemente para confeccionar las prendas de vestir que le solicita un comerciante que, a su vez, las vende en algunas ciudades de la sierra del país. Adicionalmente también ofrece en venta las prendas de vestir a sus vecinos. Esta actividad también le ayuda a sentirse activa, por lo que ella gusta mucho de la labor que realiza. Con las ganancias que ella percibe de esta actividad ayuda a sus padres a solventar la economía de su familia.

Betty desea ampliar la producción de su negocio, de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente comprar más material de modo que pueda lograr su objetivo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales pueda realizar esta acción.

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad ella pudo invertir el dinero de su préstamo en más material con lo cual pudo ampliar su producción y sus ventas y gracias a ello su negocio pudo tomar un impulso para desarrollarse. Ella agradece mucho a las personas que colaboraron con ella en aquella oportunidad y le desean todo tipo de parabienes.
texts.en: Betty is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the hamlet of Caracucho, a rural zone in the district of Mórrope. Mórrope district is characterized by having the majority of its population concentrated in small, scattered hamlets. The zone is part of Lambayeque province and is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Betty has worked for more than two years as a seamstress of skirts, dresses, and blouses. She has a sewing machine in her house where she works constantly making the garments requested by a merchant who then sells them in certain cities in the mountainous region of the country. She also offers her garments for sale to her neighbors. Her business makes her feel productive because she really enjoys the work she performs. She uses the income she earns to help her parents meet their family's economic needs. Betty would like to expand her production so that she can increase her sales and improve her earnings. In order to do this, she decided to request a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She has previously received a loan funded through Kiva, which was administered by Edpyme Alternativa through their "Capital Semilla" ["Seed Capital"] program. Thanks to that loan, she was able to expand her production and sales and her business had the momentum to develop. Betty is very thankful to the people who collaborated with her to provide that opportunity and she wishes them all the best.

loans.use: to buy more material to increase her production of clothing items

loans.name: Ntepapa Ole

texts.en:
Ntepapa Ole R. is 35 years old. He is married and blessed with five children. Ntepapa is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build rental houses. Ntepapa is a precise man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mrs. Nhoem Khema Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhoem K. is a weaver who earns some money to support her famiL., while her husband, Mr. Mala Soun, is a farmer. He owns a small piece of land and grows rice to support the famiL.. She is the mother of three children: one is a weaver and the others are still in school. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Nhoem K. wants to expand. She is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. 

This village bank is made up of 15 people from Chumrov village, Takeo province. Mrs. Nhoem K. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their famiL.'s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Felipe De Jesus G. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a pagar las protecciones de las puertas y ventabas, ya le elaboraron las protecciones esta en proceso de colocarlas. Ahora desea poner el piso de concreto al frente de su casa.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar la mejor, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que desea realizar a su vivienda. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fábrica en el área de producción, ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como mesera de un restaurante.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto es su esposa la señora Alma Janeth Rojas y su pequeño hijo del señor Felipe De Jesus G., ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita, y fue  imposible atendernos.
texts.en:
Felipe De Jesus G. is grateful for your assistance with the previous loan.  It helped him to pay for protections for the doors and windows.  He has already made the protections, and he is in the process of installing them.  Now he wishes to lay down a concrete floor in the front of his house.

He is requesting the loan to be able to buy the material and pay the person who will make the improvement.  At this time Felipe does not have the money needed to make this improvement at his house.  He plans on repaying the loan with the salary he receives from his work in production at a factory.

His wife takes care of the family expenses with the salary she gets as a waitress in a restaurant.

The people in the photo are his wife, Alma Janeth Rojas, and his young son, Felipe De Jesus G..  He was at work on the day of the visit, and it was not possible for him to be there for the photo.

loans.use: Concrete floor at the front of his house

loans.name: Migombani Group

texts.en:
Maria N., who is in her late thirties, is married with three children. She has been selling food and has a chicken business as well. She has been in these businesses for three years and works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily. She is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maria's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of her food and to start selling chicken. She has paid back her previous loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase the stock of her food business. Her dream is to expand her chicken business premises.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group Migombani, which has a total of 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Maria is wearing purple in front.

loans.use: To increase stock of food

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khun P. (in the photo with her loom) is a silk weaver. Her husband is a wooden house builder. The couple is elderly, but they are still strong enough to work. They live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Khun asked for a Kiva loan once before, she is now asking for another loan of $300 in order to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: to build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley wants a loan to purchase furniture for his restaurant. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for seven years .With the increasing demands of his family, Stanley realised his salary alone cannot sustain the family and he decided to set up a restaurant. However, he has a challenge of limited furniture as customers are increasing and his aspiration is to host at least 100 customers for a meal.  Stanley needs the loan in order to purchase furniture for his restuarant.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his restaurant

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel tiene 60 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad llamada El Consuelo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, esta casado, es padre de familia, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales tiene 3 a cargos, el es agricultor, lleva 40 años en esta actividad, hoy en día se dedica a la siembra de café y crianza de ganado. Empezó a la edad de 15 años de edad ayudando a su papa el estudiaba por la mañana y en las tardes laboraba con su papa estudio hasta cuarto grado de primaria debido a que sus padres eran muy pobres además eran 9 hermanos  a todos no se les podían pagar la escuela así que tuvo que ayudar a su papa a trabajar y llevar alimento a su hogar. A los 22 años decidió casarse le fue difícil pues tuvo que trabajar el doble de lo usual  durante 2 meses para poder comprar el vestido de novia de su esposa. Después su papa le  vendió un pedazo de tierra para que la trabajara  y así lo hizo conto con el apoyo de sus esposa después vendió ese pedazo de tierra para comprar un terreno mas grande y sembró café y también crio ganado así fueron sobreviviendo hasta el día de hoy el y su familia. El espera comercializar su producto directamente con compradores en Estados Unidos. 
El solicito el préstamo para mantenimiento de 2.5 manzana de café, pago de mano de obra, compra de abono. Esto le ayudara a mantener en buenas condiciones su cosecha, obtener un mejor rendimiento en la producción de café. Tiene dentro su planes futuros comprar una  mas de tierra para siembra de café con un sistema tecnificado y tener una producción de café orgánico. Dentro de su meta próxima sembrar 3 manzanas de frijol y dos manzanas de maíz.
texts.en:
Manuel is 60 years old and a native of the community called El Consuelo (The Consolation), located in Pueblo Nuevo (New Town) in the municipality of Esteli. He is married and the father of a family with 8 children, of whom 3 are still in his charge. Manuel is a farmer with 40 years in this activity. Now he plants coffee and raises cattle.

At the age of 15 he began helping his father. Manuel studied only to the 4th grade of primary school because his parents were very poor and he was one of 9 children. They couldn't pay for schooling for all the children, so he had to help his father to work and bring food to his home. At the age of 22, he decided to marry but it was difficult. He had to work twice as hard for 2 months to be able to afford a wedding dress for his wife. Then, his father sold him a small piece of land to work and he made it count, with the help of his wife. Later, he sold this piece of land to buy a larger plot and plant coffee, and also, raise cattle. Thus Manuel and his family have survived until the present. He hopes to sell his coffee directly to buyers in the United States.

Manuel requests a loan to maintain his 4.375 acres of coffee, to pay laborers, and to buy manure. This will help him to keep his harvest in good condition, and obtain a better production of coffee. He intends to buy more land in the future for planting coffee, using a highly technical system that will produce organic coffee. Among his short-term  goals is to sow 5.25 acres of beans and 3.5 acres of corn.

loans.use: TO FERTILIZE AND MAINTAIN 4.375 ACRES OF COFFEE TREES

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is part of 31-year-old Ou S.’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Sim Mari, is a blacksmith. He is good at making doors and windows. He usually earns an average of US$15 each day. Most of the income for her whole family relies on her husband’s business. 

Currently, Ou S.’s husband is running his business very well because he sells his items at a reasonable price. In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Ou S. is seeking a US$ 1200 loan for her husband to buy bigger amounts of iron in order to produce doors and windows to sell.

loans.use: to buy a bigger amount of iron to produce doors and windows to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta B. is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 82 years old. Vicenta is widowed and has four adult-aged children. She operates a specialized retail store buying and selling bananas and coconuts in the local community. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 1996, Vicenta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts. This loan will be her 15th loan from HSPFI.  

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is from the village of Bunawan, Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Riza runs a business venture in the Agriculture sector buying and selling coconut fruits in the local community. 

Riza has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities. Riza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. 

Riza is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP with which she will purchase more coconut fruit to sell as part of her business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Riza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut fruit to sell.

loans.name: Margaret Ayuma

texts.en: Margaret is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She comes from Huruma estate in Nairobi. Her business is at the estate, where she lives, in a busy market; her customers are passersby. Margaret wants to increase her stock and work hard to be able to educate her children. Her future dream is to have her own plot of land and her five-year plan is to own a permanent stall.

loans.use: increase her stock of blankets and bedsheets

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba comes from Vale, Samtskhe-Javakheti Region, in the southern part of Georgia. He is 36 years old, married and lives with his wife Ketevan, their 9- year-old son and 1-year-old daughter. Koba’s wife is a teacher in a local school. Koba is the head of the farming activities of the family, which is the main source of income for the family. Koba grows potatoes and cabbage on a family-owned plot. He takes the harvested vegetables to Tbilisi (capital city of the country) with his own minibus and sells them on the Tbilisi open market. The total average monthly income from sales amounts to 1000 Laris per month. 

With the requested credit, Koba plans to cover the costs of plot irrigation. He will pay the watering machine for this service. Unless he waters the plot, he won’t get a quality harvest and thus the planned income from the sales. Also, small part of the loan will be used for purchasing fertilizers for the plot. After fertilizing, the quality of the harvest will become even better and it will be sold for a better price. 

Profit received will be used for covering family daily expenses – purchasing quality food and household goods for family members.

loans.use: to pay for watering of agricultural plot  and fertilizers.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: This borrower is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She is now selling fruits and vegetables on the street. She wants to rent a shop and expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Sagynbubu

texts.en:
Sagynbubu is 54 and widowed. She lives with the family of her son and brings up two grandchildren. 

In order to add to their income, Sagynbubu’s family is engaged in cattle breeding. They started this activity with initial capital of 5,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) and now they have a farm with three milk cows and two heifers. In the summer season, they pasture their cattle in the mountainous areas with different types of herbal forage. 

Sagynbubu has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase cattle, which will allow her to increase milk-product sales. Sagynbubu’s family is very tight-knit and makes every effort to make their dreams of a prosperous future come true. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 7 children. 

Merlyn has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products like clothes, hair accessories & souvenirs. She has had this business for 12 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy t-shirts & blouses to sell.

Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts & blouses to sell.

loans.name: Altangul

texts.en: Mrs. Altangul is 24 years old and lives with her mother, sister, brother and younger sister in rental house in Darkhan-the second largest city in Mongolia. Her mother is retired, sister is a cook in a electric plant, brother works at construction by part time and younger sister studies at university. Just in this year she started a clothes selling business at market. But currently it is not running so successful and she needs to raise her business current asset. It’s very beneficial to her business and family income. Because she pays her younger sister’s school payment and house rental. She is planning to purchase more muchness clothes ever than she sells before. Therefore Altangul is taking a loan to purchase some casual clothes from Ereen-a border city of China for increase her business output.

loans.use: To purchase some casual clothes from Ereen-a border city of China for increase her business output.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
For the last three years, Anne has been selling charcoal in Karanjee area, in Limuru town. She is 36 years old and a single mother of three children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy 40 bags of charcoal.

In the future, she hopes to set up her own business premises for selling charcoal.

loans.use: to buy 40 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has 6 children. She sells panties and kenkey at Akotokyir, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is involved in farming. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in paying school fees and utility bills. Adjoa will use the loan to buy maize in bulk, to make kenkey to sell. Shown in the photo are corn dough and the maize she uses for the kenkey.

loans.use: to buy in bulk, maize to make kenkey (maize dumplings) to sell.

loans.name: Naftary

texts.en:
Naftary is a farmer in Muranga, Central Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years. He is aged 50 and married, with 4 children.  Three of the children are grown.  He currently employs two farmhands who help him in producing milk and tea for the local market.

Naftary has requested a loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He hopes to be able to increase his milk output to over 30 litres per day.  He says the dairy cow will help him meet his household needs and educate the children. 

He says the escalating cost of animal feeds remains the major challenge in farming.  He adds that farmers have a lot of help from Juhudi Kilmo loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Analy

texts.en: Analy is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Analy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ameer's Group

texts.en:
Ameer sells clothes in order to financially support her family. She purchases clothes at wholesale and sells at a profit to her community clients. She keeps herself updated about latest trends in fashion and makes reasonably good profits from her business.  Her husband has a motorbike rental business. He gives bikes to his clients on a rental basis and charges by the hour.  Ameer is the mother of 3 sons. One of them also sells clothes, while the other two are studying.  Besides her business, she also performs her household duties very well. Her family is very happy with her for her good management qualities. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her clothes business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk and of better quality.  That will allow her to offer more variety to her clients and to increase her profits.  She has been doing her business for the past 5 years and she is very confident about the success of her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ayimevo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIMEVO 1 est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Christine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Christine est âgée de 51 ans et est une veuve. Christine a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés, mais un reste encore à sa charge. Christine vit seule avec son enfant à charge. Christine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et subvenir aux besoins de son enfant, Christine mène une activité de vente de maïs dans son quartier, depuis une dizaine d'année. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Christine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Christine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIMEVO 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ayimevo 1 group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, whose name is Christine, is the lady who has her hand raised in the photo. It is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé with a view to increasing their business volume. 

Christine is 51 years old and a widow. She has two children who have both been to school but one remains in her care. She lives with her one dependant child. Christine did not go to school. In order to provide for her own needs and her child's, she has been selling rice in her neighborhood for the past ten years or so. With the aim of strengthening her activity and better responding to customer demand, Christine wants to increase her stock. In order to do this, she and the other members of the Ayimevo 1 group are requesting a third loan from Alidé. The first two loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Analia Group

texts.en:
Analia is the leader in their group, living at New Village, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur and in good health. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business. Analia and her members have had their businesses for many years, and they requested a loan of 8000 each. Analia will purchase more stock for her general store.

Analia and her group members have been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose cooperative for almost one (1) year. In the future, Analia and her group members hope that they can earn more than they want, to support with financial assistance their family's living.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida, 49, is married and has six children. She lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

She has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 3,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase stock to sell in her general store.

Leonida became a member of PMPC this year, 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her general store.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Muyazi

texts.en:
Muyazi is a married woman with six children who are all grown-ups. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of her family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Muyazi has operated a café for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of starting a livestock selling business.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase rice, beans and cooking oil for her café and also to buy livestock for her new livestock selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and cooking oil for her café and also to buy livestock for her new livestock selling business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and married to Lucy. They have five children.

John has been in the butchery business for the last two years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 19,000. He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan funds to buy stocks of sheep and goats for his butchery.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sheep and goats for butchery.

loans.name: Zenon Basilio

texts.es:
Zenon nació en la ciudad del Arequipa y tiene 32 años edad, él es soltero y no tiene hijos aun. Actualmente, Zenon vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco donde realiza sus actividades económicas.    
 
Zenon se dedica a la elaboración de estructura metálicas como por ejemplo puertas, ventanas otras cosas más.  Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Zenon requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo fierros, soldadura y otras cosas. 

Zenon es integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Zenon was born in the city of Arequipa and is 32 years old. He is single and does not yet have children. Zenon currently lives in the beautiful city of Cusco where he works.

Zenon works making metal structures such as doors, windows and other items. He has been working in this business for the past two years and he is doing well. Zenon needs this loan to purchase materials such as tools, welding items, etc.

He is a member of the Pillao Communal Bank which is comprised of 13 members living in the Province of Cusco and the District of San Jerónimo.

loans.use: to buy materials such as tools, welding items, etc.

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: Dora Isabel ha trabajado fuertemente para sacar adelante su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos y su esposo. Dora Isabel tiene su fuente de ingresos gracias a la venta de mercancía, actividad que lo hace esporádicamente y a la confección, que esta actividad es la que mayores ingresos le deja y la que mayor proyección augura. Dora Isabel aprendió la actividad de la confección gracias a su madre y a una hermana, y es con esta hermana con quién trabaja desde hace algún tiempo la confección a terceros. Dora Isabel afirma que la mejor temporada es la de principio de año ya que le asignan un mayor número de contratos en la confección de uniformes, y por esto debe aprovechar esta temporada. Dora Isabel quiere ofrecer mayores servicios a sus clientes, por lo que busca por medio de un préstamo la compra de una máquina plana. Espera que así se aumenten sus contratos y con ello sus ingresos, y poder así cumplir el sueño de expandir su negocio y empezar a confeccionar su línea propia. Dora Isabel aspira a dejarle a sus dos hijos una taller de confección posicionado que les permita tener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Dora Isabel is married with two children and has worked hard to get her family ahead.   She has two sources of income: selling merchandise, an activity she does sporadically, and tailoring.  The latter activity is the one that allows her to earn higher income and predict higher sales.  Dora Isabel learned tailoring from her mother and sister. She has worked with this sister for some time tailoring for third parties.  She states that the best season is the beginning of the year as they assign her a greater number of uniforms to make and she takes advantage of this season.  She wants to offer better services to her customers, so she is looking for a loan to buy a flat sewing machine.  She hopes to increase her contracts and therefore, her income so that she can fulfill her dream of expanding her business and making her own line of clothing.  Dora Isabel aspires to leave her two children a tailoring workshop positioned to allow them to have economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase a flat sewing machine for her tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Triunfadores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRIUNFADORES”; Este banco se ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clara tiene 48 años es casada y tiene 03 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de  venta de ropa, la socia viaja cada cierto tiempo al país de Bolivia para comprar su mercadería, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cuenta con un stand donde puede vender su mercadería como chompas el cual está ubicado por el centro de la ciudad, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al diseño grafico y al negocio de imprenta.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
